listing_jobDesc:
Azure Cloud Solution Engineer - DevOps


Salary Up to £75,000 | Remote | One of the UK's Leading Azure Partners


One of the UK's leading Azure Partners are looking for a talented Azure Cloud Solution Engineer DevOps to join a team of exceptional engineers tasked with implementing and managing customer solutions as part of our expanding Engineering Team. You will be required to contribute to the implementation of complex customer cloud solutions utilising Microsoft Azure best-in-class enterprise technologies.


If you’re passionate about the power of cloud technologies and have experience working in a mixed Engineering team, we are interested in hearing from you! We’re only interested in those who believe in the value and flexibility that hyperscale cloud technologies can bring to the mid-market and enterprise. If you’re looking for an exciting opportunity to be part of one of Microsoft’s top Azure partners in the UK, then we want to hear from you.


Why would you want to join this business?

You want to be at the forefront of cloud technology
You can learn from expert architects and engineers and those of the Microsoft engineering teams to deliver game-changing cloud solutions for customers.
You want to be part of an elite team
You have always wanted to be part of something exceptional; inspiring, the best, part of an award-winning team that people respect.
You want a relaxed but focused work environment
We are friendly and collaborative and we enjoy excitement and fun. But we’re also laser-focused on delivering on our promises to our customers.
We appreciate that everyone is different, and everyone has something unique to add to the team, and we try to provide modern and flexible approach to work as long as it doesn’t conflict with ability to deliver for customers.


The Technical Part:


Azure DevOps Pipeline Builds – You will work with CSAs to build Azure DevOps (ADO) deployment
pipelines to deploy complex Azure infrastructure templates incorporating all aspects of Azure IaaS
and PaaS technologies.
Cloud Solution Deployment Enablement– You will also be responsible for planning and executing
ADO pipeline implementation to enable solution deployments.
Engaging with PMs and CSAs to plan timescales for pipeline building and solution deployment.
ADO Pipeline Build Documentation – As part of the Cloud Engineering Team, you will be responsible for documenting both customer and internal ADO pipeline deployments.
Service Delivery Collaboration – As senior engineer you will work with the Cloud Operations Engineers (COEs) within the Service Delivery Team on complex


We are looking for someone with demonstrable technical competence in the following technologies:


Microsoft Azure - Deployment and Best Practices
DevOps – Azure DevOps Pipelines (including YAML)
Scripting – PowerShell or Command Line Scripting Experience
Identity – Active Directory and Azure Active Directory


While not essential, it'd be great if you also had:


Web Applications – Deployment of App Service and Container based solutions
Infrastructure as Code – ARM, Terraform, Pulumi, Cloud Maker
Security – Microsoft Defender for Cloud
AWS/GCP Deployment Experience
Office 365 - Deployment and Best Practice


What to do next... simply get in touch/apply here!


Cloud Decisions are proud to be part of Microsoft UK's Partner Talent Services and able to you to connect with some of the best cloud career opportunities within the Microsoft Partner Network. Our Talent Specialists are also Microsoft certified in Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365, allowing us to have conversations at depth with you about your technical/consulting experience. Whether this role is right for you or not we can also connect you with other opportunities to suit your background. Azure Cloud Solution Engineer - DevOps

We’re looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our tech team at an exciting time of growth! This is a great role for a DevOps Engineer looking to take a critical role in a company, working in a secure environment critical to many emergency services.

Who are Airbox Systems?

At Airbox Systems, we’ve built a passionate and collaborative environment and we’re looking for someone who shares our enthusiasm for trying to make the world a better place! We are at the forefront of our industry, building a software suite of situational awareness tools, with the core mission of saving lives by supporting emergency response units. Our products are currently trusted by Law Enforcement, Search & Rescue, Fire, Medical Emergency Services, Military and Special Forces around the world.


With Airbox you will be joining a supportive working environment, where we are focused on growing and nurturing our staff and creating a positive workplace for everyone. We value work/life balance, so offer remote working and flexible working hours. It’s a fast-paced company with plenty of exciting plans and growth for the coming years!


What will you be doing?

As the DevOps Engineer you will be responsible for deploying and managing multiple environments to support rapid, Agile development approaches. Our environment is mixed Linux and Windows, hosted in AWS cloud. You’ll be working with CI/CD principles and containerisation (Kubernetes).


What do you need?

For this DevOps Engineer role we’re looking for experience with:

Previous experience as a DevOps Engineer
Comfortable with Linux and ideally also Windows
CI/CD
Configuration management (Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Terraform)
Cloud – ideally AWS


Interested?

If you’re interested in learning more about this DevOps Engineer role then please apply today for immediate consideration! Unily is an award-winning enterprise employee experience platform designed for the world’s leading enterprises to connect, inform, and engage globally diverse workforces with a meaningful digital experience. Unily was founded in 2005, and with $68m in funding in 2019 and a new investment in partner in 2022, we plan to triple in size by 2026 – in both customers and colleagues. We are growing at a rapid rate so there really is no better time to join us.*The Role*Unily are embarking on a multi-million pound tech modernisation project, to enable us to scale our market leading product further, kicking off in early 2023. We are introducing cutting-edge technologies to our tech stack to allow this project to take flight and we need experienced DevOps Engineers to join our team to bring this project to life.Reporting to the DevOps Lead, and based out of our HQ in Lower Eashing, you will contribute to the technical operations team as a DevOps engineer helping build and maintain solutions for the team and the business to automate and manage current and new systems. You will continually strive to improve performance through scaling, configuration and tuning and will be a ‘go-to’ person for any of the processes and platforms that support our core products.This role will include occasional out-of-hours work for critical system and database issues and planned maintenance where needed. This is an opportunity to build solutions and software that can make a real difference to our clients and their customers.*Responsibilities*Establish monitoring systems and alerting procedures: Unily is a rapidly evolving solution with new services. You will need to ensure these services are monitored and alerted upon properly to the relevant teamsManage integrations between hosting platforms and applications: You will be responsible for setting up any potential integrations required. This may require you to build a solution using C#Automate the processes of release management, orchestration, monitoring, and containerization: You will have to build and maintain the process to automate the release of the core product and services to Azure VMs, Azure Functions, Azure App Services, Kubernetes and other platforms on AzureMake sure the CI pipeline is running smoothly: You will be responsible for ensuring that the pipeline is always functional and performantDocument everything for others to follow and refer to: You will create or maintain documentation around your work items to ensure other team members or teams have documentation to fall back onKnowledge, Skills and ExperienceStrong working experience with container management and micro-services architectures such as Docker, Kubernetes, AKSKnowledge in Microsoft Azure, ideally their Platform as Service offerings (App Services, Azure SQL, CosmosDB, Azure Search, KeyVault etc.)Experience working across both Linux and WindowsExcellent skills in PowerShell and YAMLBuilding, Managing, and securing C# ASP.Net web applicationsWeb-based authentication flows such as OAuth or SAMLEffective source control management with GitBuild and Release Management using Azure DevOps (VSTS) or a similar productExperience monitoring large distributed systems using technologies such as ELK, DataDog, Prometheus and tooling provided by cloud platform vendorsAwareness and interest in technology trends to adopt new cutting-edge toolsRequired AttributesExcellent communicator, confident, clear, and able to concisely make a point, and enjoys planning and documentationConfident, yet calm. Able to inspire the team around you and your customers.Ambitious high achiever. Strives to achieve the highest goals from a personal and professional perspectiveBe a team player. Will seek to achieve harmony across peers and within the team in face of difficult prioritiesFriendly with a good sense of humourBe prepared to work out of hours/weekend and shift patterns to accommodate different time zones. In return, you will be compensated with a generous overtime packageWhy work for Unily?In addition to a generous base salary and discretionary company bonus, here are some things we think you will love:Our awesome team culture. We are focused on achieving results as a team and having fun whilst we do it. You won’t find a friendlier or more dedicated bunch of people.Our industry leading product. We are very proud of our ever-evolving product, naturally we use (and love) it internally and provide the tools and resources for you (and our clients) to become an Unily expert.The flexibility that we offer. We don’t just mean working from home occasionally. We operate on a hybrid basis, and also recognise that life happens during the 9-5.30 and encourage a sustainable work/life balance.Our bright and modern office spaces. When you need to be in the office we want it to be like being at home. We have a well-stocked kitchen (with a beer pump), ample parking and the option to bring your dog to work.We offer a fantastic suite of benefits. Including 25 days holiday, Vitality life cover, Aviva pension, life assurance, income protection and so many more.Our commitment to sustainability and giving back to the community. We offer 1 fully paid volunteering day per year and the option to lease an Electric Vehicle through our salary sacrifice scheme.*Some other things you should know*This role reports to our EMEA HQ based in Godalming, Surrey and we operate on a hybrid basis, so be prepared to join us in the office 1-2 times per week. We cannot accept applications outside of the UK for this position.We provide your equipment including a laptop and any other tools required to do the role, so if you need a monitor, headset or chair just let us know.Location: Unily,GU7 2QW,Godalming, Godalming GU7Job Type: Full-time Unily is an award-winning enterprise employee experience platform designed for the world’s leading enterprises to connect, inform, and engage globally diverse workforces with a meaningful digital experience. Unily was founded in 2005, and with $68m in funding in 2019 and a new investment in partner in 2022, we plan to triple in size by 2026 – in both customers and colleagues. AWS DevOps Engineer
EU (outside UK) - Fully Remote
6 months
£450/day (or equivalent in USD or EUR)
Who are we?
We're a software development company building the world's Elastic Workforce, reinventing work and challenging the assumption that a local team = the best team.
We help businesses deliver technical projects better than ever before through our platform and on-demand Elastic Teams.
What's in it for you? Our mission is to create freelance jobs with more benefits than permanent.

Want to know more? read: https://distributed.co/about
About this role
We're re-engineering a monolithic platform (around 10-12 years' old) and moving it to the cloud to improve the services and capabilities we can offer our customers. We're in sprint 0 - you'll be instrumental in helping to define this migration.
Your Responsibilities

Work closely with our Head of Technology to map out a plan for the migration of a monolithic platform
Build CI/CD pipelines
Act as a subject-matter expert for all things cloud and serverless
Configuration management using Ansible

About You
We’re looking for passionate technologists who enjoy working in collaborative agile teams. You’ll need to be a clear, concise & engaging communicator with people on your team. We enjoy the big picture and the detail; we want people who excel at both.

Gitlab Automated CI/CD Pipeline expert (integration with external services)
Gitlab / JIRA Integration
Terraform expert (to build AWS infrastructure as code - PCI experience in cloud desirable)
Ansible (configuration management)
Security by design

About us
Distributed is proud to be an equal opportunities employer. Employees and contractors, as well as prospective employees and contractors, will all be treated equally and fairly. Distributed is committed to ensuring no less favourable treatment is experienced by any current or prospective employee because of any of the protected characteristics under the UK Equality Act 2010 or equivalent local equality legislation.
By submitting your application you give us permission to store and use the information from your CV and your answers to application questions. AWS DevOps Engineer

Distributed is proud to be an equal opportunities employer. Employees and contractors, as well as prospective employees and contractors, will all be treated equally and fairly. Distributed is committed to ensuring no less favourable treatment is experienced by any current or prospective employee because of any of the protected characteristics under the UK Equality Act 2010 or equivalent local equality legislation.
By submitting your application you give us permission to store and use the information from your CV and your answers to application questions. Show more

Overview of the role
We are seeking a highly capable DevOps Engineer with a proven track record of being able to plan and create a complete CI/CD eco system. This is a rare opportunity to start from a blank sheet with all options open and plan, provide and grow the entire system.
You will liaise with our software engineering staff to understand the needs of the engineers and the business, and then create a commercial grade CI/CD-based infrastructure for our current and future software development and delivery. You will guide and drive the selection of tools and working practices to facilitate this need. You will also be expected to contribute to mechanisms for auto-deployment of development environments for engineers.
Responsibilities… what will you do?

As a Senior DevOps Engineer you will be responsible for:

Design and implementation of all CI/CD infrastructure
Owning and driving the tool selection process
Design, implementation and maintenance of source code and data control systems
Design, implementation and maintenance of autonomous build and test infrastructure
Mechanisms for the control of software configuration management
Control and operation of the software release to end customers


Essential skills and experience… what are we looking for?

You will have the following skills and experience:

Previous experience either as a prominent or lead role in a DevOps team
Strong, practical, commercial DevOps experience with:
Excellent knowledge of CI/CD infrastructures and tool sets
Excellent knowledge of source control tools, including Git
Experience of GitLab and GitHub and their strengths and weaknesses
Build environment management
Commercial software release management
Hands-on can-do attitude
Degree, relevant qualification or significant relevant experience


Desirable skills and experience:

Background in software development or test
C++, Python, PowerShell, Bash
Linux, Windows, Android, AWS
Jenkins
Containerization related technologies such as Docker/Kubernetes
Virtualization skills with platforms such as VMware and Hyper-V
Automated testing environments
Digital signing of executables
Software warehousing
Auto-provisioning, isolation, and control of build environments
Third-party library management and checking for malicious content (npm, PyPi)


Benefits… what do you get?

Competitive salary up to 70k dependent on experience
EMI share options scheme
Flexible working
25 days annual leave, bank holidays, plus 3 days additional leave for Christmas closure
Company discount scheme
Pension scheme
New Career Development Framework to support your professional development


This role is advertised as full-time but we want to hire the best person and would therefore consider part-time options.
Note to all applicants
Due to the security classification on the work we do, we will undertake a routine Baseline Personnel Security Standard check on the successful applicant. This is a standard process which includes references and career history checks.

Science and Technology Facilities Council
Salary: £39,748 - £44,166 per annum
Plus a recruitment and retention allowance of £2,000 + Overtime
Contract Type: Permanent with full & part time options (minimum 25 hours per week)
Location: Rutherford Appleton Laboratory Harwell, Oxfordshire
Closing Date: 28th August 2022
About the role
SCD currently has an opportunity for a Devops Engineer to join the team responsible for the extensive computing infrastructure that supports the large science projects in which SCD participates.
SCD defines, develops and manages the underpinning scientific computing infrastructure used to provide an extensive range of national and international science projects including the GridPP Tier1 service for Particle Physics, the JASMIN super data cluster for environmental science, STFC’s central HPC cluster, a large in-house OpenStack cloud as well as computing support for STFC facilities such as the ISIS Neutron and Muon Facility, the Central Laser Facility plus the Diamond Light Source.
The extensive infrastructure we support includes both High Throughput Computing (HTC) and High Performance Computing (HPC), extensive cloud and virtualization services, large capacity data storage resources and a range of general purpose scientific computing services.
Please see the following for more information –
https://www.scd.stfc.ac.uk/Pages/home.aspx
https://www.scd.stfc.ac.uk/Pages/Videos.aspx
Key parts of the role will be to:
Be a senior member of the team responsible for installing, maintaining and supporting the data storage services and scientific computing resources managed by the Cloud Operations Group
Take ownership and responsibility for specific sections of the infrastructure ensuring they run smoothly and meet their operational commitments
Investigate, recommend and deploy new technologies, services and applications as required to enhance the service levels provided
Act as a technical expert from SCD projects during interaction with the science communities to help understand, define and develop future requirements
Technical Skills Required
Experience in the use and system management of UNIX /Linux
Experience in a programming or scripting language such as Python or Bash
Managing a service platform to a high level of availability
Ideally additional experience in multiple of:
Multi-Petabyte storage solutions using object-stores or traditional POSIX filesystems
Virtualisation and/or Cloud computing systems
Managing large scale computing clusters
Distributed or Grid computing, particularly using the UMD/OSG middleware stack
System integration, particularly in large scale environments (>100s of systems)
Ethernet and TCP/IP networking
Personal Skills and Attributes
Good communication skills both verbal and written
The ability to diagnose system faults and analyse problems
The ability to work as a team member delivering commitments on time
The ability to work independently and manage projects
The ability to interact with scientists as well as external collaborators with diverse levels of technical ability

Any other Relevant Information
Able to undertake occasional UK and Overseas travel (usually 1-3 days, but up to 1 week)
Able to take a routine share in an on-call work system providing out of hours cover (allowance and overtime payments provided).

About you
Please indicate whether you will assess the criteria through shortlisting (S), at Interview (I) or both (S&I)
Essential:
A degree in an IT or other scientific/technical discipline or equivalent experience (S)
Experience in System Administration procedures and practice (S&I)
Expertise in Unix or Linux Operating Systems (S&I)
Good written communication as demonstrated by the quality of the CV and application covering letter (S)
Expertise in a programming or scripting language such as Python or Bash
Ability to diagnose system faults and analyse problems (I)
Ability to work in an IT environment delivering a high level of service availability (I)
Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a team (I)
Ability to work independently and manage projects (I)

Desirable:
Specialist knowledge in large scale storage systems (S&I)

What we can offer you
A whole host of family friendly benefits including;
An exceptional index linked pension scheme,
30 days leave (pro-rata) plus 10 public holidays,
Christmas shut down
Flexible working,
An onsite subsidised nursery
Access to employee shopping/travel discounts - Salary sacrifice cycle to work scheme.
Social and sporting activities and societies
We are committed to developing our staff, and training will be provided in relevant areas.
Plus many more benefits and wellbeing initiatives that enable our employees to have a great work life balance.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.
The Science and Technology Facilities Council is a world-leading multi-disciplinary science organisation where curiosity-driven, blue-skies thinking meets practical, application-led science and engineering. Our goal is to deliver economic, societal, scientific and international benefits to the UK and its people – and more broadly to the world.

One of Europe’s largest research organisations, we’re trusted to support, enable and undertake cutting-edge projects in an amazing diversity of fields. Through world-class facilities and people, we’re driving ground-breaking advances in science, engineering, computing and technology. Our research seeks to understand the Universe from the largest astronomical scales to the tiniest constituents of matter, yet creates impact on a very tangible, human scale.

For more information about STFC please visit https://stfc.ukri.org/

You can also visit our careers site https://www.stfccareers.co.uk/

How to Apply

Online applications only for this role. Please submit your CV and a covering letter which clearly outlines how you fulfil the criteria specified along with your motivation to join STFC and the role you’re applying for. Ensure that the job reference number is included in the filename description of each document uploaded. Note that failure to address the above criteria or submit your application without a covering letter may result in your application not being considered.

About UKRI
Launched in April 2018, UKRI is a non-departmental public body sponsored by the Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS). UK Research and Innovation brings together the seven disciplinary research councils, Research England, which is responsible for supporting research and knowledge exchange at higher education institutions in England, and the UK’s innovation agency, Innovate UK. More information can be found at https://www.ukri.org/. Science and Technology Facilities Council

Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET)

Role Summary

We are looking for a Software Developer in Test (SDET), to join our Quality Chapter. As a member of the Quality chapter, you will work with the crews where your primary focus will be as the voice of Quality and Quality Engineering practices. You will work collaboratively to deliver high quality outcomes to our customers.
You will be focused on the evolution and maintenance of our technical quality engineering practices/principles and deliverables i.e., automation, performance, static code analysis etc. You will be hands on in the delivery and growth of the automation frameworks across our application stacks, whilst supporting the wider quality engineering community to better utilise and benefit from the automation within a Dev-Ops culture by shifting quality practices to the left.

You will support our delivery teams to ensure that quality is at the forefront of our delivery practices, and work towards a whole team ownership for quality. You will seek to identify obstacles that can derail the success of our deliveries, and help to identify and drive towards the mitigation of such obstacles

What You’ll Do

Design and implement robust testing frameworks focused on enabling test first practices and fast feedback
Utilise toolsets that fit with the products under test and for use within a continuous Integration and deployment pipeline
Continually seek to advance the software quality practices and raise the overall maturity within the tribe, by identifying potential impediments / obstacles, which could impact upon achieving successful high-quality deliverables at pace
Design, implement and execute automated test scenarios which demonstrate the business condition/behaviour under test and the expected results
Work closely with solution architects, and engineers to help design and implement testable solutions
Work collaboratively with the crew to ensure that quality is built into everything we do at Dunelm, focusing on bug prevention over detection
Help innovate and deliver continuous improvements within the crews and Quality chapter

What We Want from You

Essential Skills

Hands on experience with automation as part of the delivery cycle, i.e., framework design, test creation, execution against iteration deliverables.
Working in an Agile / Scrum environment to ensure quality is driven from the start and throughout the delivery process using practices such as 3 amigos
Demonstrable knowledge of supporting understanding and consistency in delivery practices through ATDD / TDD / BDD
Experience of Continuous Integration, Delivery and deployment through CI Pipelines
Knowledge of the following JavaScript including ReactJS and NodeJS
Expertise with automated testing tools for web/mobile applications (such as Cypress.io, Selenium, Appium, Jest)

Desirable Skills

Understanding of programming principles and best practice (e.g., DRY, SOLID for creating re-usable code, best practice etc)
Background in DevOps tooling for execution of automation tests such as Jenkins/Gitlab, GIT, PAAS, Monitoring / Log aggregation, DataDog.
Experience with non-functional automated testing e.g., performance, security etc
Knowledge of some of the following, Lambda, SAP

This will be a hybrid working position, so much of your time will be working from home.

If you’re excited about joining our growing Quality chapter, then please apply now for our immediate attention

locations.
We recognise the value in diversity and welcome applications from all candidates regardless of sex, age, race,
religion, ability, gender or sexual identity, socio-economic background or education.
We are committed to making Dunelm a place where everyone can enjoy a successful career and have systems
in place to support all our staff.

We’re Nominet – a world-leading domain name registry. For over 25 years, we’ve been operating at the heart of internet infrastructure. While we're best known for running .UK domains, we also help protect public services from cyber threat.Our aim is to create a world which is more connected, inclusive and secure. We know that technology has the power to transform lives by creating opportunities and providing support where it’s needed most.As a public benefit company, our work funds the ability to make a positive impact on society. We’ve donated millions to projects that use technology to improve peoples’ lives and have committed to delivering £60m worth of support over the next three years.We understand the impact the Internet has on the environment and are committed to helping the UK reach Net Zero by 2050. We’re already a Carbon Neutral company through offsetting our emissions and will continue to work on reducing our footprint.ABOUT THE ROLEWe are looking for a multi-disciplined, skilled and self-motivated DevOps Engineer to join Nominet Cyber Solutions and help us deliver our Protective DNS solution. You will work closely with other engineers as part of a cross-functional scrum team. Within the team, you will be responsible for deployment of products into cloud environments as well as building artefacts for distribution to customers so you’ll need good skills developing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines. Our customers require very high availability of our Protective DNS system and you’ll have the opportunity to work with modern technologies, such as Kubernetes and terraform in a cloud native environment to design and deliver a data platform.WHAT YOU'LL BE DOINGWork on deployment, management and maintenance of new cloud-based cyber security products.Support development of new product features and services.Deliver implementation of robust, maintainable, standards-compliant configuration and infrastructure in an agile working environment.Advise colleagues to ensure new products and features are deployed safely in a timely and effective manner.Investigating and engaging with new trends, technologies, and configurations.Advocate, educate and build consensus.Building relationships with other teams/key stakeholders and working in a cohesive, friendly and collaborative manner to deliver real value for customers.WHO YOU AREExcellent knowledge of Amazon Web Services (AWS)Commercial experience working with Terraform, Kubernetes and Helm.Good familiarity with Git and GitLab.Good knowledge of a scripting language.Experience of CI/CD using tools such as GitLab pipelines or GitHub The Productivity Engineering Group at Arm is designed to assist colleagues across all of Arm's Engineering population with infrastructure that is evaluated and deployed alongside a deep understanding of the huge variety of work that the company does and what will work best at Arm. We are looking for a hardworking and enthusiastic engineer to join our Productivity Engineering Software & DevOps team based in Cambridge who support and enable our engineering teams.
We combine people, technology and domain specific knowledge to craft tools, services and infrastructure for Arm’s Engineering workforce that improve their productivity. It is a complicated and at times, but there are many opportunities for people who take pride in, and enjoy developing these services and systems to make a real difference.
Responsibilities:
You will have a chance to work across a range of systems, services and tools to provide first-class development environments and productivity tools for both hardware and software engineers around Arm, enabling them to perform the job effectively and efficiently. The domains and areas typically include:
Software build and test solutions using CI/CD, binary, secret and test management.
Exploiting Virtualisation and cloud technologies such as AWS, Kubernetes and Vault.
Migrating services from on-prem based infrastructure to AWS
Our days can be highly dynamic and are usually a mixture of both development and supporting the engineering community with advice on how best to utilize the tools and systems we have available. Development activities range from small incremental improvements and bug fixes to multi-month strategic scale projects. In all our activities we usually spend a large amount of time interacting with the other engineering teams in Arm.
Required Skills and Experience:
A good university degree in computer science/software engineering or equivalent
A working knowledge of software development lifecycle
Significant experience of Linux based infrastructure design, provisioning and maintenance.
Have a broad range of Cloud services experience with a deep knowledge of at least one of the following: AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Demonstrable experience in:
Infrastructure as code technologies such as Terraform, Ansible, Puppet
Containerisation (Kubernetes and Docker)
Interpreted programming languages such as Bash, Python, Ruby or Perl
‘Nice to Have’ Skills and Experience
Self-motivated
Passionate about software development and automation
Have an active interest in Open Source Software
A focus on personal achievement and responsibility
Experience of Microservice Software development using GoLang

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
DevOps Engineer
About Mastercard

Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.
Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.

Overview

As part of Mastercards ONE RTP and Applications System and Platform Engineering team, we provide Tooling and Support services to our team and multiple programs across Mastercard and its acquisitions. We're a multi-disciplined DevOps engineering function responsible for the design, build and run of Kubernetes platforms and its hosted applications supporting product deployments across public and private cloud.

Your focus areas will be the support, maintenance and improvement of our services and applications via various support channels, Jira, Teams and Email. You'll have a direct impact on the developer experience and engineering efficiencies across the business.

You are a DevOps specialist skilled in the cultural and technical principles & practices of the DevOps movement with experience of implementing DevOps approach and associated tools within an organization. You have a desire to continually improve your own skills and the ability to transfer those skills to others. You look for efficiencies, optimizations, and ways to improve through automation. Together, you will be part of a team who work together to deliver complex projects through agile methodologies.

Role Responsibilities
Day-to-day support duties for all services and applications to the development teams and other users.Manages platform systems to ensure reliability and security through the support and maintenance of existing systems; develops, selects, and implements systems enhancementsUses working knowledge of automation design and infrastructure to determine what to automate and perform large-scale sustainable, intelligent automation in a cross-functional environmentAssists with input into design of automation for full infrastructure deployment; assists with review of and tests for compatibility and integration processes needed to connect with other devicesInterprets the analysis of current architecture setup to understand and suggest potential enhancementsProvides advice and best practice to our service users
Researching and evaluating tools to support domain-specific needsDemonstrates knowledge of company procedures and standards to analyse impact on existing IT systems and platformsApplies technical capabilities within own discipline to coach and develop junior employeesProvides input into performance appraisal process for some junior employees or team membersProvide support to production operations teams. Exceptional and pre-approved on-call support will be required
Experiences & Skills

Administration experience of one or more of Jenkins, SonarQube, Nexus Lifecycle, Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence, CrowdAdministraiion of PostgreSQL HA preferably using repmgr and barmanStrong experience of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) automation tools such as TerraformStrong experience with configuration management tools such as Ansible, Chef, PuppetStrong experience with CI/CD pipelinesStrong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to listen, present and communicate solutions clearly and concisely with technical audiencesStrong experience of Kubernetes
Experience with scripting languages such as Python, Groovy, BashExperience & hands on knowledge of Unix/LinuxExperience in driving issue resolution and root cause identificationExperience of working within Agile frameworks including Scrum and KanbanExperience with Git version control and branching strategies, eg. trunk-based development, gitflow
COVID-19 Considerations
We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together. In many locations, which may change over time, we’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by video or phone. In addition, in some locations, only individuals who have been fully vaccinated will be permitted inside Mastercard offices until further notice.
In the US, Mastercard is a government contractor, which may legally require most Mastercard employees to be vaccinated unless a verified approved medical or religious exemption is granted. Further, we are currently making every effort towards having employees return to work in the office 2 days per week, if that makes sense for their team. Everyone must be vaccinated to enter Mastercard offices at this time. Therefore, we expect all candidates to be vaccinated or to be approved for a medical or religious accommodation prior to commencing work at Mastercard.
Corporate Security Responsibility
All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines. Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
DevOps Engineer
About Mastercard

Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.
Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.

Overview

As part of Mastercards ONE RTP and Applications System and Platform Engineering team, we provide Tooling and Support services to our team and multiple programs across Mastercard and its acquisitions. We're a multi-disciplined DevOps engineering function responsible for the design, build and run of Kubernetes platforms and its hosted applications supporting product deployments across public and private cloud.

Your focus areas will be the support, maintenance and improvement of our services and applications via various support channels, Jira, Teams and Email. You'll have a direct impact on the developer experience and engineering efficiencies across the business.

You are a DevOps specialist skilled in the cultural and technical principles & practices of the DevOps movement with experience of implementing DevOps approach and associated tools within an organization. You have a desire to continually improve your own skills and the ability to transfer those skills to others. You look for efficiencies, optimizations, and ways to improve through automation. Together, you will be part of a team who work together to deliver complex projects through agile methodologies.

Role Responsibilities
Day-to-day support duties for all services and applications to the development teams and other users.Manages platform systems to ensure reliability and security through the support and maintenance of existing systems; develops, selects, and implements systems enhancementsUses working knowledge of automation design and infrastructure to determine what to automate and perform large-scale sustainable, intelligent automation in a cross-functional environmentAssists with input into design of automation for full infrastructure deployment; assists with review of and tests for compatibility and integration processes needed to connect with other devicesInterprets the analysis of current architecture setup to understand and suggest potential enhancementsProvides advice and best practice to our service users
Researching and evaluating tools to support domain-specific needsDemonstrates knowledge of company procedures and standards to analyse impact on existing IT systems and platformsApplies technical capabilities within own discipline to coach and develop junior employeesProvides input into performance appraisal process for some junior employees or team membersProvide support to production operations teams. Exceptional and pre-approved on-call support will be required
Experiences & Skills

Administration experience of one or more of Jenkins, SonarQube, Nexus Lifecycle, Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence, CrowdAdministraiion of PostgreSQL HA preferably using repmgr and barmanStrong experience of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) automation tools such as TerraformStrong experience with configuration management tools such as Ansible, Chef, PuppetStrong experience with CI/CD pipelinesStrong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to listen, present and communicate solutions clearly and concisely with technical audiencesStrong experience of Kubernetes
Experience with scripting languages such as Python, Groovy, BashExperience & hands on knowledge of Unix/LinuxExperience in driving issue resolution and root cause identificationExperience of working within Agile frameworks including Scrum and KanbanExperience with Git version control and branching strategies, eg. trunk-based development, gitflow

Introduction
This is a hybrid position with a 60/40 split. For 60% of the month, you can work from home and 40% of the month will be onsite. You can choose the days you work onsite to make up the 40%.

The client is a leading engineering consultancy operating within the Defence and Security space. The client is looking for DevOps engineering with a software development background to work across a variety of projects within the software development team.

If you feel this is the role for you, please apply!
The client is looking for some currently working as a DevOps engineer who has transitioned from Software Development/Engineering and has good technical understanding in one or more areas of the below:
Skills & experience
Cloud technologies including Azure and/or AWS.
Cyber security techniques and skills.
A range of programming languages & frameworks suitable for Java, J2EE & Spring application development e.g. Java, WildFly/JBOSS, Spring, Spring Boot, JPA, SQL, Node.js, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Vue.js
Relevant architectural styles e.g. micro service architecture, REST.
Database design, integration, management & maintenance (migration)
Database tools e.g. Oracle SQL Developer, Liquibase.
Development & debugging tools & techniques e.g. IntelliJ IDEA, Eclipse, NetBeans.
VCS tools & techniques e.g. Git, SVN, branching, merging, patching, release management.
Testing tools and plug-ins e.g. Junit, Cucumber, Maven Surefire, Maven Failsafe.
Testing levels e.g. unit, integration, system.
Documentation tools and techniques e.g. UML, Enterprise Architect, MDA & MBSE, Confluence including draw.io
Development methodologies e.g. Agile (SCRUM, SAFe).
DevOps techniques, tools & infrastructure e.g. continuous integration, continuous deployment, Bamboo, Jenkins, Gitlab, Docker, Ansible, vRealize etc.

Our client is committed to a policy of Equal Opportunity, Diversity and Inclusion. Their working environment is friendly, innovative and inclusive. They can accommodate flexible working arrangements, and support a diverse work-force and those with additional needs.
Additional benefits
Flexi Leave and Flexi Time Scheme
Annual Holiday
Flexible Benefits
Sickness Benefit
Business Performance Related Bonus
Share Save Plan
Pension scheme

ABOUT OQCAt Oxford Quantum Circuits (OQC) we build quantum computers to enable life-changing discoveries: from new drug modelisation to longer-lasting battery technology and portfolio optimisation. We have launched Europe’s first Quantum Computing as a Service (QCaaS) – to bring quantum to our customers’ fingertips and help them improve their operations and trailblaze new commercial and scientific approaches.Our team is composed of 60+ people with various backgrounds in quantum physics, nanotechnologies, hardware, software and business operations from marketing to intellectual property. We are all bound by the desire to put OQC at the forefront of the quantum revolution and help solve some of the world’s most challenging problems.*ROLE OVERVIEW*Quantum Computing as a Service (QCaaS) is a fundamental part of our offering at OQC, and we are looking for skilled and motivated individuals to engage with our technical team and customers to develop high-quality, robust and scalable systems that allow us to serve an ever increasing user base.You will primarily work on the cloud infrastructure, but will have wide ranging responsibilities to ensure that our systems are operational and also in designing and executing next generation projects. You will also assist the development team with their tooling to ensure that aspects such as CI and release/packaging pipelines are properly configured and working well. We expect candidates with excellent technical and team working skills, knowledge of quantum computing is a bonus.*RESPONSIBILITIES*Ensure operation of our cloud and local infrastructure to meet ongoing needs in a fast growing business.Apply engineering practices to ensure QCaaS operations are robust and scalable.Maintain and incrementally improve existing cloud services based on technical and business led requirements.Work with developers, and other stakeholders within the businessContribute to the next generation requirements and designs relating to QCaaS and dependent systems. Help ensure future business objectives can be met.Work with third party system administrators on on-site projects, ensuring that the IT infrastructure is fit for purpose.Assist with security audits and reviews, collaborating with third-party vendors where necessaryREQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLSExperience of system administration or DevOps in a professional environmentGood knowledge of LinuxKnowledge of version control systems, preferably gitKnowledge of scripting languages including bashExperience with AWS or AzureConfiguring and deploying continuous integration pipelinesExperience building maintaining and updating cloud systemsDESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLSExperience working with Docker and KubernetesExperience in pythonRelational and no-sql database designNetwork design and administrationLOCATION & TRAVELOQC’s office is located in Shinfield, Reading. There will be a requirement for occasional travel throughout the UK and elsewhere abroad for conferences, meetings and engineering visits.REMUNERATIONWe offer competitive remuneration based on experience.We also offer multiple benefits, from private medical insurance to Employee Assistance Cash Plan, from cycle to work to gym and fitness memberships. All our employees also participate in our ESOP. For more info, visit https://apply.workable.com/oqc/*APPLY NOW*As part of our application process we ask that you also provide us with a cover letter outlining why you think you would be a good fit for the role and what attracts you to OQC. Applications without a cover letter including this information will not be considered.We look forward to hearing from you!_At OQC we are not just hoping you’ll fit in our culture. We aspire to thrive, as a company and as people, thanks to your diversity of thought and background. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to providing our team members with a work environment free from discrimination, where everyone is treated with respect. Our employment decisions are based on business needs, talent and merit and all our colleagues share in the responsibility for fulfilling our commitment to diversity. DevOps engineer looking for your next challenge? Want to work on a project based around containeriation for the 3rd largest E-commerece company in the UK?


You could be working on one of the largest scale containerisation platforms in the UK, allowing you to build and improve the platform at a huge scale. You will get the chance to use your DevOps skills including CI/CD, AWS, Cloudformation, Ansible and Puppet to spear head this project.
This is an opportunity to work for an international company with a multi-billion pound turnover. The opportunity would be working for the 3rd largest E-commerce companies in the uk with a multi-million poud turnover on a platform with millions of users.
We are looking for someone who has:
AWS experince
Containerisation experience (Ideally mesos)
Terraform Experience
Jenkins Experience

DevOps Engineer (Remote), £50,000 to £60,000
You will be working within a software business with technology at its core. Investing heavily in technology they are currently migrating to AWS and looking for a DevOps Engineer to build and design their CI/CD environment.
Ideally you will have a background or strong understanding of Linux administration and containerised AWS cloud environments. You will be deploying IaC using Terraform and building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines with Jenkins.
There is opportunity to be involved in creating the technology roadmap and designing and delivering their new technology platform. They are also able to offer tangible progression within a growing business.
You will have previous experience
Building, deploying and optimising services within the AWS platform.
Designing, building, and managing CI/CD pipelines.
IaC experience ideally with Terraform but other tools considered.
Working collaboratively in multidisciplinary teams to deliver project requirements.
Good knowledge of Linux administration (ideally Redhat).
Desirable experience
Previous experience with MongoDB
Proven experience of scripting with one of: PowerShell, Bash, Python, Golang.
This is a great opportunity for a AWS DevOps engineer to work for an exciting brand with cutting edge technology.if you would prefer office based or hybrid working they are open to this, office location Sheffield.
Sound interesting?
If so, apply now or get in touch with AleksandraKoryzma@uniting,cloud for a confidential conversation.

Function:
Business Intelligence and Data Science
Closing Date:
09/09/2022
Virgin Media are on a mission to become the most recommended brand by our customers. At the heart of this strategy is digital innovation and our significant data resources.
So that's what you'll get up to, but what about us?

Well, we're super proud of our history, helping communities to stay connected with oodles of top-notch products and services. We offer the full kit and caboodle – broadband, TV, mobile and landline – equipping our customers out with the very latest tech.

But it's not just what we do, but why we do it that really matters.

Our mission is to become the most recommended brand, by our people and our customers. A massive part of that journey is about how we ensure that our brilliant people have a working environment in which they can truly belong and thrive. For us, it's critical that every single person can bring, and be, their whole selves at work, and we're working hard every day to achieve this.
As a DevOps Engineer, you will…
Support our GCP infrastructure
Build CI/CD pipelines
Automate where we can
Train other team members to follow DevOps best practices such as IaC
Build Terraform frameworks and reusable components to accelerate and scale our IaC adoption over time
Work with highly skilled Data Engineers, ML Engineers, Data Scientists and Software Engineers side by side to build powerful data products and services (including MLOps) that would really improve our customer’s experience at Virgin Media
Work in a start-up like environment (yeah, you heard that right!)
We’d love to hear from you, if you are …
Business value and delivery focused
Have the “I can solve it” attitude
A team player and have excellent communication skills
Have strong Terraform skills
Have built and owned CI/CD pipelines before
Operational experience with Kubernetes
Have good understanding of security best practices on a Cloud environment, including managing secret and service account
Good knowledge of networking such as VPC, subnets, routing and firewalls
Cloud experience is required preferably GCP
It would be nice if you…
Have worked in an Agile environment
Have a good understanding of distributed computing
Have deployed production systems using GitLab pipelines and Cloud Build
What we use…
Terraform
GitLab, Cloud Build and anything else that makes sense Function:
Business Intelligence and Data Science

DV Cleared DevOps Engineer
Contract Role
Duration- 12 months
Location- Newcastle Upon Tyne
Rate -Up to £900 per day PAYE inside IR35 (via Umbrella Co)
**Must have valid Deep vetted clearance **
Key Details and Responsibilities
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform - Responsible for the operations and maintainance of Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform (RHOCP) on Azure which is used by the Platform users for rapid application development.
Applicants should have Linux or Kubernetes (K8s) experience.
Skills: RH OpenShift, RH Service Mesh, Red Hat Advanced Cluster Security, Red Hat Quay, RH AMQ/Kafka, RH Ceph, Networking, Red Hat SSO (Keycloak), OpenShift Monitoring/Logging, PostgreSQL, Backup/Restore, Azure
Hands on experience required.
Additional skills:
Familiarity with DevOps tools and practices (Tekton, ArgoCD)
Operational activities: Monitoring, Incident resolution, Troubleshooting, Bug fixing, Patching/Upgrades, Support minor enhancements, user onboarding, user support, capacity planning and scaling. DV Cleared DevOps Engineer

Job Description Summary
.
Job Description
DevOps Engineer - Google Cloud
Lloyds Banking Group
Leeds, London, Halifax, Bristol, Manchester, Edinburgh – We’re happy with home working the majority of the time, however you’ll need to be in office at least 1 day per week under your own cost.
Salary & Benefits: The base salary banding for this role is £52,912 - £84,117 (dependant on location) plus annual personal bonus, 15% employer pension contribution, 4% flexible cash pot, private medical insurance, 30 days holiday plus bank holidays.
We also offer flexible working hours, agile working practices flexibility to suit your lifestyle and ensure a good work-life balance.
Who are Lloyds Banking Group and where does this role sit?
We’re rapidly transforming into a digitally-led business on a massive scale in order to better serve our customers.
Our Cloud Engineering team is growing! We’re looking for a talented DevOps Engineer to join our team and build scalable systems that will shape the future of our cloud infrastructure for our bank.
Specific activities which you’ll be responsible for include things like;
Work across multiple functional teams to assess, build and maintain a highly fault-tolerant, elastic infrastructure of tools and automation on cloud.
Creating deployments, services, and other resources on Kubernetes clusters.
Design, build, test, deploy, and automate stable/scalable services for the internal engineering team and end users.
Create and manage CI/CD pipelines for automated testing, deployment, and any other use cases.
Debug, troubleshoot, and resolve system level scale, performance, and automation problems.
Checking in code to Github repositories and performing code reviews for your fellow team members.
What do we need to see from applicants?
Significant experience in a DevOps or Site Reliability Engineer role. Mix of consumer technology and SaaS technology is ideal.
Working with and maintaining production experience with Kubernetes deployments and services.
Kubernetes (k8s) and Docker production experience
Built out continuous integration and continuous deployment pipelines.
Able to write Bash and/or Python scripts.
Ability to own and be responsible for the projects you will be working on.
Able to write Infrastructure as a code (IaC)
Able to curate product lifecycle around cloud core services
What else would be handy?
Experience working with GCP/Azure cloud infrastructure and their various services.
Fluent in Terraform and writing Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
Experience working with Service Mesh (Istio/Anthos)
Experience working with OpenVPN / Remote Access, Squid / Egress Proxy, IP Management, SMTP / Mail gateway, SMEE / Webhook Delivery.
Experience and thorough understanding of the Linux operating systems.
Experience with high-traffic monitoring systems. Implementing logging (Grafana/Prometheus), telemetry (New Relic), and tracing is ideal.
Excellent eye for security and creating bulletproof secure systems.
Excellent and effective verbal, written, interpersonal communication skills.
Comfortable with fast-paced change: ability to demonstrate comfort with ambiguity, adapt quickly and be effective in new situations in a highly dynamic setting.
What can I expect in Return?
We're dedicated to giving you opportunities and support to develop you both professionally and personally to optimise your potential!
As a new colleague to the team, you’ll join us on our journey to build a 21st century bank that reflects modern Britain and craft an inclusive culture where all colleagues feel encouraged and valued.
We're committed to building a workforce which reflects the diversity of the customers and communities we serve, and to building an inclusive environment where all our colleagues can be themselves and succeed on merit. We support the principles of agile working and equal opportunity and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements.
Together we’ll make it possible!
At Lloyds Banking Group, we're driven by a clear purpose; to help Britain recover. Across the Group, our colleagues are focused on making a difference to customers, businesses and communities. With us you'll have a key role to play in shaping the financial services of the future, whilst the scale and reach of our Group means you'll have many opportunities to learn, grow and develop.
We're focused on creating a values-led culture and are committed to building a workforce which reflects the diversity of the customers and communities we serve. Together we’re building a truly inclusive workplace where all of our colleagues have the opportunity to make a real difference. End Date

Working with and maintaining production experience with Kubernetes deployments and services.
Kubernetes (k8s) and Docker production experience
Built out continuous integration and continuous deployment pipelines.
Able to write Bash and/or Python scripts.
Ability to own and be responsible for the projects you will be working on.
Able to write Infrastructure as a code (IaC)
Able to curate product lifecycle around cloud core services
What else would be handy?
Experience working with GCP/Azure cloud infrastructure and their various services.
Fluent in Terraform and writing Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
Experience working with Service Mesh (Istio/Anthos)
Experience working with OpenVPN / Remote Access, Squid / Egress Proxy, IP Management, SMTP / Mail gateway, SMEE / Webhook Delivery.
Experience and thorough understanding of the Linux operating systems.
Experience with high-traffic monitoring systems. Implementing logging (Grafana/Prometheus), telemetry (New Relic), and tracing is ideal.
Excellent eye for security and creating bulletproof secure systems.
Excellent and effective verbal, written, interpersonal communication skills.
Comfortable with fast-paced change: ability to demonstrate comfort with ambiguity, adapt quickly and be effective in new situations in a highly dynamic setting.
What can I expect in Return?
We're dedicated to giving you opportunities and support to develop you both professionally and personally to optimise your potential!
As a new colleague to the team, you’ll join us on our journey to build a 21st century bank that reflects modern Britain and craft an inclusive culture where all colleagues feel encouraged and valued.
We're committed to building a workforce which reflects the diversity of the customers and communities we serve, and to building an inclusive environment where all our colleagues can be themselves and succeed on merit. We support the principles of agile working and equal opportunity and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements.
Together we’ll make it possible!
At Lloyds Banking Group, we're driven by a clear purpose; to help Britain recover. Across the Group, our colleagues are focused on making a difference to customers, businesses and communities. With us you'll have a key role to play in shaping the financial services of the future, whilst the scale and reach of our Group means you'll have many opportunities to learn, grow and develop.
We're focused on creating a values-led culture and are committed to building a workforce which reflects the diversity of the customers and communities we serve. Together we’re building a truly inclusive workplace where all of our colleagues have the opportunity to make a real difference. End Date

Agile Working Options

Job Description 
DevOps Engineer - Google Cloud  
Lloyds Banking Group  
Leeds, London, Halifax, Bristol, Manchester, Edinburgh – We’re happy with home working the majority of the time, however you’ll need to be in office at least 1 day per week under your own cost.  
Salary & Benefits: The base salary banding for this role is £52,912 - £84,117 (dependant on location) plus annual personal bonus, 15% employer pension contribution, 4% flexible cash pot, private medical insurance, 30 days holiday plus bank holidays.  
We also offer flexible working hours, agile working practices flexibility to suit your lifestyle and ensure a good work-life balance.  
Who are Lloyds Banking Group and where does this role sit? 
We’re rapidly transforming into a digitally-led business on a massive scale in order to better serve our customers.  
Our Cloud Engineering team is growing! We’re looking for a talented DevOps Engineer to join our team and build scalable systems that will shape the future of our cloud infrastructure for our bank.  
Specific activities which you’ll be responsible for include things like; 
Work across multiple functional teams to assess, build and maintain a highly fault-tolerant, elastic infrastructure of tools and automation on cloud. 
Creating deployments, services, and other resources on Kubernetes clusters. 
Design, build, test, deploy, and automate stable/scalable services for the internal engineering team and end users. 
Create and manage CI/CD pipelines for automated testing, deployment, and any other use cases. 
Debug, troubleshoot, and resolve system level scale, performance, and automation problems. 
Checking in code to Github repositories and performing code reviews for your fellow team members.  
What do we need to see from applicants? 
Significant experience in a DevOps or Site Reliability Engineer role. Mix of consumer technology and SaaS technology is ideal. 
Working with and maintaining production experience with Kubernetes deployments and services. 
Kubernetes (k8s) and Docker production experience 
Built out continuous integration and continuous deployment pipelines. 
Able to write Bash and/or Python scripts. 
Ability to own and be responsible for the projects you will be working on. 
Able to write Infrastructure as a code (IaC) 
Able to curate product lifecycle around cloud core services  
What else would be handy? 
Experience working with GCP/Azure cloud infrastructure and their various services. 
Fluent in Terraform and writing Infrastructure as Code (IaC). 
Experience working with Service Mesh (Istio/Anthos) 
Experience working with OpenVPN / Remote Access, Squid / Egress Proxy, IP Management, SMTP / Mail gateway, SMEE / Webhook Delivery. 
Experience and thorough understanding of the Linux operating systems. 
Experience with high-traffic monitoring systems. Implementing logging (Grafana/Prometheus), telemetry (New Relic), and tracing is ideal. 
Excellent eye for security and creating bulletproof secure systems. 
Excellent and effective verbal, written, interpersonal communication skills. 
Comfortable with fast-paced change: ability to demonstrate comfort with ambiguity, adapt quickly and be effective in new situations in a highly dynamic setting.

Company Description
Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.
When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.
Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.

Job Description
What’s it all about?
Working within OVN Programme within Network Processing
As the world’s largest electronic payments network, Visa customers trust us with ensuring that they can pay with security and confidence everywhere they want to be.
Network Processing looks after the systems that form the core of Visa, allowing consumers and merchants to connect with financial institutions and provide a seamless payment experience, the mission of the OVN (Open VisaNet) team is to create the next generation of these core systems using the latest technologies to ensure we are able to maintain this trust going forward and ensure that Visa is ready for the challenges of the future.
What we expect of you, day to day.
This role requires an DevOps software engineer who wants to work in an agile cross-functional DevOps development team. The team is currently responsible for operational activities in pre-production environments, providing support for the OVN application build teams, which is a long term and exciting commitment making use of Go, Kafka, Docker and NoSql databases in a micro-services and web-service architecture, leveraging configuration automation tools such as Jenkins and operational tools such as Splunk, Sysdig and Prometheus.
The team additionally have a key responsibility for creating DevOps tools and capabilities both to aid the current build activities and for the long term running of the application, for example CI/CD pipelines, test automation, operational monitoring.

Qualifications

Thinking about careers differently...

At Visa, we are passionate to offer our employees compelling career growth opportunities. As such, even if you do not have experience of this function there could be skills or experiences, which would transfer well. For this role, the key skills required are:


Skilled with Kafka, Docker & KubernetesSkilled at CI/CD using automation tools such as Jenkins, Puppet, Ansible.Experience using and configuring operational tools such as Splunk, Sysdig, Prometheus, Grafana.
Experienced at administering a code repo such as GithubDevelopment experience with Golang (alternatively a strong background in C or java)

A successful candidate would have a working knowledge of most of the technologies with a deep understanding of one or more and a desire to learn more. More products will be added over time, which could bring more technologies into the remit of the team, so flexibility, and a desire to learn is key. As Go is an evolving language, we will consider candidates with a strong background in C or java, additionally, experience with operating system internals, networking protocols and file systems is beneficial.


The ideal candidate has proven and demonstrable experience of implementing and maintaining Dev Ops infrastructure and capability for an enterprise grade micro services architecture in a highly available (five 9s) environment.


They will also have spent time developing code within a software development team having familiarity with the entire software development lifecycle including version control, build process, testing, and code release and be comfortable working/leading on multiple workstreams.


We will be expecting the DevOps software engineer to provide guidance to DevOps team members, act as the design authority, shape best practice and ways of working within the team. As a senior software engineer, the candidate will be expected to lead on specific project level deliverables, maintaining stakeholder relationships with business and operations partners whilst mentoring more junior members of the team.


Additional desirable Skills:


Technical experience with distributed databases such as Cassandra, Aerospike, BoltDB. Distributed computing and high frequency transactions is a plus, as would be previous experience with financial services or payments processing domain.


Additional Information
Think you have what it takes?

If you are interested in a career that will challenge and inspire you – we’d love to hear from you!

Additional Information

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law. Company Description

When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.

It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!
We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.
Company Overview
At Proofpoint, people are at the heart of our award-winning lineup of cybersecurity solutions, and the people who work here are the key to our success, and to that of our customers. We’re customer-focused, collaborative and committed to excellence. Through a culture of diversity, honesty and initiative, we deliver meaningful innovation that helps manage today’s biggest threats. With opportunities in all functions, we offer many exciting reasons to join our team.
The Role
We are seeking a highly motivated DevOps Engineer to join our newly formed Belfast Engineering team working on the Proofpoint Flagship Security product. The successful candidate will make a highly visible contribution to several greenfield cloud modernisation projects serving many of the largest enterprise companies in the world.
Do you enjoy solving real world difficult problems and see the results of your work benefit to customers?
Do you want to learn and apply new skills on an ongoing basis?
Do you love working with big, complex and scalable applications that support thousands of customers?
If you answered yes to the questions above, then we want to talk to you!
Your day-to-day
We offer flexibility with remote working and office time ensuring a suitable work-life balance for our teams and individual needs.
Be an effective part of a small team and add to our positive culture. Contribute to the team's Agile development lifecycle.
By partnering with operations and other engineering teams, you will deliver improvements to the Proofpoint Protection Server platform, including reliability, efficiency and serviceability.
Design and implement new deployment techniques, processes and tools.
What you bring to the team
Experience with virtualization & container technologies: one or more of the following: Docker, Kubernetes, AWS or similar
Competent with Bash shell scripting
Self-motivated and can work independently, while also being able to partner closely with other engineers on a project
Evangelist of good software development practices, including source control, code reviews, automated tests
Strong software development: you are comfortable with more than one high level language
Why Proofpoint
We are wholly devoted to helping our customers protect their greatest assets and biggest security risk: their people. That’s why we’re a pioneer in next-generation cybersecurity and why more than half of the Fortune 100 trust us as a security partner. We welcome candidates from all walks of life. Apply today and explore your future #LifeAtPFPT.
#LI-CB1
#LI-Hybrid
If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us! It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!
