DevOps Engineer

Why Join Capco?

Capco is a global technology and business consultancy, focused on the financial services sector. We are passionate about helping our clients succeed in an ever-changing industry.

You will work on engaging projects with some of the largest banks in the world, on projects that will transform the financial services industry.

We offer:

A work culture focused on innovation and building lasting value for our clients and employees
Ongoing learning opportunities to help you acquire new skills or deepen existing expertise
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture
Enhanced and competitive family friendly benefits, including maternity / adoption / shared parental leave and paid leave for sickness, pregnancy loss, fertility treatment, menopause, and bereavement

DevOps at Capco

You’ll be part of excellent teams developing the new financial services apps, having the opportunity to work on exciting greenfield projects as well as on established Tier1 banks applications already adopted by millions of users.

You will be able to work on automating and optimising DevOps processes, improving your knowledge and skills to become an expert on CI/CD.

You’ll be able to work across different technology stacks, ranging from serverless deployments through to on-premise private cloud deployments.

You will also have the opportunity to learn and work with other mobile technologies whenever you want to wide your expertise.

We offer you the opportunity to train with the best courses and portals available online and get certified becoming the best version of DevOps engineer you can.

About you

Capco is looking for hardworking, innovative, and creative people to join our Digital Engineering team.

We'd also like to see:

Practical experience of engineering best practices, while being obsessed with continuous improvement.
Deep technical knowledge of two or more technologies and is curious to learn other parts of the stack.
Experience delivering software/technology projects leveraging Agile methodologies
You have personally made valuable contributions to products, solutions and teams and can articulate the value to customers.
You have played a role in the delivery of critical business applications and ideally customer facing applications.
You can communicate complex ideas to non-experts with eloquence and confidence.
You bring an awareness and understanding of new technologies being used in finance and other industries and loves to experiment.
A passion for being part of the engineering team that is forming the future of finance.

Skills & Expertise

You will have experience working with some of the following Methodologies/Technologies.

Knowledgeable in the Software Development Lifecycle with both a Development and Operations mindset
Hands on development experience in at least one object-orientated language e.g., Java/C#, JavaScript, Golang.
Understanding of containerisation and aware of container orchestration concepts, including hands on Docker experience.
A strong grasp on infrastructure as code, as well as techniques including Terraform and CloudFormation.
Hands on experience of using scripting with Python, Groovy to build CI/CD pipelines on Jenkins, CircleCI, GoCD.
Understanding of application and system monitoring tools with experience of auto-healing, autoscaling and predictive monitoring
Experience using version control software such as Git.
Experience using AWS, GCP and/or Azure
Experience in Automation and Configuration Management tools such as Ansible, Chef, Puppet or Helm.

Nice to have skills

Hands on Test Orchestration experience with Cucumber, Karate or Selenium.
TDD or BDD understanding and how to enable and orchestrate the different types of tests required by the quality phase.
Understanding of CSP networking and security features and services
Experience/understanding of Kubernetes, Istio and knowledge of related tools (Kiali, Fortio etc).

Joining Capco means joining an organisation that is committed to an inclusive working environment where you’re encouraged to #BeYourselfAtWork. We celebrate individuality and recognize that diversity and inclusion, in all forms, is critical to success. It’s important to us that we recruit and develop as diverse a range of talent as we can and we believe that everyone brings something different to the table – so we’d love to know what makes you different. Such differences may mean we need to make changes to our process to allow you the best possible platform to succeed, and we are happy to cater to any reasonable adjustments you may require. You will find the section to let us know of these at the bottom of your application form or you can mention it directly to your recruiter at any stage and they will be happy to help. DevOps Engineer

Why Join Capco?

Capco is a global technology and business consultancy, focused on the financial services sector. We are passionate about helping our clients succeed in an ever-changing industry.

You will work on engaging projects with some of the largest banks in the world, on projects that will transform the financial services industry.

We offer:

A work culture focused on innovation and building lasting value for our clients and employees
Ongoing learning opportunities to help you acquire new skills or deepen existing expertise
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture
Enhanced and competitive family friendly benefits, including maternity / adoption / shared parental leave and paid leave for sickness, pregnancy loss, fertility treatment, menopause, and bereavement

DevOps at Capco

You’ll be part of excellent teams developing the new financial services apps, having the opportunity to work on exciting greenfield projects as well as on established Tier1 banks applications already adopted by millions of users.

You will be able to work on automating and optimising DevOps processes, improving your knowledge and skills to become an expert on CI/CD.

You’ll be able to work across different technology stacks, ranging from serverless deployments through to on-premise private cloud deployments.

You will also have the opportunity to learn and work with other mobile technologies whenever you want to wide your expertise.

We offer you the opportunity to train with the best courses and portals available online and get certified becoming the best version of DevOps engineer you can.

About you

Capco is looking for hardworking, innovative, and creative people to join our Digital Engineering team.

We'd also like to see:

Practical experience of engineering best practices, while being obsessed with continuous improvement.
Deep technical knowledge of two or more technologies and is curious to learn other parts of the stack.
Experience delivering software/technology projects leveraging Agile methodologies
You have personally made valuable contributions to products, solutions and teams and can articulate the value to customers.
You have played a role in the delivery of critical business applications and ideally customer facing applications.
You can communicate complex ideas to non-experts with eloquence and confidence.
You bring an awareness and understanding of new technologies being used in finance and other industries and loves to experiment.
A passion for being part of the engineering team that is forming the future of finance.

Skills & Expertise

You will have experience working with some of the following Methodologies/Technologies.

Knowledgeable in the Software Development Lifecycle with both a Development and Operations mindset
Hands on development experience in at least one object-orientated language e.g., Java/C#, JavaScript, Golang.
Understanding of containerisation and aware of container orchestration concepts, including hands on Docker experience.
A strong grasp on infrastructure as code, as well as techniques including Terraform and CloudFormation.
Hands on experience of using scripting with Python, Groovy to build CI/CD pipelines on Jenkins, CircleCI, GoCD.
Understanding of application and system monitoring tools with experience of auto-healing, autoscaling and predictive monitoring
Experience using version control software such as Git.
Experience using AWS, GCP and/or Azure
Experience in Automation and Configuration Management tools such as Ansible, Chef, Puppet or Helm.

Nice to have skills

Hands on Test Orchestration experience with Cucumber, Karate or Selenium.
TDD or BDD understanding and how to enable and orchestrate the different types of tests required by the quality phase.
Understanding of CSP networking and security features and services
Experience/understanding of Kubernetes, Istio and knowledge of related tools (Kiali, Fortio etc).

The Company
Imburse was founded in Switzerland in February 2018. We are backed by specialist Tech VC investors that include Addition, Lakestar, DST, Accenture Ventures and Guidewire.

We are set for rapid growth and offer:
A game-changing platform and productAn expanding global community of loyal enterprise clientsStrategic partnerships with a comprehensive A-list of partners spanning the entire global payments ecosystemA highly engaged team with an inclusive and winning cultureRapidly increasing market momentumExperienced investors, proven in supporting hypergrowth unicorns and tech scale-ups

With the hubs in Zurich, London and Lisbon, we already count large multinationals as clients. Our ground-breaking platform and unique approach are set to transform the way businesses around the world access and derive value from the global payments ecosystem.

Become a part of our story as we change the payments world forever.
The Role
Location: London hub, with the flexibility to work remotely.
Salary: Up to £75k dependent on experience
At Imburse we are on a steep growth trajectory, and with that comes the need to build a platform that can scale rapidly. We are currently looking for DevOps Engineers for our growing team.

You will be part of a squad with responsibility for designing, implementing and maintaining the infrastructure and automation processes which form the foundations of the Imburse platform.
You will be an evangelist of DevOps principles and enable our application development teams to deliver new features to our clients in a robust, secure and streamlined manner. You will enable teams to “shift left” and ensure Imburse stays ahead of its competitors by providing a bleeding-edge platform upon which it delivers its services to clients.
You will take ownership of our infrastructure-as-code configurations, CICD pipelines, Kubernetes manifests, automation scripts, and be responsible for ensuring that our cloud platforms are secure, resilient and scalable.
Our current platform stack includes:Cloud infrastructure hosted in Microsoft AzureInfrastructure-as-code via Terraform and PowerShell/Bash scriptsCICD pipelines using GitHub, Azure DevOps and ArgoCDApplications hosted in Kubernetes (AKS)Monitoring provided by DataDog, Azure Monitor and OpsGenie
What you will need
3+ years of commercial experience
Experience maintaining cloud platforms in Microsoft Azure
Experience authoring and maintaining infrastructure-as-code configurations in Terraform
Experience building CICD pipelines in a relevant framework (preferably Azure DevOps)
Skilled at scripting using relevant languages (preferably PowerShell or Bash)
Comfortable using the command line and CLIs
Experience designing, implementing and maintaining cloud platforms that are secure, resilient and scalable
Strong Docker and Kubernetes experience
Experience with identity management in Azure Active Directory and implementing Role-Based Access Controls (RBAC)
Experience with Helm charts and ArgoCD is preferable
Familiarity with GitOps practices
Ability to independently gather technical requirements and formulate a plan to deliver them
Confidence in analysing and questioning the assumptions and justifications behind technical specifications/implementations, with an open mind to considering alternative approaches which may be a better fit
Willingness to share out-of-hours on-call responsibilities with the team
Be an evangelist of DevOps principles who strives to enable teams to perform to the best of their ability
Don’t worry if you don’t have experience in all of the skills listed, we are open to a wide range of candidates with all levels of experience. If you think you’d be a good fit, send us your CV.
Our UK benefits include:
Company Stock Options
Company funded Private Medical Insurance (including dental and optical) and 5 x Life Insurance
€750 personal learning budget per annum to support your professional development
€500 work from home set up budget on joining
Enhanced parental leave pay
Salary Sacrifice Schemes: Cycle to Work, Nursery, Gym Membership and Season Ticket Loans
Flexible working: choose a home/office and working hours set up that suits your needs
4% company pension contribution
25 days annual leave (in addition to public holidays) plus an extra day for your birthday
Half days on Christmas Eve and New Year’s Eve
A Perkbox subscription that provides great perks, discounts and a wellbeing platform
Plenty of (Covid permitting) company social events
The Hiring Process
Apply online and, if a good match, our People team will reach out for an initial chat
A complete-at-home technical exercise to test your knowledge
Interview with the DevOps engineering team lead
Final stage interview with some of our Management Team
Offer
One last thing
Don’t dress up, don’t tailor your CV, don’t change a thing. Just be you. It’s who we want. The Company

Job Description Summary
Job Summary:

We're looking for driven individuals to tackle a DevOps Lead Engineering role, helping to deliver exciting customer driven solutions. From our DevOps team we lead the way in defining the best of new technology offerings, working closely with our Engineering Leads to collectively drive the tooling agenda whilst balancing the requirements of the UKs leading retail bank. The ultimate measure of success for us is leveraging these best of breed software and platform solutions so that we can continuously improve how we deliver market leading applications for our customers.
Job Description
Our Mission
We're on a journey to build the bank of the future, and we need your help. We’re continuing our extensive transformation Programme, with an investment of £3bn, redefining what a bank is from the inside out. Become part of our diverse team, and you'll experience a rare opportunity to impact the lives of more than 26 million customers through brands including Lloyds Bank, Halifax, Bank of Scotland and Scottish Widows. We need people who can make this transformation a reality.
Where does the role sit and what can I expect in the role?
In the Payments Services Platform, our mission is to provide compliant and efficient payments capabilities for the Group and drive innovation to enable customers to move money confidently, quickly and securely. The Payments Services Platform sits within Business & Commercial Banking and plays a critical role in providing services across the whole Group.
You’ll be presented with technical challenges on a scale unmatched in other industry sectors, but with this also the satisfaction of knowing your expertise will be making a difference to millions of customers. It’s a very hands-on role, with your time spread among short term support-related tasks, longer-term initiatives, problem-solving, optimising, forecasting, planning for the future and personal development, as well as leading others. There really is no such thing as a typical day as a DevOps Engineer in our team!
Key Capabilities
We're looking for the following qualities from our Senior DevOps Engineer
Behaviours & Competencies
Hands-on experience in delivering DevOps pipeline for the feature teams and supporting them in this journey
Thought leadership in all aspects of DevOps tooling. This will involve defining and contributing to the overall strategy of the Group
Collaborating with Engineering teams to up-skill their capabilities in their relevant technology area
Taking ownership of specific problems and delivering customer focused outcomes
Being an ambassador for the DevOps brand both internally and externally to the division
What we're looking for in you
You're a team lead who can build relationships, work efficiently with others across a variety of domains, fields and locations, but also be able to work autonomously and proactively
You're passionate about technology and its application to real-world problems, such as software automation and delivery
You'll bring the right mind-set to the role.
What we're looking for on your CV?
An excellent understanding of the entire pipeline, both breadth and depth, and hands-on experience in modern web technologies - Terraform, Spinnaker, Jenkins, Docker and Kubernetes.
A deep and proven understanding of GIT, source code management and managing change.
Excellent knowledge and experience of agile development practices, continuous integration and delivery for fast and secure route to live.
A good understanding of how to craft low-latency, high-availability and performant applications and environments with specific knowledge on security and networks
Plus technical understanding of Spring boot, Maven, JSON, Kafka/WMQ, REST APIs, Database SQL, Helm, JKube.
We understand in such a diverse and disparate world no one person can be a specialist in all DevOps tooling. If you have the right technical background, a willingness to be part of a team dedicated to transforming the landscape and are willing to develop yourself then we want to hear from you!
So what can we offer you in return?
Whatever your aspiration, you can also expect excellent benefits, personal development and a career that's enriching and full of opportunity.
You'll also receive a package that includes
Discretionary bonus
Cash sum of 4% which you can exchange for a variety of benefits or simply take the cash
Private Medical Insurance
Pension, where we'll give up to a max of 15%
Share plans
30 days holiday plus bank holidays
Tempted to apply but something holding you back?
We ensure our workforce represents every corner of society and we celebrate diversity.
We further ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to join the application process.
Are you interested in joining us? Apply today, we'd love to hear from you...
Our continued commitment to helping Britain recover means that as a colleague you can make a difference to customers, businesses and communities.
Together we have a key role to play in shaping the bank of the future, whilst the scale and reach of our Group means you'll continue to have opportunities to learn, grow and develop.
We're focused on creating a values-led culture, and our approach to inclusion and diversity means that we all have the opportunity to make a real difference, together.
At Lloyds Banking Group, we're driven by a clear purpose; to help Britain recover. Across the Group, our colleagues are focused on making a difference to customers, businesses and communities. With us you'll have a key role to play in shaping the financial services of the future, whilst the scale and reach of our Group means you'll have many opportunities to learn, grow and develop.
We're focused on creating a values-led culture and are committed to building a workforce which reflects the diversity of the customers and communities we serve. Together we’re building a truly inclusive workplace where all of our colleagues have the opportunity to make a real difference. End Date

Whatever your aspiration, you can also expect excellent benefits, personal development and a career that's enriching and full of opportunity.
You'll also receive a package that includes
Discretionary bonus
Cash sum of 4% which you can exchange for a variety of benefits or simply take the cash
Private Medical Insurance
Pension, where we'll give up to a max of 15%
Share plans
30 days holiday plus bank holidays
Tempted to apply but something holding you back?
We ensure our workforce represents every corner of society and we celebrate diversity.
We further ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to join the application process.
Are you interested in joining us? Apply today, we'd love to hear from you...
Our continued commitment to helping Britain recover means that as a colleague you can make a difference to customers, businesses and communities.
Together we have a key role to play in shaping the bank of the future, whilst the scale and reach of our Group means you'll continue to have opportunities to learn, grow and develop.
We're focused on creating a values-led culture, and our approach to inclusion and diversity means that we all have the opportunity to make a real difference, together.
At Lloyds Banking Group, we're driven by a clear purpose; to help Britain recover. Across the Group, our colleagues are focused on making a difference to customers, businesses and communities. With us you'll have a key role to play in shaping the financial services of the future, whilst the scale and reach of our Group means you'll have many opportunities to learn, grow and develop.
We're focused on creating a values-led culture and are committed to building a workforce which reflects the diversity of the customers and communities we serve. Together we’re building a truly inclusive workplace where all of our colleagues have the opportunity to make a real difference. End Date
Tuesday 30 August 2022
Salary Range
£68,139 - £98,423
Agile Working Options
Other Agile Working Arrangements / Open to Discussion
Job Description Summary
Job Summary:

We're looking for driven individuals to tackle a DevOps Lead Engineering role, helping to deliver exciting customer driven solutions. From our DevOps team we lead the way in defining the best of new technology offerings, working closely with our Engineering Leads to collectively drive the tooling agenda whilst balancing the requirements of the UKs leading retail bank. The ultimate measure of success for us is leveraging these best of breed software and platform solutions so that we can continuously improve how we deliver market leading applications for our customers.
Job Description
Our Mission
We're on a journey to build the bank of the future, and we need your help. We’re continuing our extensive transformation Programme, with an investment of £3bn, redefining what a bank is from the inside out. Become part of our diverse team, and you'll experience a rare opportunity to impact the lives of more than 26 million customers through brands including Lloyds Bank, Halifax, Bank of Scotland and Scottish Widows. We need people who can make this transformation a reality.
Where does the role sit and what can I expect in the role?
In the Payments Services Platform, our mission is to provide compliant and efficient payments capabilities for the Group and drive innovation to enable customers to move money confidently, quickly and securely. The Payments Services Platform sits within Business & Commercial Banking and plays a critical role in providing services across the whole Group.
You’ll be presented with technical challenges on a scale unmatched in other industry sectors, but with this also the satisfaction of knowing your expertise will be making a difference to millions of customers. It’s a very hands-on role, with your time spread among short term support-related tasks, longer-term initiatives, problem-solving, optimising, forecasting, planning for the future and personal development, as well as leading others. There really is no such thing as a typical day as a DevOps Engineer in our team!
Key Capabilities
We're looking for the following qualities from our Senior DevOps Engineer
Behaviours & Competencies
Hands-on experience in delivering DevOps pipeline for the feature teams and supporting them in this journey
Thought leadership in all aspects of DevOps tooling. This will involve defining and contributing to the overall strategy of the Group
Collaborating with Engineering teams to up-skill their capabilities in their relevant technology area
Taking ownership of specific problems and delivering customer focused outcomes
Being an ambassador for the DevOps brand both internally and externally to the division
What we're looking for in you
You're a team lead who can build relationships, work efficiently with others across a variety of domains, fields and locations, but also be able to work autonomously and proactively
You're passionate about technology and its application to real-world problems, such as software automation and delivery
You'll bring the right mind-set to the role.
What we're looking for on your CV?
An excellent understanding of the entire pipeline, both breadth and depth, and hands-on experience in modern web technologies - Terraform, Spinnaker, Jenkins, Docker and Kubernetes.
A deep and proven understanding of GIT, source code management and managing change.
Excellent knowledge and experience of agile development practices, continuous integration and delivery for fast and secure route to live.
A good understanding of how to craft low-latency, high-availability and performant applications and environments with specific knowledge on security and networks
Plus technical understanding of Spring boot, Maven, JSON, Kafka/WMQ, REST APIs, Database SQL, Helm, JKube.
We understand in such a diverse and disparate world no one person can be a specialist in all DevOps tooling. If you have the right technical background, a willingness to be part of a team dedicated to transforming the landscape and are willing to develop yourself then we want to hear from you!
So what can we offer you in return?
Whatever your aspiration, you can also expect excellent benefits, personal development and a career that's enriching and full of opportunity.
You'll also receive a package that includes
Discretionary bonus
Cash sum of 4% which you can exchange for a variety of benefits or simply take the cash
Private Medical Insurance
Pension, where we'll give up to a max of 15%
Share plans
30 days holiday plus bank holidays
Tempted to apply but something holding you back?
We ensure our workforce represents every corner of society and we celebrate diversity.
We further ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to join the application process.
Are you interested in joining us? Apply today, we'd love to hear from you...
Our continued commitment to helping Britain recover means that as a colleague you can make a difference to customers, businesses and communities.
Together we have a key role to play in shaping the bank of the future, whilst the scale and reach of our Group means you'll continue to have opportunities to learn, grow and develop.
We're focused on creating a values-led culture, and our approach to inclusion and diversity means that we all have the opportunity to make a real difference, together.

We're focused on creating a values-led culture and are committed to building a workforce which reflects the diversity of the customers and communities we serve. Together we’re building a truly inclusive workplace where all of our colleagues have the opportunity to make a real difference. End Date

listing_jobDesc:
Location: Manor Royal Crawley, United Kingdom
In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible.
Together we offer fantastic opportunities for committed employees to learn and develop their career with us. At Thales UK, we research, develop, and supply technology and services that impact the lives of millions of people each day to make life better, and keep us safer. We innovate across five major industries; Aerospace, Defence, Ground Transportation, Security and Space. Your health and well-being matters to us and that’s why we offer you the flexibility to do what’s important to you; whether that’s part time hours, job sharing, home working, or the ability to flex your start and finish times. Where possible, we support a working pattern that suits your lifestyle and helps you reach your ambitions.
DevOps Engineer
Locations – Crawley, Cheadle, Reading, Glasgow, Belfast, Templecombe, Bristol, Doncaster, Ebbw Vale (With Flexible Hybrid/Remote Working)
Who are we and what do we do?
In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other.
Together we offer fantastic opportunities for committed employees to learn and develop their career with us. At Thales UK, we research, develop, and supply technology and services that impact the lives of millions of people each day to make life better, and keep us safer. We innovate across five major industries; Aerospace, Defence, Ground Transportation, Security and Space.
Your health, well-being and work/life balance matters to us and that’s why we offer you as much flexibility as possible regarding remote and hybrid working. Where possible, we support a working pattern that suits your lifestyle and helps you reach your ambitions. We offer flexible start and finish times, the opportunity to job share and many of our roles can also be worked on a part time basis.
The Role
Thales is transforming to a cloud-operating environment. In this new role, you’ll be helping to build and support a digital platform within the UK Digital Competence Centre (Best-In-Class), shaping the tools and processes for our development teams moving into DevSecOps ways of working.
As a DevOps Engineer, you will work as part of an agile development team, helping to build secure and resilient application infrastructure providing an outstanding experience for our customers and engineering teams.
Your career could develop within DCC as it continues to grow, or take you into the business as the digital and technical agenda develops.
Thales is a great place to work so diversity, integrity and a passion for what we do are very important drivers for us. Whether you’ve been a DevOps professional for many years or have had some recent exposure in your last role that you would like to build on, we would love to hear from you.
Responsibilities
Design and build industry leading cloud-based infrastructure on Azure
Using modern DevOps practices, create and manage secure, low maintenance environments in cloud
Create and maintain development tools to enable effective and efficient CI/CD pipelines
Help shape and grow cloud estate, with no legacy systems to support
Automate and improve development and release process
Support release and production environment where necessary
Maintaining the technical solution for infrastructure
Define and develop the means so that products are correctly deployed respecting established rules.
Support delivery teams with automated tools and scripts to provision infrastructure resources (compute, network & storage) in a simple and efficient manner.
Securing the platform infrastructure
Understand the functional context of the product up to the point of challenging functional decisions
Ensure that operational best practices (supervision/monitoring, backups, archives, log management) are implemented.
Ensure the Squad is informed and aware of operational constraints, and if required train the team on those topics.
Ensuring Security best practises are being upheld
Educate and communicate with the wider Thales UK community
Typical Benefits
Competitive Salary
Pension – Thales match, plus 1%, with a max contribution of 7%
Health Insurance – 50% of Salary for 5 years
Life Assurance – 2 x Minimum (higher if part of the Pension Scheme)
Private Medical Insurance
Annual Leave 201 hours + 1 Company day (27 Days + Bank Holidays)
Annual Bonus
37 Hours per week. (Half Day Friday typically)
Excellent Maternity and Paternity Support
Experience Required
We recruit DevOps Engineers and Managers at many levels so we would be very interested to hear from you regardless of your length of experience.
Active interest in the cloud operating environment; able to show that you have undertaken self-development in this discipline
Able to demonstrate a good understanding of cloud infrastructure as a service and cloud platform as a service
Active ability and interest in scripting languages
Strong experience with Cloud infrastructure on Azure
Experience with Infrastructure as Code using Terraform or Ansible
Experience with build and CI/CD tools and pipelines such Bitbucket, Git, Jenkins, Jira, Maven, Nexus, SonarQube)
Exposure to application development.
Good understanding of Cloud design patterns and have used them solve to complex problems
Security Requirements
In line with Thales' Baseline Security requirements, candidates will be asked to provide evidence of identity, eligibility to work in the UK and employment and/or education history for up to three years. Some vacancies may require full Security Clearance which can require further evidence to be provided. For further details of the evidence required to apply for Baseline and Security Clearance please refer to the Defence Business Services National Security Vetting (DBS NSV) Agency.
In line with Thales' Baseline Security requirements, candidates will be asked to provide evidence of identity, eligibility to work in the UK and employment and/or education history for up to three years. Some vacancies may require full Security Clearance which can require further evidence to be provided. For further details of the evidence required to apply for Baseline and Security Clearance please refer to the Defence Business Services National Security Vetting (DBS NSV) Agency.
At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working.
Thales UK is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free recruitment process. We will provide reasonable adjustments and support to ensure neuro-diverse applicants or those with a disability or long-term condition can be their best during the recruitment process. To request an adjustment, if you need this job advert in an alternative format or if you have any questions about the recruitment process, please contact Resourcing Ops for mid to senior roles, or the Early Careers Team for graduate and apprentice roles.

About Ekco:
 Founded in 2016 Ekco is now one of the fastest growing cloud solution providers in Europe!


We specialise in enabling companies to progress along the path of cloud maturity, managing transformation and driving better outcomes from our customers’ existing technology investments.

️ In a few words, we take businesses to the cloud and back!


 We have 350+ highly talented and supportive colleagues (and counting) across a number of regional offices in the UK, Benelux & Ireland.
About the role:
We are seeking a Cloud / DevOps Engineer to join our fast growing team.
Architecture and Orchestration
Our clients are looking for assistance navigating the vast array of services available within a public cloud, as well as expert setup and configuration in line with best-practice guidelines. The ideal candidate will act as one of the 'Product Champions' for Cloud services throughout the Ekco Group.


Customer Support & Service Delivery
One of the key aspects of the role will be to assist new and existing customers on their journey to the public cloud from either on-prem or other private or public cloud services and to deploy new environments or services. We are also seeing a need to support customers with the more niche aspects of public cloud, utilising the myriad of 'as a Service' offerings within the stack and across the marketplace.


Also, Ekco provides a first-class service to customers, providing responsive, agile support. Another one of your responsibilities is to respond to customers’ needs including incident management, change management and work with our account managers to ensure the customers enjoy an awesome service.


Essential Skills / Experience:

3+ years public cloud environment design, deployment, and support experience
Good working knowledge of core public cloud infrastructure components
Deployment of Vnets/VPC’s
Knowledge of cloud security-related services - Load Balancers, Secrets Management, Firewalls,
Experienced with container technologies and tools such as Docker running on Fargate, ECS, and Kubernetes (EKS)
Automation experience using Cloudformation, Ansible, Puppet, or other similar tools
Experienced in using version control software (Gitlab/Github) for configuration management
Configuring Monitoring, Alerting and Dashboarding using Cloudwatch, Monitor, Metrics Collection, and Log Management, or other tools
Scripting experience in Powershell/Python or equivalent
Confident in obtaining requirements and creating designs to meet technical challenges for our customers
Translate general infrastructure concepts through a deep understanding of Public Cloud toolsets and be able to advise/recommend the appropriate solutions PaaS, IaaS, or other services to use for specific deployments


Bonus points if you have experience with:

Building and deploying IAC and Code Pipelines
Building highly available scalable solutions
Migrating systems from traditional Infrastructure to AWS

Azure/AWS Well-Architected Framework
Knowledge of Rancher and Harbour


Why Ekco:


 Ranked as Ireland's 4th fastest growing technology company in the Deloitte Fast50 Awards
️ VMware & Veeam top partner status
Ekco are committed to cultivating an environment that promotes diversity, equality, inclusion and belonging

 We recognise the value of internal mobility and encourage opportunities for internal development & progression

Employee perks:


 Learning & development - Unlimited access to Udemy learning platform
️ Time off - 25 days leave + public holidays
 x1 day Birthday leave per year
 Private Medical Healthcare with Bupa (post probation)

For information on our Recruitment Privacy Policy, please refer to our recruiting privacy policy link About Ekco:
 Founded in 2016 Ekco is now one of the fastest growing cloud solution providers in Europe!


We specialise in enabling companies to progress along the path of cloud maturity, managing transformation and driving better outcomes from our customers’ existing technology investments.

️ In a few words, we take businesses to the cloud and back!


 We have 350+ highly talented and supportive colleagues (and counting) across a number of regional offices in the UK, Benelux & Ireland.
About the role:
We are seeking a Cloud / DevOps Engineer to join our fast growing team.
Architecture and Orchestration
Our clients are looking for assistance navigating the vast array of services available within a public cloud, as well as expert setup and configuration in line with best-practice guidelines. The ideal candidate will act as one of the 'Product Champions' for Cloud services throughout the Ekco Group.


Customer Support & Service Delivery
One of the key aspects of the role will be to assist new and existing customers on their journey to the public cloud from either on-prem or other private or public cloud services and to deploy new environments or services. We are also seeing a need to support customers with the more niche aspects of public cloud, utilising the myriad of 'as a Service' offerings within the stack and across the marketplace.


Also, Ekco provides a first-class service to customers, providing responsive, agile support. Another one of your responsibilities is to respond to customers’ needs including incident management, change management and work with our account managers to ensure the customers enjoy an awesome service.


Essential Skills / Experience:

3+ years public cloud environment design, deployment, and support experience
Good working knowledge of core public cloud infrastructure components
Deployment of Vnets/VPC’s
Knowledge of cloud security-related services - Load Balancers, Secrets Management, Firewalls,
Experienced with container technologies and tools such as Docker running on Fargate, ECS, and Kubernetes (EKS)
Automation experience using Cloudformation, Ansible, Puppet, or other similar tools
Experienced in using version control software (Gitlab/Github) for configuration management
Configuring Monitoring, Alerting and Dashboarding using Cloudwatch, Monitor, Metrics Collection, and Log Management, or other tools
Scripting experience in Powershell/Python or equivalent
Confident in obtaining requirements and creating designs to meet technical challenges for our customers
Translate general infrastructure concepts through a deep understanding of Public Cloud toolsets and be able to advise/recommend the appropriate solutions PaaS, IaaS, or other services to use for specific deployments


Bonus points if you have experience with:

Building and deploying IAC and Code Pipelines
Building highly available scalable solutions
Migrating systems from traditional Infrastructure to AWS

Azure/AWS Well-Architected Framework
Knowledge of Rancher and Harbour

️ VMware & Veeam top partner status

Do you want to be part of team of pathfinders bringing cutting edge transformation to world leading organisations across Defence and Commercial sectors?At Geollect we put innovation at the heart of everything we do, coupled with our core values of client value creation, respect for the individual, best people, integrity, and stewardship, we offer careers that provide accelerated opportunities for career growth and job satisfaction.Our mission is to empower clients to make faster, more accurate and informed decisions. We are creating a paradigm shift in the they approach complex operational problems with creative, technological interventions, which deliver enduring meaning and value. More data doesn’t always lead to more clarity. Making informed, in-the-moment decisions requires understanding, interpretation, and expertise.At Geollect, we turn complex geospatial intelligence into a competitive advantage. Combining place-based data with cutting edge AI, clear visualisation, and human interpretation, we deliver the insights our clients need to prevent, protect, and improve. It’s what makes us leaders in our field.“We are at the leading edge of a global, geospatial intelligence revolution. Our products change the way organisations think and communicate by blending multiple layers of data into one place. The accuracy of real-time information, pinpoint location certainty and machine learning offer insights and advanced foresights you won’t get from anyone else, meaning our clients know where, know first and know more.” - Cate Gwilliam – Chief Executive Officer & Co-FounderJob DescriptionWe are seeking a forward thinking Platform Engineer to play an integral role in developing, improving, and owning our technology and services. The role will involve ensuring our existing services, hosted on AWS, remain performant and secure, as well as having an influential role in the development of future projects. You will work closely with our Data Science and Development teams ensuring we continue to deliver world leading solutions.If you’re talented with terraform, dazzling at DevOps, and adept with AWS cloud technologies you’re encouraged to reach out, especially if you’re wanting to have fun whilst doing it! Geollect is a young and sparky organisation, and we’re proud of our culture; we believe everyone should have a place to work where they can be productive with psychological safety. An interest in geospatial technologies would be especially welcome.We also invite you to check out examples of how the products you will help build are used here, and testimonials from the existing Geollect team here If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us.Technical Skills: Have a strong desire and ability to pick up and learn new tools quickly and keep your knowledge currentAt least 2 years AWS experienceAWS certifications highly desirable, but not essentialExperience of working in a DevOps environment, supporting developers CI/CD pipelines and IaC tools such as Terraform.Experience of AWS management tools and key services, such as ECS, EC2, Lambda, RDS, IAM, Networking etcExperience with containerization tools (Docker)Awareness of different application architectures and how different cloud architectures may or may not support themYou will be comfortable presenting solutions both in written documents and workshop situations, leading and facilitating discussions around public cloud solutions at a high levelHelp more junior team members to understand best software practices and share skillsExperience working with and applying Agile methodologiesBig Data experience, architecting and maintaining big data pipelines, understanding of best practices around big dataDesirable skills and qualificationsExperience of languages such as Python and JavaScript would be usefulUnderstanding of other public clouds such as Azure and GCP a bonusGeollect’s success draws upon the diverse viewpoints, skills, and experiences of our employees. reliably.RequirementsExcellent communication and collaboration skills, as you will be working with the engineering team and product managers to deliver and support Saas productAbility to design and implement a good build and deployment pipeline (CI/CD)Design and implement with the future in mind to future proof our overall B2B SaaS platform with our engineering team to support more clients in futureExperience with building CI/CD pipeline for a multi-tenant SaaS productWe are currently migrating the product platform from GCP to AWS, so experience in cloud migration will helpeiTech StackIaas: Terraform, TerragruntGood knowledge of KubernetesGithub ActionAWS CI/CD: CodeDeploy, CodeBuild, LambdaAWS platform: Cloud Front, API gateway, SSO, Cognito (probably)AWS: Kinesis, Glue, Lambda, S3, Fargate, ECSAWS: RDS(Postgres), OpenSearchGCP: GKE, Cloud Storage, Cloud BuildFront end build: npm/yarnBenefitsHighly Competitive salaryPension25 days holiday (+ 8 bank holidays)Dynamic working environmentFlexible Working and Remote FriendlyWith Vibrant on-site cultureWhen on site - the staff canteen, Rock Climbing Gym, Spin Studio and Yoga ClassesEquipment provided – hi-spec Macbook or thinkpad teamProfessional & Technical DevelopmentSkills & management trainingFriday afternoon L&D timePeopleThe definition of teamwork has been redefined and executed to a high level here, you’ll be working collaboratively with cross functional teams as you all plan the best path to take when it comes to technologies, approaches, processes etc. Whether it be as a group, or as an individual, people really dig in here and go the extra mile because they all believe that the company can and will fulfil its potential. It is a fun environment, with team lunches and events taking place often, and being your own self is encouraged because they understand the value that brings to the business. Accountability, working toward the collective goal, and always striving for innovation, but most importantly being caring toward your work and your colleagues are values that are pushed through here, and it’s one of the many reasons we are proud to have them as an Orbit client; we believe in the journey and want to be a part of it too.*Company*By joining this company, you will take on a genuine challenge that you will be able to look back upon and say that you have had a genuine influence in the day-to-day practices and standards of an exciting and innovative Healthtech company. The progression in yourself as a professional that you will see is amazing, and it’s something that is rare to come across in other companies. The company is right on the cusp of really breaking boundaries in their field, on the edge of true scalability, and will give you the flexibility in what technologies you work with. The short-term gain is that you will be the solution to a lot of creative technological challenges, as well as soft-skill hurdles, that in the long-term will greatly reward you in terms of actual career progression and professional self-development.If you are interested in this role then please apply now or contact daniel@weorbit.ai direct for further information.Job Type: Full-timePay: £65,000.00-£80,000.00 per year Show more

Our people work differently depending on their jobs and needs. From home working to job sharing, visit the remote and flexible working page on our website to find out more.
This role is based in the United Kingdom and as such all normal working days must be carried out in the United Kingdom.
Join us as a DevOps Engineer
This is an excellent opportunity to contribute to building our DevOps engineering capability, culture and mindsets within the bank
Promoting technical and cultural change, you’ll be accelerating learning journeys and the progressive adoption of our DevOps centre of excellence technical practices and techniques
As you build relationships with your colleagues, you’ll be making sure that decisions are commercially focused and create long term value for the bank
What you'll do
As a DevOps Engineer, you’ll be mentoring and coaching feature and platform teams to higher levels of DevOps capability to drive continuous improvements and enhance the end customer experience. You’ll assess their current levels of DevOps technical capability to identify any gaps, and support them in closing these through learning workshops and training.
You’ll also be:
Demonstrating how to measure, understand and visualise the flow and delivery of value through adopting DevOps tools, techniques and processes
Advising teams across platform and within the centre of excellence on which DevOps capability uplifts would be best suited to their needs and abilities
Providing feedback that builds on policies, standards, practices and associated DevOps tooling
Making sure decisions made are based on robust data, return on investment and value measures that demonstrate thoughtful and intelligent cost management
The skills you'll need
We’re looking for someone with experience of setting up and maintaining Cloud infrastructure and integrating with complex networks in addition to setting up and maturing CI/CD Toolchains. Ideally you will have AWS certification and have experience of working with Gitlab.
You’ll also have knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes and an understanding of Jenkins would be an added advantage. You’ll ideally have knowledge of Mobile CI/CD and tools including Fastlane or Bitrise.
You’ll also demonstrate:
Knowledge and comfort with designing and implementing to satisfy the requirements across all layers of the tech stack from networking, cloud infrastructure management, IAM, IT Security, DevOps Tool-chain best practices and maintenance.
Experience with designing and implementing new/greenfield AWS Cloud environments built with Terraform Enterprise.
Experience and knowledge of common DevOps Tooling such as Gitlab (creating pipelines but also utilising the full suite of functionality in Gitlab’s ultimate license
If you need any adjustments to support your application, such as information in alternative formats or special requirements to access our buildings, or if you’re eligible under the Disability Confident Scheme please contact us and we’ll do everything we can to help. Engineer - DevOps

Job Grade: Individual Contributing Engineer 2 (IC2)
Responsibilities
Create / Maintain Kubernetes clusters
Create / Maintain / Deploy helm charts for internal applications
Monitor / Update / Work On assigned tickets from Engineering teams
Maintain / Troubleshoot automation and management scripts (Python, Bash,
Ansible)
Maintain / Troubleshoot CI/CD pipeline (GitHub Actions)
Create / Maintain / Troubleshoot VPN Access Control Lists using Tailscale
Create / Maintain / Troubleshoot DNS Records using OctoDNS (yaml)
Create / Maintain / Troubleshoot internal monitoring systems (Prometheus)
Create / Maintain / Troubleshoot cloud servers (ensure maximum uptime/stability)
Create / Maintain documentation for the above systems
Provide Tier 2 support for Professional Services team
Technical Requirements
2+ years experience with RHEL or Debian based OS
1+ years experience with Ansible, Chef, or Puppet (Ansbile preferred)
1+ years experience with running Docker containers
Experience with Prometheus
Experience with Bash and Python
Experience with cloud providers AWS, Azure, or GCP (AWS preferred)
Experience with GitHub or GitLab (GitHub Preferred)
Engineer - DevOps 2
Experience with CI/CD Systems (GitHub Actions preferred)
Experience with Git version control system
Optional Requirements
Experience with Test Rails.
Behavioral Expectations
Positive and solution-oriented mindset.
Mastery of English language, both oral and written.
Ability to communicate successfully with remote teams.
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced changing environment.
Active participation in daily stand-ups.
Provide daily updates in team update system.
A work ethic which includes honesty, integrity and maintains confidentiality at all
times.
Ability to work within a hybrid Agile / Waterfall development methodology.
Key Performance Indicators
Levels
Title Job Grade
Associate Engineer - DevOps IC1
Engineer - DevOps IC2
Senior Engineer - DevOps IC3
Staff Engineer - DevOps IC4
Principal Engineer - DevOps IC5
Promotion Criteria
Engineer - DevOps 3
Minimum time in grade 12 months (before promotion consideration).
Ability to meet 70% of the requirements of the next level.
Additional Information
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States
Ayasdi is not currently looking to provide sponsorship, now or at any time in the
future

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual

Excellent opportunity for candidates looking to build a career in the DevOps and cloud computing space by joining an experienced team of engineers who are working with the latest cloud technologies to continuously evolve the hosting infrastructure for Efficio’s proprietary SAAS platform.


The role will encompass a range of responsibilities from supporting strategic projects to adopt and embed new cloud products and practices into our infrastructure and development pipelines, to helping development teams run proofs-of-concepts with data-focussed tools, to managing BAU requests and monitoring the health and performance of our systems.

Efficio are further willing to support a successful candidate to achieve relevant professional certifications in the cloud and DevOps space.


This is a fantastic opportunity to join a top-tier company that recognises the value of investing in individuals and who are view their technology as the foundation for their strategic growth plans.

Essential Requirements Efficio are looking for a high-calibre individual with 1-2 years’ experience administering cloud computing environments, following either formal education or a switch to this space from another IT career path. They will have strong troubleshooting skills and be keen to push on towards the engineer and architect levels of cloud computing.


A successful candidate must have:

Hands on experience of cloud computing in a business setting

Proven experience of Linux systems administration; able to administer a typical LAMP stack

GIT version control inc. use of tools such as GitHub, GitLab etc

Some scripting/programming skills (any language)

Basic knowledge of networking and containerisation

Desirable RequirementsInfrastructure as Code (e.g. terraform, cloudformation)

Understanding of CI/CD principles and use of CI/CD tools

Agile project management methodology

Time Type: Full time
Worker Type: Employee
DO NOT USE. See Reward/Compensation team.
Junior DevOps Engineer
London
Who we are:
Technology Services at QBE is changing – fast. In a world that also throws out it’s unexpected twists and turns, QBE technology has been pushed to the forefront of the business value chain.
QBE’s investment in its platform and services have created a natural continuity environment that has elevated technology delivery even closer to the heart of its business value chain. This also allows its colleagues to set themselves up for a true work/life balance approach to their day to day and a healthy appetite for discovery, innovation and continuous improvement.
If office life is your thing, QBE Tech Services have a brand new shiny one! Based in the heart of Docklands, this has been designed around collaborative working and harbouring a culture more akin to that of a start-up. It needs to be seen to be appreciated. “Wows” and “Ooohhs” to be expected.
Our journey continues and the need for future proof thinking is greater than ever. Understanding the business needs and desired outcomes remains of upmost importance and will be key to the next phases of both of our growth as professionals.
The Opportunity:
We are seeking a Junior DevOps Engineer to help build out our cloud platform. The role will involve working with data scientists, python engineers, and I.T. professionals to develop and deliver full stack data science tools and applications within the business.
You’ll be working in an agile team collaboratively planning and implementing stories and strategies for improving all aspects of the infrastructure, such as our Google Cloud platform, CI/CD pipelines, and security tooling.
You’ll have a progressive attitude to delivering software and infrastructure, appreciating the importance of automating all aspects of the stack in an agile manner. You’ll combine understanding of the fundamentals of Linux systems and security principles, with a keen interest in the latest technologies and approaches to delivering software.
Your responsibilities for this role may include, but are not limited to:
Work on cloud infrastructure
Maintain CI/CD pipelines
Keep systems patched and software up to date
We are looking for an individual with a subset (not necessarily all) of the following:
Experience building infrastructure with Terraform
Working knowledge of cloud infrastructure
Experience in automated deployments and continuous integration
Knowledge of version control
Hands-on with Python as scripting language
Good communication skills
We are here to support you

We are here to support you We offer a range of benefits to help provide holistic support for your work life, whatever your circumstances. As an QBE employee you will have access to and benefit from:
‘Hybrid Working’ – a mix of working from home and in the office to enhance your work/life balance
Our ‘At My Best’ wellbeing program, including free holistic wellbeing coaching, nutritional, confidential counselling, financial and legal advice
QBE Pension scheme and private health cover
Discounts on insurance products, car hire, hotels, goods and services including benefits through our various sports and arts sponsorship partners
BCS Organisational Membership
Some of the award’s QBE are proud to have won include:
The British Computer Society 2021 Winners – Inspirational Individual of the Year; IT Service & Support Professional of the year
British Claims Awards 2022 Winner - InsurTech Award
Insurance Times Claims Excellence Awards 2022 Winner - Claims Product Solution of the Year
We are proud to have partnerships with organisations such as Stonewall and Working Families, and our commitment to the Women in Finance Charter, the UN Women’s Empowerment Principles and Race at Work charter helps keep us accountable and transparent.
Why QBE?
Working for us. Working for you.
We understand that one size doesn’t fit all and that priorities can change depending on your life stage. That is why our blend of wellbeing initiatives and benefits offer flexibility to suit what matters most to you. Offering a great range of benefits which enable you to bring your best self to work; including competitive salaries and bonus structures, health and well being programs, hybrid working for the flexibility of working from home and the office. In addition to this, we also offer flexible parental leave for both parents and have several employee network groups that support and empower our diverse workforce.
At QBE, we view our people as our most precious asset. We understand the importance of fostering a work environment that is responsive to the changing needs of today's workforce. QBE aims to build a workplace that is fair and inclusive because we want to attract and retain the best people to do the job, we have adopted flexible working across the company and welcome this conversation.
To find out more about why you should work for QBE, visit our careers website.

You’ll have a progressive attitude to delivering software and infrastructure, appreciating the importance of automating all aspects of the stack in an agile manner. You’ll combine understanding of the fundamentals of Linux systems and security principles, with a keen interest in the latest technologies and approaches to delivering software.
Your responsibilities for this role may include, but are not limited to:
Work on cloud infrastructure
Maintain CI/CD pipelines
Keep systems patched and software up to date
We are looking for an individual with a subset (not necessarily all) of the following:
Experience building infrastructure with Terraform
Working knowledge of cloud infrastructure
Experience in automated deployments and continuous integration
Knowledge of version control
Hands-on with Python as scripting language
Good communication skills
We are here to support you

We are here to support you We offer a range of benefits to help provide holistic support for your work life, whatever your circumstances. As an QBE employee you will have access to and benefit from:
‘Hybrid Working’ – a mix of working from home and in the office to enhance your work/life balance
Our ‘At My Best’ wellbeing program, including free holistic wellbeing coaching, nutritional, confidential counselling, financial and legal advice
QBE Pension scheme and private health cover
Discounts on insurance products, car hire, hotels, goods and services including benefits through our various sports and arts sponsorship partners
BCS Organisational Membership
Some of the award’s QBE are proud to have won include:
The British Computer Society 2021 Winners – Inspirational Individual of the Year; IT Service & Support Professional of the year
British Claims Awards 2022 Winner - InsurTech Award
Insurance Times Claims Excellence Awards 2022 Winner - Claims Product Solution of the Year
We are proud to have partnerships with organisations such as Stonewall and Working Families, and our commitment to the Women in Finance Charter, the UN Women’s Empowerment Principles and Race at Work charter helps keep us accountable and transparent.
Why QBE?
Working for us. Working for you.
We understand that one size doesn’t fit all and that priorities can change depending on your life stage. That is why our blend of wellbeing initiatives and benefits offer flexibility to suit what matters most to you. Offering a great range of benefits which enable you to bring your best self to work; including competitive salaries and bonus structures, health and well being programs, hybrid working for the flexibility of working from home and the office. In addition to this, we also offer flexible parental leave for both parents and have several employee network groups that support and empower our diverse workforce.
At QBE, we view our people as our most precious asset. We understand the importance of fostering a work environment that is responsive to the changing needs of today's workforce. QBE aims to build a workplace that is fair and inclusive because we want to attract and retain the best people to do the job, we have adopted flexible working across the company and welcome this conversation.
To find out more about why you should work for QBE, visit our careers website.

Mid-level DevOps Engineer III
Location: London, United Kingdom
Would you like to be part of an engineering team that develops and maintains our cloud and platform services?
Are you motivated by seeing how your work makes a difference to product delivery and customer outcomes?
About our Team
We are a growing, global team of 2000 entrepreneurial digital technologists. Collaborating in small agile teams, we have the freedom to leverage the latest technologies to build digital solutions. We create products that help scientists make breakthroughs and health professionals impact lives.
About the Role
As a DevOps Engineer, you will be working with colleagues from Elsevier’s Technology organization. Working collaboratively, you’ll be delivering shared solutions for infrastructure operations across our products and services. You will assist in the design, build and maintenance of application stacks for product teams working in this space.
Responsibilities
Working within our DevOps squad to ensure the reliability, scalability, performance and security of our platform and products
Identifying improvements to common tasks and self-service modules to allow teams to move at pace across the SDLC
Designing, building, and maintaining cost effective cloud environments for our organisation
Collaborating with central platform teams to support the onboarding of products to our platforms
Seeking out and implementing efficiencies to erase toil to allow more focus on project work and lasting improvements
Acting as an escalation point for internal and external customers to provide support for production issues
Key Requirements Needed for a DevOps Engineer
Have experience working in global cross-functional teams to solve problems at scale with innovative solutions
Have experience in implementing DevOps and SRE (Site Reliability Engineer) best-practices
Demonstrate experience in AWS, Linux, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform and GitHub
Have experience designing highly available and secure distributed systems that scale using AWS, Linux, and Kubernetes
Have experience in standardising and improving the deployment process using common platforms and CI/CD pipelines
Have an understanding of how tools like New Relic can help observe product performance and identify root causes
Work in a way that works for you
We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organisation. With an average length of service of 9 years, we are confident that we offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, shared parental leave, study assistance and sabbaticals, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and your long-term goals. Working remotely from home and at our office in a hybrid working style Working flexible hours - flexing the times you work in the day
Working with us
We are an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to help you succeed. Here, you will find an inclusive, agile, collaborative, innovative and fun environment, where everyone has a part to play. Regardless of the team you join, we promote a diverse environment with co-workers who are passionate about what they do, and how they do it.
Working for you
At Elsevier, we know that your wellbeing and happiness are key to a long and successful career. These are some of the benefits we are delighted to offer: Generous holiday allowance with the option to buy additional days Health screening, eye care vouchers and private medical benefits Wellbeing programs Life assurance Access to a competitive contributory pension scheme Long service awards Save As You Earn share option scheme Travel Season ticket loan Maternity, paternity and shared parental leave Access to emergency care for both the elderly and children RECARES days, giving you time to support the charities and causes that matter to you Access to employee resource groups with dedicated time to volunteer Access to extensive learning and development resources Access to employee discounts via Perks at Work
About Us
A global leader in information and analytics, we help researchers and healthcare professionals advance science and improve health outcomes for the benefit of society. Building on our publishing heritage, we combine quality information and vast data sets with analytics to support visionary science and research, health education and interactive learning, as well as exceptional healthcare and clinical practice. At Elsevier, your work contributes to the world’s grand challenges and a more sustainable future. We harness innovative technologies to support science and healthcare to partner for a better world.
Join Us
Are you ready to help us progress science and health? Our technology leads to innovation, so join a forward-thinking digital business that is tackling world-scale challenges and align your ambitions with our passion for driving global knowledge-sharing.
-
Elsevier is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. If a qualified individual with a disability or disabled veteran needs a reasonable accommodation to use or access our online system, that individual should please contact accommodations@relx.com or if you are based in the US you may also contact us on 1.855.833.5120.

Role – DevOps Engineer Cashroom LimitedOur MissionAt Cashroom, our mission is to free lawyers from the complexities of Legal Accounting.About UsLaw firms have the challenge of managing their clients’ money and also the firm’s money. Their procedures for doing so are regulated by the Solicitors Regulatory Authority (SRA) in England and Law Society of Scotland in Scotland and there are significant consequences on the law firms if the regulations are not applied correctly - that’s where we come in. Cashroom is an outsourced legal cashiering firm and we provide an expert service, managing these monies on behalf of law firms in accordance with the published regulations.Our technology helps lawyers and cashiers manage these funds in a secure, efficient and compliant manner. Cashroom has recently acquired a technology startup to help further develop our capabilities in this space, and deliver an excellent product experience to our clients and staff alike.We continue to experience significant business growth with our body of clients growing month on month and we want you to help us enable that growth in terms of identifying and delivering business efficiencies, and creating the capacity for continued success in the future.We have offices in Livingston, Scotland and Skelmersdale, England but our team is distributed and we work as a remote team. This provides great benefits and flexibility to work where you perform best, whether that be in the office, at home or a combination of both. Occasional travel to office may be required from time to time, when COVID permits.We know that passionate and driven people excel when they’re all pulling in the same direction, which is why we strongly believe in our Cashroom values. These outline what we are, how we do things and where we want to be.Teamwork– We build relationships based on trust, honesty, respect and encouragement, and we have fun!Loyalty– We show commitment and foster team spirit by treating each other well and promoting a culture of positivity.Desire – We strive to be ambitious, energetic and determined – never settle for ‘good enough’Opportunity– We develop staff, promote from within and embrace challenges - there’s always something new to learn.Innovation– We are adventurous and creative, and always open-minded - strive for excellence at any level.Trust, Care & Respect – We are open, honest and committed to quality. We trust, care and are respectful to all our colleagues and clients.If these match your ethos, we think you’ll be a great fit here at Cashroom.The roleWe are looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer to help us deliver projects and initiatives that will help us to continue to grow Cashroom. You’ll join our technology team working in an agile environment to identify, build and support our technology environment.This role will cover a wide range of activities and technologies including, building and maintaining servers and databases, maintaining a distributed web application using continuous integration and delivery mechanisms, developing monitoring and alerting systems and potential cloud migrations, as well as providing technical expertise to assist with managing an outsourced provider supplying end user compute capabilities.There will also be the opportunity to get involved in the development of Java and JavaScript applications.You will be able to demonstrate a strong understanding of distributed infrastructure and maintaining applications/services in production, as well as the software development lifecycle, and will advocate for best practice in quality, architecture and design. You should also have a strong understanding of the importance of maintainability, performance and scalability.We are continuing to see opportunities in the FinTech space such as Open Banking and integrations with legal practice management systems. The technology in this space is changing rapidly and we are working on the cutting edge, while still ensuring quality and stability.As a team we embrace using the best technology available for the job at hand and encourage continuous learning. We aim to use modern processes such as continuous integration, continuous delivery and infrastructure as code and this role includes helping us to continue to improve not just what we deliver but will have a big focus on how we deliver it.Some of the technologies that we currently use include: React, JavaScript, NodeJS, Java, PHP, MySQL, MongoDB, RabbitMQ, OpenShift, Kubernetes, AWS, Prometheus and GrafanaYour typical weekSupporting a containerized production application, reviewing capacity and performance, ensuring housekeeping jobs are working as expectedGetting involved in solving production Engineer Cashroom LimitedOur MissionAt Cashroom, our mission is to free lawyers from the complexities of Legal Accounting.About UsLaw firms have the challenge of managing their clients’ money and also the firm’s money. Their procedures for doing so are regulated by the Solicitors Regulatory Authority (SRA) in England and Law Society of Scotland in Scotland and there are significant consequences on the law firms if the regulations are not applied correctly - that’s where we come in. Cashroom is an outsourced legal cashiering firm and we provide an expert service, managing these monies on behalf of law firms in accordance with the published regulations.Our technology helps lawyers and cashiers manage these funds in a secure, efficient and compliant manner. Cashroom has recently acquired a technology startup to help further develop our capabilities in this space, and deliver an excellent product experience to our clients and staff alike.We continue to experience significant business growth with our body of clients growing month on month and we want you to help us enable that growth in terms of identifying and delivering business efficiencies, and creating the capacity for continued success in the future.We have offices in Livingston, Scotland and Skelmersdale, England but our team is distributed and we work as a remote team. This provides great benefits and flexibility to work where you perform best, whether that be in the office, at home or a combination of both. Occasional travel to office may be required from time to time, when COVID permits.We know that passionate and driven people excel when they’re all pulling in the same direction, which is why we strongly believe in our Cashroom values. These outline what we are, how we do things and where we want to be.Teamwork– We build relationships based on trust, honesty, respect and encouragement, and we have fun!Loyalty– We show commitment and foster team spirit by treating each other well and promoting a culture of positivity.Desire – We strive to be ambitious, energetic and determined – never settle for ‘good enough’Opportunity– We develop staff, promote from within and embrace challenges - there’s always something new to learn.Innovation– We are adventurous and creative, and always open-minded - strive for excellence at any level.Trust, Care & Respect – We are open, honest and committed to quality. We trust, care and are respectful to all our colleagues and clients.If these match your ethos, we think you’ll be a great fit here at Cashroom.The roleWe are looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer to help us deliver projects and initiatives that will help us to continue to grow Cashroom. You’ll join our technology team working in an agile environment to identify, build and support our technology environment.This role will cover a wide range of activities and technologies including, building and maintaining servers and databases, maintaining a distributed web application using continuous integration and delivery mechanisms, developing monitoring and alerting systems and potential cloud migrations, as well as providing technical expertise to assist with managing an outsourced provider supplying end user compute capabilities.There will also be the opportunity to get involved in the development of Java and JavaScript applications.You will be able to demonstrate a strong understanding of distributed infrastructure and maintaining applications/services in production, as well as the software development lifecycle, and will advocate for best practice in quality, architecture and design. You should also have a strong understanding of the importance of maintainability, performance and scalability.We are continuing to see opportunities in the FinTech space such as Open Banking and integrations with legal practice management systems. The technology in this space is changing rapidly and we are working on the cutting edge, while still ensuring quality and stability.As a team we embrace using the best technology available for the job at hand and encourage continuous learning. We aim to use modern processes such as continuous integration, continuous delivery and infrastructure as code and this role includes helping us to continue to improve not just what we deliver but will
