At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar North is on the lookout for a talented DevOps Engineer who possess a passion for tools, DevOps and IT.

This is a full time permanent position based out of Rockstars' unique game development studio in the heart of Edinburgh.

WHAT WE DO
We work with our global IT Systems Engineers to develop infrastructure for hosting our internal tool services.
We maintain this infrastructure to the highest standard, with an emphasis on preventative actions rather than reactive.
We constantly review our processes with the aim of automating wherever possible.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Design, deploy, document and support internal services to best practices for fault tolerance, high availability, and security.
Work closely with IT Systems and Tools Programmers to develop our internal services to continually improve them.

QUALIFICATIONS
Computer Science degree or equivalent or
Relevant experience as a DevOps Engineer.

SKILLS
Windows and/or Linux Configuration and Administration skills.
Windows and/or Linux Desired State/Configuration Management skills using tools such as Ansible or Puppet.
Installation and Configuration of Application Servers including documentation and maintenance upgrades.
Virtual Machine Provisioning using tools such as Terraform or Pulumi.
Infrastructure monitoring using tools such as CheckMK or Nagios.
Scripting skills such as Powershell, Bash or Python.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to work as part of a team or individually as required.
Self-motivated.
Excellent documentation skills with high attention to detail.
Experience with taking projects from planning through to completion.

PLUSES

Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.
Application and web service administration (IIS, WCF, gRPC).
Database configuration and administration (MySQL, Percona, NoSQL).
Version control system exposure (Perforce, Git, Subversion).
Windows and/or Linux Containerization administration and configuration using tools such as Docker, Podman or Kubernetes.
VMware, Nutanix or other Hypervisor administration.

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you've got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race. Job reference

London, UK
Company Overview

Sliide is a mobile technology company that solves some of the most pressing challenges for mobile network operators and handset manufacturers globally.

Our digital products are used and loved by millions of people every month and drive billions of impressions to content producers and advertisers around the world.

Sliide is on a mission to help companies get more from the mobile economy. Our suite of mobile apps empower millions of users to unlock their essential device, and enable mobile carriers, handset manufacturers and app developers to engage, retain and maximise the value of their users.

We’ve more than tripled in size in the last 12 months and we have no intention of slowing down. We’re investing significantly in our existing product suite and we’re taking new and exciting products to market.

Role overview

We are looking for a DevOps engineer to join our technology team with experience building and scaling services in a cloud environment. You’ll be working as part of a small team of other DevOps engineers, whilst liaising with Android, Backend, Data Engineering, and Analytics team. Externally you will be in contact with our service management partners on a weekly or bi-weekly basis.

You will establish configuration management, automate our infrastructure, implement continuous integration, and ensure that members of the technology team are up to speed with DevOps best practices to achieve a continuously deployable system.

You will be responsible for all Disaster Recovery and regular system maintenance, as well as performing or coordinating regular security audits, using internal and external resources.

You Will be responsible for enforcing and creating security best practices as well as devops knowledge hub.

Responsibilities

Working with containerisation technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes in daily bases
Maintaining and improving AWS infrastructure using Terraform, Ansible and Packer
Maintaining and improving our CI/CD pipelines
Continuously increasing transparency of our systems through monitoring and alerting
Building and maintaining a highly available production environment while automating creation/destruction of other non production environments.
Own and deliver Disaster Recovery capabilities
Closely working with technical teams to implement and build automation solutions
Supporting applications hosted in an AWS cloud environment, including deployments, patches, security checks, and maintenance
Working with data team to create and maintain ETL jobs on Airflow
Skills required

BSc computer science or equivalent experience (min 2 year)
Passion for automation
Is a friendly, thoughtful person
Knowledge of ‘Infrastructure as Code’ such as Terraform
General scripting using bash, python, groovy, ruby
Experience of supporting applications, specifically GoLang, Java, Python
Understanding of of unix OS (e.g. Linux and MacOS)
Experience in Cloud platforms, Ideally with AWS and GCP
Working with containerisation technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes
Understanding of databases (e.g. Postgres, MySQL)
Experience in CI/CD tooling such as Jenkins or other
Ability to prioritise tickets, projects and multi tasking
Ability to to work in a quick paced environment
Experience with distributed systems
Decent knowledge of networks
Knowledge of ETL jobs
Familiarity of Big Data infrastructure/processes
Bonus points for

Familiarity with Android build processes is big plus
Experience with monitoring tools such as Logic Monitor and Lacework
Knowledge of automation tool such as Ansible
Knowledge of maintaining and deploying Elasticsearch

Package

Competitive salary + EMI share options

Benefits

25 days of holiday + bank holidays
up to 8% company pension contribution
Flexible working
Buzzing London office with a vibrant culture and well-stocked snack cupboards and drinks fridge
Working with a passionate team who love to learn and implement new technologies
Flat structure with plenty of exposure to the senior leadership team
Weekly company fitness sessions
Cycle to Work Scheme
Access to wellness venues and apps (via Gympass)
Private Health Insurance (with 24/7 Digital GP)
Budget for learning resources, courses and conferences
Regular all-company socials
Free haircuts in the office

Equal Opportunity

We are hugely committed to equality of opportunity. We employ many nationalities and think it's extremely important to have both genders represented in all functions and levels. All individuals will be treated in a fair and equal manner and in accordance with the law regardless of age, disability, gender, pregnancy and maternity, marital status, race, religion or sexual orientation. London, UK
Company Overview

Sliide is a mobile technology company that solves some of the most pressing challenges for mobile network operators and handset manufacturers globally.

Our digital products are used and loved by millions of people every month and drive billions of impressions to content producers and advertisers around the world.

Sliide is on a mission to help companies get more from the mobile economy. Our suite of mobile apps empower millions of users to unlock their essential device, and enable mobile carriers, handset manufacturers and app developers to engage, retain and maximise the value of their users.

We’ve more than tripled in size in the last 12 months and we have no intention of slowing down. We’re investing significantly in our existing product suite and we’re taking new and exciting products to market.

Role overview

We are looking for a DevOps engineer to join our technology team with experience building and scaling services in a cloud environment. You’ll be working as part of a small team of other DevOps engineers, whilst liaising with Android, Backend, Data Engineering, and Analytics team. Externally you will be in contact with our service management partners on a weekly or bi-weekly basis.

You will establish configuration management, automate our infrastructure, implement continuous integration, and ensure that members of the technology team are up to speed with DevOps best practices to achieve a continuously deployable system.

You will be responsible for all Disaster Recovery and regular system maintenance, as well as performing or coordinating regular security audits, using internal and external resources.

You Will be responsible for enforcing and creating security best practices as well as devops knowledge hub.

Responsibilities

Working with containerisation technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes in daily bases
Maintaining and improving AWS infrastructure using Terraform, Ansible and Packer
Maintaining and improving our CI/CD pipelines
Continuously increasing transparency of our systems through monitoring and alerting
Building and maintaining a highly available production environment while automating creation/destruction of other non production environments.
Own and deliver Disaster Recovery capabilities
Closely working with technical teams to implement and build automation solutions
Supporting applications hosted in an AWS cloud environment, including deployments, patches, security checks, and maintenance
Working with data team to create and maintain ETL jobs on Airflow
Skills required

BSc computer science or equivalent experience (min 2 year)
Passion for automation
Is a friendly, thoughtful person
Knowledge of ‘Infrastructure as Code’ such as Terraform
General scripting using bash, python, groovy, ruby
Experience of supporting applications, specifically GoLang, Java, Python
Understanding of of unix OS (e.g. Linux and MacOS)
Experience in Cloud platforms, Ideally with AWS and GCP
Working with containerisation technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes
Understanding of databases (e.g. Postgres, MySQL)
Experience in CI/CD tooling such as Jenkins or other
Ability to prioritise tickets, projects and multi tasking
Ability to to work in a quick paced environment
Experience with distributed systems
Decent knowledge of networks
Knowledge of ETL jobs
Familiarity of Big Data infrastructure/processes
Bonus points for

Familiarity with Android build processes is big plus
Experience with monitoring tools such as Logic Monitor and Lacework
Knowledge of automation tool such as Ansible
Knowledge of maintaining and deploying Elasticsearch

Package

Competitive salary + EMI share options

Benefits

25 days of holiday + bank holidays
up to 8% company pension contribution

OVERALL SUMMARY

Close Brothers Group, a FTSE 250 company, is leading UK merchant banking group consisting of a diversified set of specialist financial services business units providing lending, deposit taking, wealth management services and securities trading.

The Commercial Division (comprising the Asset Finance & Leasing and Invoice & Speciality Finance business units) is in the midst of an exciting transformation process that will have a significant impact on the organisation over the next 2-3 years. As a result we have an exciting opportunity for a DevOps Engineer to join our team, working alongside Agile delivery squads, in helping simplify, standardise and automate change delivery processes.

The DevOps Engineer will also work closely with Infrastructure, development and architecture teams as well as collaborating with peers across the various Business Units in helping establish (and apply) best practice.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Promoting and implementing DevOps best practices in pursuit of streamlined delivery.

Designing and implementing secure automation solutions (CI/CD pipelines) across development, testing, and production environments covering Hybrid (Cloud/On-Premise) architectures.

Continuously evaluating existing systems against industry standards; making recommendations for improvements and implementing as agreed.

Ensuring Governance is built into the automation pipelines – including traceability of change and control of environments.

Inspect, adapt and improve constantly to increase the Quality & Velocity of deliveries.

Development and support of the DevOps toolchain.

Development and maintenance of automated solution covering operational administration, system/data backup, disaster recovery, and security/performance monitoring

Facilitating the process of knowledge sharing across delivery and operations teams.

WE WOULD LOVE TO HEAR FROM YOU IF:
Minimum 3 years’ experience as a DevOps Engineer.

Hands-on experience in Software Build Automation; the creation of CI/CD pipelines; Configuration Management; and Change & Release Management in an Agile/SCRUM development environment.

DevOps tooling: GIT, GitLab, Jenkins, Nexus, Artifactory, SonarQube.

Firm understanding of various branching/merging strategies.

Atlassian JIRA/Confluence.

Proficiency in scripting languages including Bash, Python, Ruby and JavaScript etc.

You’re passionate about technology and excited about working with us

At Close Brothers we look to recruit individuals from all different backgrounds and encourage you to apply even if you don’t tick every box. We celebrate diversity, promote inclusivity and are open to discuss flexible work options to help you balance your work and home life.

We appreciate that from time to time, recruitment agencies will have speculative CVs that they may wish to submit to our Talent Acquisition team in relation to a specific role.

To avoid any ambiguity around fees, please note that speculative CVs received by Close Brothers, that have not been authorised in advance, by us, will be ineligible for an agency fee. Thank you. OVERALL SUMMARY

Azure Engineer / Cloud Engineer – remote working

Hybrid and Remote working available

Join a fully cloud-based challenger to the UK Financial Services and Insurance sector.

We are looking for a hands-on Azure Engineer to support our business in building a state-of-the-art platform for our customers.

The Role

As an Azure Engineer, you will support and manage the business’ Azure Infrastructure. This role will focus on BAU application and cloud support as well as project work to deliver operational efficiency improvements.

The Azure Engineer will work with multiple teams within the business as well as our delivery partners to ensure the smooth delivery of software projects.

If you have strong coding/scripting experience and have an interest in DevOps and are looking to develop your skills further – you may have what it takes.

Job Role Summary

Service Management: Working closely with the Head of IT, Solutions Architect, internal teams and suppliers to operate and improve processes that ensure smooth operational collaboration.
Supporting the evaluation and implementation of new tools and technologies through independent research, prototyping and participation in proof-of-concept activities, alongside the Solutions Architect and other members of the team.
Assessing the impact of business or technical change on; Application Support processes, tools and documentation, and delivering necessary changes to ensure Application Support team readiness.
Implementing and improving operational IT processes and service monitoring. This spans our DevOps tools and processes, service logging and monitoring/alerting tools and helpdesk systems.
Participating in IT delivery projects to ensure deployment, operations and support requirements are met.
Application / Technology Expertise: Develop a detailed understanding of the business’ Application and Infrastructure estate and use this knowledge to:
Diagnose and resolve complex Application Support incidents.
Provide a point of escalation to support other IT / Business Change staff to diagnose and resolve Application Support incidents.
Develop and maintain IT documentation and support guides.
Provide training/knowledge transfer to other Application and IT support staff.

Key Responsibilities

Identify operational efficiency improvement opportunities.
Liaise with other departments and deliver a supportive teamwork approach.
Identify and eliminate security vulnerabilities with strategic solutions that increase data security and implement best practise.
Writing scripts for service quality analysis, monitoring and operation
Designing procedures for system troubleshooting and maintenance
Investigating and resolving technical issues by deploying updates/ fixes

About you

We are looking for someone to take a strong desire to be constantly learning and developing. Our priority is to find colleagues that share our passions and mindset.

Working at the forefront of technology means that you’re constantly evolving your skills and experience, so we don’t expect you to have used all of our tech stacks, but we do expect expertise in some.

Requirements

Degree in computer science, software engineering, or an adjacent field or relevant work experience.
Experience using an array of automation tools.
Familiarity with software security methods.
Curious, discerning envelope pusher.
Top-notch decision-making and collaborative abilities.
Customer-oriented with the ability to receive and use constructive criticism.
Solid communication and prioritisation skills

Technical Skill Requirements:

Azure KeyVault
Azure Function Apps
Azure CosmosDB
Azure APIM
Azure Application Insights
Azure Front Door
Azure Service Bus
Azure B2C
Powershell

Desirable Skills and Qualifications

Prior experience at all phases of the software product life cycle, from conception to extinction.
Demonstrated experience using a wide variety of coding languages.
Knowledge of the Insurance industry useful but not essential
Azure DevOps
YAML
Salesforce
Kubernetes
Docker
Terraform
Ansible
jMeter
C#
Java

Job title: Graduate DevOps Engineer
Location: Reading (office based initially, moving to hybrid working)
Working hours: 37.5 hours per week, Monday to Friday
The Opportunity:
Our Graduate DevOps Engineers don’t just write code, that’s just c25% of their role! They play a key role in helping develop and deploy automation solutions vital in delivering cutting-edge 5G networks to our customers across the UK. They are confident people with a drive to learn and develop within the tech and communications industry and a passion to forge a career with the E2E DevOps Solution Architect or Consultant areas.
Key Responsibilities:
Plan, develop and execute the implementation of automation mechanisms and cloud ecosystem deployment pipelines.
Suggest and develop solutions to technical problems, and drive improvements to delight our customers
Support DevOps-related pre-sales activities, including pre-studies
Support to drive the ongoing Agile Transformation within projects.
Interpret and implement in Perl script and/or python HLDs and/or playbooks provided by the design team
Provide support to program/project team for automation realization
Prepare and present internal and customer demos if any
Manage the existing Gitlab structure to ensure it fits with the workflow.
 You?
Completed a technically focused degree e.g. Network Engineering, Computer Science, Electronic Engineering
The confidence to build solid business relationships with our B2b customers
A demonstrated focus/passion around one or more of the following, or related, skills
 Object Orientated programming. E.g C++, Python or Perl shell scripting)
Cloud Architecture mindset
Machine Learning capability Job title: Graduate DevOps Engineer
Location: Reading (office based initially, moving to hybrid working)
Working hours: 37.5 hours per week, Monday to Friday

The DevOps Engineer will be part of a project team that will participate in the design, development, testing,

implementation, support and documentation related to automation, server/application configuration, build and deploy, and activities related to end to end solutions.
Automation and processes required to deploy, manage, configure, scale, and monitor internal, product, and cloud-based applications.
Implementation and support of build and deploy workflow processes related to product development.
Management and support of infrastructure and development applications including continuous integration, source code management, and hosted applications.
Work collaboratively with team members to ensure successful delivery and implementation of assigned tasks.
Coordinate with corporate IT organization to identify, refine, and validate technology requirements especially in regards to build and deploy activities and cloud activities.
Guide development teams in their DevOps journey

This position can sit anywhere in the UK.
A Moody's employee in this role would typically have 1-3 years of experience in the following areas:
o Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery process

o CI/CD tools (e.g git, Azure DevOps)

o Cloud (Microsoft Azure ...)

o Infrastructure as Code (e.g terraform)

o Container technologies (kubernetes, helm, docker...)

o Linux/Windows Platforms

o Scripting (bash, Powershell, etc.)

Knowledge of software development life cycle (SDLC) including Agile Development Methodology
Excellent communication, interpersonal, and, consultative skills, work effectively with clients, vendors, peers, and business/IT management.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills.
Ability to stay current on trends and development within functional area of experience along with the industry.
Self-assured and confident with professional approach.
Ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines.
In Buy-side Solutions, we serve investors, consultants and asset managers by helping them make better decisions. Our next-generation buy-side technology enhances customer performance, improves governance and ultimately helps win more business. Our dedicated team of sales, marketing and product management experts are passionate about delivering effective solutions to our customers.

Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.
Moody's (NYSE: MCO) is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions. Our data, analytical solutions and insights help decision-makers identify opportunities and manage the risks of doing business with others. We believe that greater transparency, more informed decisions, and fair access to information open the door to shared progress. With over 11,000 employees in more than 40 countries, Moody's combines international presence with local expertise and over a century of experience in financial markets. Learn more at moodys.com .


At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity
Moody’s Analytics provides financial intelligence and analytical tools supporting our clients’ growth, efficiency and risk management objectives. The combination of our unparalleled expertise in risk, expansive information resources, and innovative application of technology, helps today’s business leaders confidently navigate an evolving marketplace.
For more information on the Securities Trading Program, please refer to the STP Quick Reference guide on ComplianceNet

Team of 5 DevOps Platform Engineering people seeking team member number 6 to play in Azure (& some AWS) cloud environments with Terraform.
We are part of a Software Engineering team of ~160 globally + & a wider, global company numbering 1000+ staff, offering SaaS solutions to our customers who use our solutions platforms daily.
Operating a strong & mature “DevOps” mentality, the team operate firmly on the "dev" side of things - we seek strong, hands on software engineers & coders with an obsession to automate everything!
The role:
Job title: Platform Engineer. SRE. Site Reliability Engineer. “DevOps” Engineer.
Location: London or London Home Counties or "within commuting distance for a once-a-week London office visit". We come in one day a week to liaise & catch-up in the flesh with each other & the wider Software Engineering team.
Salary: Up to £90K Basic + Benefits Package (25 days holiday, private pension, private health, etc)
To be successful in the team, you will be a seasoned engineer with demonstrable provenance in Infrastructure cloud design, build and configuration. Working within a continuous delivery model will be the norm and (competent in one or more programming languages) you will operate with a software engineering mind set.
Infrastructure as Code (Terraform)Configuration Management (Chef)Cloud providers (Azure, mostly)Jenkins CI/CDAzure DevOpsImplementing solutions to provide observability of platform status and healthSoftware defined networkingAutomated deployment tooling (Octopus, Azure DevOps)
Skills required:
TerraformConfiguration Management (ideally Chef)Kubernetes (cloud based)Docker (Kubernetes or AWS ECS Fargate)Extensive cloud experience (ideally Azure)Programming and scripting language used in production systems (Golang, Python, etc)
So, if you’d like to…
Work in a modern, cloud based, software house, in pure technical environment…Dabble in AWS & Azure environments… but primarily on AzureBe measured on output & production, rather than hours logged on & the normal 9-5… (We operate exceptionally flexible work patterns)Join a team of super awesome nerds who work on Terraform, Infrastructure as code, Kubernetes, Docker, Chef, Golang, etc…
Then, please get in touch with us to have a chat!
We operate a 1, maybe 2 stage interview process with no stupid coding exercises.
We’ll all get together remotely & screen share, talk code & see if we work for you & you work for us.
Please hit apply, call or message me to speak today!

Company Description
NEC Software Solutions is headquartered in the UK and operates around the world.
We employ more than 3,000 people in six countries, building software and services to get our customers better outcomes.
We traded as Northgate Public Services until 1 July 2021 when we rebranded to align with our owners, NEC. Most of our subsidiary companies did too (APD Communications, i2N, EMIS Care and Charter Systems) but our service design agency still trades as Snook.
We have been part of global tech company NEC Corporation since January 2018.
Find out more about our business on the Corporate Responsibility and Performance pages.
Job Description
**This is a UK home-based role**
This is an exciting opportunity for an enthusiastic, technical candidate to join an innovative and market-leading team.
Key Objectives
You will be part of the NEC Document Management support team delivering:
Upgrade, patching and technical application support of hosted solutions
Helping with customer upgrades when demand peaks
Assisting with support calls relating to upgrades and installations
Maintaining and managing pre-sales and test solutions
Configure systems to support business design
Incorporate and configure third party, service and integrations to support project outcomes
Feedback to wider team for process and application improvements
Liaison with customers and Customer Service Managers during maintenance windows
Maintenance of a good all-round understanding of associated NEC product offerings such as Environment and Planning, Housing and Revenues and Benefits, at a technical level.
Where directed, mentor and train other staff
We are looking for someone who has a keen interest in technical delivery, is fast learner and understands how to provide excellent customer service.
Responsibilities
Delivery of allocated tasks to budget and timescales
Ensuring that over-running tasks are highlighted to manager and approval is obtained
Picking up and learning new elements of te solution and improving relevant elements of the delivery process
Maintaining and developing technical skills required to upgrade and maintain the NEC DM solution

The Markets Engineering and Architecture team are seeking DevOps Engineers with experience in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) products such as Terraform and Ansible, as well as good working knowledge of virtualisation using industry standard products such as VMWare and RHEV.

The ideal candidate will have had recent experience with infrastructure modernisation and will be part of a small but impactful team who are responsible for accelerating virtualisation across the Markets infrastructure estate.

Due to the collaborative nature of the team candidates will be expected to have excellent communication skills and be able to partner with a variety of stakeholder and core technology groups to deliver solutions.

Required skills:
Hands on experience with Infrastructure as Code (e.g. Terraform)
Hands on experience with provisioning and configuration (e.g. Ansible)
Good working knowledge of server virtualisation concepts
Hands on experience with building CI/CD pipelines for infrastructure

Desirable skills:
Proven track record in an infrastructure modernisation role
Operating within complex multi-tenant environments
UNIX / Linux OS knowledge
Experience with a diverse range of monitoring products

We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. Role Introduction
The works as part of a team to design implement and operate cloud hosting of SaaS services in AWS. Building and managing resources and process automation built and deployed as IaC and DevOps tools.
Home working.
What You Will Do
Work on implementing and troubleshooting standalone and pipelined automation.
Apply knowledge and experience creatively to design, test and implements solutions to problems while conforming to best practice.
Analyze architectural solutions and advise on changes to deliver operational and cost efficiency, risk mitigation and alignment with best practice.
Drive efficiency through automation and use of patterns to drive efficiency in a measurable way
What You Will Have
Strong capability in multiple disciplines covering public cloud, network, security principles, virtual servers and OS’s, web hosting applications such as apache & IIS as well as being adept with database technology.
Experience working with IaC pipelines and automation in public cloud.
Operational awarness and understanding of ITIL fundamentals.
Good communication and documentation skills, written and verbal.
What We Do For You
Generous Annual Leave – 25 days, plus public holidays, with the possibility to buy additional days
Summer Fridays! Every Friday afternoon off throughout July and August 2022 (or equivalent time in the week)
Life Insurance – 4x times annual salary
Top Achievers Club – Our yearly VIP trip includes flights, transfers and accommodation to recognise excellence in our employees
65% Internal Mobility – Committed to the development & growth of our people
Advanced Perks At Work – Exclusive employee discounts & benefits portal
Charity Fundraising – Proud to be a Patron of The Prince's Trust; every employee is entitled to one day of volunteering each year
Pension Scheme - Up to 5% matched contribution
Who We Are
We are one the UK’s largest tech companies, and our products sit at the heart of some of the country's best-known businesses. We’ve grown phenomenally quickly with a £275m turnover and 2,800 employees supporting over 25,000 customers. We hire for potential. We want to make sure we have the best people for the job and provide genuinely equal opportunities for our people to thrive. Our recruitment process is designed with inclusion and equity at its core.
Find out more about the next steps once you’ve applied here - careers.oneadvanced.com/how-we-hire Role Introduction

Details
Reference number
233415
Salary
£52,606 - £62,286
PA, PR. Potential for a specialist pay allowance up to £10,000
Grade
Grade 7
Contract type
Permanent
Type of role
Digital
Information Technology
Working pattern
Flexible working, Full-time, Job share, Part-time
Number of posts
3
Contents
Location
About the job
Benefits
Things you need to know
Apply and further information
Location
London
About the job
Summary
We pride ourselves as being an employer of choice, where Everyone Matters promoting equality of opportunity to actively encourage applications from everyone, including groups currently underrepresented in our workforce.
UKHSA ethos is to be an inclusive organisation for all our staff and stakeholders. To create, nurture and sustain an inclusive culture, where differences drive innovative solutions to meet the needs of our workforce and wider communities. We do this through celebrating and protecting differences by removing barriers and promoting equity and equality of opportunity for all.
The UKHSA Development and Operations team leads the digital transformation of UKHSA to make it a more data driven, customer focused, digital organisation. We do this by delivering services which meet and maintain the Government Digital Service (GDS) Digital by Default Service Standard (https://www.gov.uk/service-manual/digital-by-default).
UKHSA Development and Operations team is based within the Technology Directorate. We have a team of roughly 40 people including content designers, developers, product managers, strategists and policy experts. We blend expertise from private and Government sectors and we work with a wide range of partners and suppliers. We also manages UKHSA’s presence on GOV.UK, is transitioning UKHSA’s websites to GOV.UK and NHS Choices, runs the UKHSA intranet, and contains a services team to drive improvements in the services operated by UKHSA colleagues.
Potential for a specialist pay allowance of up to £10,000 could be available depending on a capability assessment.
Job description
As a DevOps Engineer, you will have experience of designing and architecting highly-available services on a cloud platform such as AWS, and of implementing continuous integration technologies such as Jenkins, and orchestration tools such as Ansible or Terraform.
As a DevOps Engineer, you will work to optimise our development processes and identify process optimisation opportunities and contribute to the implementation of proposed solutions. You will initially work mostly with AWS, OpenStack and OpenShift developing and supporting systems and infrastructure through to production using modern continuous integration/deployment (CI/CD) techniques and supporting analysis, identification, prioritisation and implementation of incremental improvements to our services currently running. You will be a good technical communicator, able to improve developer experience through tools and technologies in collaboration with the development teams throughout the development lifecycle to live service and decommissioning. You will maintain the security, confidentiality and integrity of our cloud services by implementing relevant information security standards and ensure compliance with relevant legislations and regulations.
Responsibilities
You will excel at architecting cloud enabled systems and creating specifications and designs to meet our cloud hosting requirements, working with other stakeholders to translate requirements into visual technical designs and explore different approaches to solving problems. You will be capable of reviewing system designs to ensure selection of appropriate technology, design standards, methods, and tools and efficient use of resources and integration of multiple systems and technology. You will be a systems integrator and able to define and co-ordinate integration build activities across systems and understand how to undertake and support integration testing.
You will understand users and be able to identify them and their needs based on evidence and translate user stories and propose design approaches or services to meet these needs and engage in meaningful interactions and relationships with users. You must put users first, manage competing priorities excel at collaborating with users and user researchers and be able to make recommendations on the best tools and methods to use.
You will work to ensure that our cloud platforms are highly available and be able to define, analyse, plan, forecast, measure, maintain and improve all aspects of our service availability in a cost effective manner. You will need excellent ability to manage the capability, functionality and sustainability of all of our cloud services including infrastructure-as-a-service (IaaS) and platform-as-a-service (PaaS).
The post holder will develop working relationships and communicate regularly with a wide range of individuals, clinical and non-clinical, internal and external to UKHSA. This will include:
Internal
Technology team
Data team
Users within UKHSA including key business sponsors
External
Suppliers, in particular UKHSA’s current or potential cloud hosting providers
Representatives of other bodies with NHS and Department of Health
Government Digital Service
Key Responsibilities
Lead development and rollout of a continuous integration and deployment pipeline across UKHSA’s Digital’s estate of apps and services, use of containerisation techniques where appropriate, and working collaboratively with other department
Support developers, system administrators and technical architects to use DevOps approaches to design, architect, automate and implement highly available and fault-tolerant environments (staging, quality assurance, user acceptance and production), with multi-cloud capability primarily starting on AWS or Azur
Work with technical colleagues to define and implement DevOps methodology using practices recommended in the GDS Digital by Default Service Standard. Support the team to extend our continuous integration pipeline across our estate of apps and service
Write infrastructure as code using Terraform or similar. Use cross-platform APIs and automation/deployment technologies such as Ansible or similar to orchestrate cloud platform deployment
Support and fix bugs in existing application deployment pipelines, using standard debugging tools to track down and identify root causes. Work independently to find solutions / identify problems and to work with the Lead and Senior Developers to solve more challenging issue
Review existing applications, advising and supporting colleagues on configuring and converting them for deployment to the cloud or migrate from other cloud providers. Support setting up continuous integration/deployment, developing automation scripts and advising developers on adapting them to run in the clou
Working in sprints in a multidisciplinary scrum team, collaborate and liaise with delivery managers, product owners and other stakeholders to identify business requirements and implement user storie
Collaborate and work with external developers and cloud service providers to ensure UKHSA derives the maximum benefit from any third party service providers and that the right knowledge is transferred in-house
Continuously seek to improve your own knowledge of work areas, bringing your learning back into the team, and embrace the agile framework of software delivery. Support colleagues to reach full agility using DevOps best practices including continuous integrations, delivery, and release
Consistently work to meet project deadlines and manage time effectively to deliver projects on budget
Essential Criteria:
Educated to degree level in relevant subject such as computer science with core development element or equivalent level qualification or experience of working at a similar level in specialist area
Proficiency/experience with DevOps approaches to application testing and deployment
Experience of automated deployment of applications and services to AWS or Azure
Design, development and support of CI/CD pipelines in a microservice architecture
Experience of implementing a continuous integration platform such as Jenkins using repeatable deployment patterns
Knowledge/experience of appropriate standards, methods and tools to design systems using DevOps principles
Knowledge/experience of cloud automation technologies such as Ansible or Terraform
Genuine passion and interest in DevOps and cloud automation technologies and version control software (Git)
Ability to handle multiple tasks and workloads
Able to identify opportunities to optimise application development/deployment and lifecycle processes and contribute to their implementation using DevOps and Agile approaches
Able to defines the continuous integration build, co-ordinate build activities across systems and understand how to undertake and support integration testing activities
Able to work with business and technology stakeholders to translate business problems into technical designs, specifying and designing systems using appropriate standards and tools
An understanding of and commitment to equality of opportunity and good working relationships, both in terms of day-to-day working practices, but also in relation to management systems
Desirable Criteria:
Postgraduate or professional qualification or equivalent experience in of working at a similar level in specialist area Experience with continuous integration systems (Jenkins/Travis)
Experience of containerisation or microservices technologies and techniques, such as Docker or Kubernetes
Good understanding of RESTful Web Services
Good understanding of user needs and the difference between user needs and desires
Experience of Agile principles, practices and tools such as Jira
Behaviours
We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:
Making Effective Decisions
Communicating and Influencing
Managing a Quality Service
Technical skills
We'll assess you against these technical skills during the selection process:
Technical assessment
Benefits
Learning and development tailored to your role
An environment with flexible working options
A culture encouraging inclusion and diversity
A Civil Service pension with an average employer contribution of 27%
Things you need to know
Security
Successful candidates must pass a disclosure and barring security check.
People working with government assets must complete basic personnel security standard checks.
Selection process details
This vacancy is using Success Profiles, and will assess your Behaviours and Technical skills.
STAGE 1 - APPLICATION & SIFT:
You will be required to complete an application form. You will be assessed on essential criteria and this will be in the form of:
a CV/ Application form
(up to 500 words) Statement of Suitability.
This should outline how you consider your skills, experience and achievements, provide evidence of your suitability for the role, with particular reference to the essential criteria outlined.
The CV & Statement of Suitability will be marked separately and you must pass both to move on to interview.
There will be no possibility to upload any documents along with your online application so include everything you would like us to know in your application.
If you are successful at this stage, you will progress to interview & assessment
STAGE 2 – INTERVIEW
This vacancy is using Success Profiles.
Behaviours , technical, knowledge and experience will be tested at interview.
There will be a Technical Assessment and there may be a Presentation.
The Behaviours tested during the interview stage will be:
Making Effective Decisions
Communicating and Influencing
Managing a Quality Service
Option 3 – External
Open to all external applicants (anyone) from outside the Civil Service (including by definition internal applicants).
Unfortunately, late applications will not be considered
Successful candidates must pass a disclosure and barring security check.
Reserve List:
Candidates who pass the interview criteria but are not offered a post will be kept on a reserve list for 12 months and may be contacted if similar roles become available.

If you are interviewed for the post and do not meet the required threshold for the specified grade, your application may be assessed against a similar, lower grade role and you may be offered the post should one be available.
Further information
The law requires that selection for appointment to the Civil Service is on merit on the basis of fair and open competition as outlined in the Civil Service Commission's Recruitment Principles.
If you feel your application has not been treated in accordance with the Recruitment Principles, and you wish to make a complaint, in the first instance, you should contact UKHSA Public Accountability Unit via email: Complaints1@ukhsa.gov.uk.
If you are not satisfied with the response you receive from the Department, you can contact the Civil Service Commission: Visit the Civil Service Commission website here.

Feedback will only be provided if you attend an interview or assessment.
Nationality requirements
This job is broadly open to the following groups:
UK nationals
nationals of Commonwealth countries who have the right to work in the UK
nationals of the Republic of Ireland
nationals from the EU, EEA or Switzerland with settled or pre-settled status or who apply for either status by the deadline of the European Union Settlement Scheme (EUSS)
relevant EU, EEA, Swiss or Turkish nationals working in the Civil Service
relevant EU, EEA, Swiss or Turkish nationals who have built up the right to work in the Civil Service
certain family members of the relevant EU, EEA, Swiss or Turkish nationals
Further information on nationality requirements
Working for the Civil Service
The Civil Service Code sets out the standards of behaviour expected of civil servants.

We recruit by merit on the basis of fair and open competition, as outlined in the Civil Service Commission's recruitment principles.
The Civil Service embraces diversity and promotes equal opportunities. As such, we run a Disability Confident Scheme (DCS) for candidates with disabilities who meet the minimum selection criteria.
Apply and further information
The Civil Service welcomes applications from people who have recently left prison or have an unspent conviction. Read more about prison leaver recruitment.
Once this job has closed, the job advert will no longer be available. You may want to save a copy for your records.
Contact point for applicants

RecruitmentTeam3@ukhsa.gov.uk

Location
London
About the job
Summary
We pride ourselves as being an employer of choice, where Everyone Matters promoting equality of opportunity to actively encourage applications from everyone, including groups currently underrepresented in our workforce.
UKHSA ethos is to be an inclusive organisation for all our staff and stakeholders. To create, nurture and sustain an inclusive culture, where differences drive innovative solutions to meet the needs of our workforce and wider communities. We do this through celebrating and protecting differences by removing barriers and promoting equity and equality of opportunity for all.
The UKHSA Development and Operations team leads the digital transformation of UKHSA to make it a more data driven, customer focused, digital organisation. We do this by delivering services which meet and maintain the Government Digital Service (GDS) Digital by Default Service Standard (https://www.gov.uk/service-manual/digital-by-default).
UKHSA Development and Operations team is based within the Technology Directorate. We have a team of roughly 40 people including content designers, developers, product managers, strategists and policy experts. We blend expertise from private and Government sectors and we work with a wide range of partners and suppliers. We also manages UKHSA’s presence on GOV.UK, is transitioning UKHSA’s websites to GOV.UK and NHS Choices, runs the UKHSA intranet, and contains a services team to drive improvements in the services operated by UKHSA colleagues.
Potential for a specialist pay allowance of up to £10,000 could be available depending on a capability assessment.
Job description
As a DevOps Engineer, you will have experience of designing and architecting highly-available services on a cloud platform such as AWS, and of implementing continuous integration technologies such as Jenkins, and orchestration tools such as Ansible or Terraform.
As a DevOps Engineer, you will work to optimise our development processes and identify process optimisation opportunities and contribute to the implementation of proposed solutions. You will initially work mostly with AWS, OpenStack and OpenShift developing and supporting systems and infrastructure through to production using modern continuous integration/deployment (CI/CD) techniques and supporting analysis, identification, prioritisation and implementation of incremental improvements to our services currently running. You will be a good technical communicator, able to improve developer experience through tools and technologies in collaboration with the development teams throughout the development lifecycle to live service and decommissioning. You will maintain the security, confidentiality and integrity of our cloud services by implementing relevant information security standards and ensure compliance with relevant legislations and regulations.
Responsibilities
You will excel at architecting cloud enabled systems and creating specifications and designs to meet our cloud hosting requirements, working with other stakeholders to translate requirements into visual technical designs and explore different approaches to solving problems. You will be capable of reviewing system designs to ensure selection of appropriate technology, design standards, methods, and tools and efficient use of resources and integration of multiple systems and technology. You will be a systems integrator and able to define and co-ordinate integration build activities across systems and understand how to undertake and support integration testing.
You will understand users and be able to identify them and their needs based on evidence and translate user stories and propose design approaches or services to meet these needs and engage in meaningful interactions and relationships with users. You must put users first, manage competing priorities excel at collaborating with users and user researchers and be able to make recommendations on the best tools and methods to use.
You will work to ensure that our cloud platforms are highly available and be able to define, analyse, plan, forecast, measure, maintain and improve all aspects of our service availability in a cost effective manner. You will need excellent ability to manage the capability, functionality and sustainability of all of our cloud services including infrastructure-as-a-service (IaaS) and platform-as-a-service (PaaS).
The post holder will develop working relationships and communicate regularly with a wide range of individuals, clinical and non-clinical, internal and external to UKHSA. This will include:
Internal
Technology team
Data team
Users within UKHSA including key business sponsors
External
Suppliers, in particular UKHSA’s current or potential cloud hosting providers
Representatives of other bodies with NHS and Department of Health
Government Digital Service
Key Responsibilities
Lead development and rollout of a continuous integration and deployment pipeline across UKHSA’s Digital’s estate of apps and services, use of containerisation techniques where appropriate, and working collaboratively with other department
Support developers, system administrators and technical architects to use DevOps approaches to design, architect, automate and implement highly available and fault-tolerant environments (staging, quality assurance, user acceptance and production), with multi-cloud capability primarily starting on AWS or Azur
Work with technical colleagues to define and implement DevOps methodology using practices recommended in the GDS Digital by Default Service Standard. Support the team to extend our continuous integration pipeline across our estate of apps and service
Write infrastructure as code using Terraform or similar. Use cross-platform APIs and automation/deployment technologies such as Ansible or similar to orchestrate cloud platform deployment
Support and fix bugs in existing application deployment pipelines, using standard debugging tools to track down and identify root causes. Work independently to find solutions / identify problems and to work with the Lead and Senior Developers to solve more challenging issue
Review existing applications, advising and supporting colleagues on configuring and converting them for deployment to the cloud or migrate from other cloud providers. Support setting up continuous integration/deployment, developing automation scripts and advising developers on adapting them to run in the clou
Working in sprints in a multidisciplinary scrum team, collaborate and liaise with delivery managers, product owners and other stakeholders to identify business requirements and implement user storie
Collaborate and work with external developers and cloud service providers to ensure UKHSA derives the maximum benefit from any third party service providers and that the right knowledge is transferred in-house
Continuously seek to improve your own knowledge of work areas, bringing your learning back into the team, and embrace the agile framework of software delivery. Support colleagues to reach full agility using DevOps best practices including continuous integrations, delivery, and release
Consistently work to meet project deadlines and manage time effectively to deliver projects on budget
Essential Criteria:
Educated to degree level in relevant subject such as computer science with core development element or equivalent level qualification or experience of working at a similar level in specialist area
Proficiency/experience with DevOps approaches to application testing and deployment
Experience of automated deployment of applications and services to AWS or Azure
Design, development and support of CI/CD pipelines in a microservice architecture
Experience of implementing a continuous integration platform such as Jenkins using repeatable deployment patterns
Knowledge/experience of appropriate standards, methods and tools to design systems using DevOps principles
Knowledge/experience of cloud automation technologies such as Ansible or Terraform
Genuine passion and interest in DevOps and cloud automation technologies and version control software (Git)
Ability to handle multiple tasks and workloads
Able to identify opportunities to optimise application development/deployment and lifecycle processes and contribute to their implementation using DevOps and Agile approaches
Able to defines the continuous integration build, co-ordinate build activities across systems and understand how to undertake and support integration testing activities
Able to work with business and technology stakeholders to translate business problems into technical designs, specifying and designing systems using appropriate standards and tools
An understanding of and commitment to equality of opportunity and good working relationships, both in terms of day-to-day working practices, but also in relation to management systems
Desirable Criteria:
Postgraduate or professional qualification or equivalent experience in of working at a similar level in specialist area Experience with continuous integration systems (Jenkins/Travis)
Experience of containerisation or microservices technologies and techniques, such as Docker or Kubernetes
Good understanding of RESTful Web Services
Good understanding of user needs and the difference between user needs and desires
Experience of Agile principles, practices and tools such as Jira
Behaviours
We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:
Making Effective Decisions
Communicating and Influencing
Managing a Quality Service
Technical skills
We'll assess you against these technical skills during the selection process:
Technical assessment
Benefits
Learning and development tailored to your role
An environment with flexible working options
A culture encouraging inclusion and diversity
A Civil Service pension with an average employer contribution of 27%
Things you need to know
Security
Successful candidates must pass a disclosure and barring security check.
People working with government assets must complete basic personnel security standard checks.
Selection process details
This vacancy is using Success Profiles, and will assess your Behaviours and Technical skills.
STAGE 1 - APPLICATION & SIFT:
You will be required to complete an application form. You will be assessed on essential criteria and this will be in the form of:
a CV/ Application form
(up to 500 words) Statement of Suitability.
This should outline how you consider your skills, experience and achievements, provide evidence of your suitability for the role, with particular reference to the essential criteria outlined.
The CV & Statement of Suitability will be marked separately and you must pass both to move on to interview.
There will be no possibility to upload any documents along with your online application so include everything you would like us to know in your application.
If you are successful at this stage, you will progress to interview & assessment
STAGE 2 – INTERVIEW
This vacancy is using Success Profiles.
Behaviours , technical, knowledge and experience will be tested at interview.
There will be a Technical Assessment and there may be a Presentation.
The Behaviours tested during the interview stage will be:
Making Effective Decisions
Communicating and Influencing
Managing a Quality Service
Option 3 – External
Open to all external applicants (anyone) from outside the Civil Service (including by definition internal applicants).
Unfortunately, late applications will not be considered
Successful candidates must pass a disclosure and barring security check.
Reserve List:
Candidates who pass the interview criteria but are not offered a post will be kept on a reserve list for 12 months and may be contacted if similar roles become available.

If you are interviewed for the post and do not meet the required threshold for the specified grade, your application may be assessed against a similar, lower grade role and you may be offered the post should one be available.
Further information
The law requires that selection for appointment to the Civil Service is on merit on the basis of fair and open competition as outlined in the Civil Service Commission's Recruitment Principles.
If you feel your application has not been treated in accordance with the Recruitment Principles, and you wish to make a complaint, in the first instance, you should contact UKHSA Public Accountability Unit via email: Complaints1@ukhsa.gov.uk.
If you are not satisfied with the response you receive from the Department, you can contact the Civil Service Commission: Visit the Civil Service Commission website here.

Feedback will only be provided if you attend an interview or assessment.
Nationality requirements
This job is broadly open to the following groups:
UK nationals
nationals of Commonwealth countries who have the right to work in the UK
nationals of the Republic of Ireland
nationals from the EU, EEA or Switzerland with settled or pre-settled status or who apply for either status by the deadline of the European Union Settlement Scheme (EUSS)
relevant EU, EEA, Swiss or Turkish nationals working in the Civil Service
relevant EU, EEA, Swiss or Turkish nationals who have built up the right to work in the Civil Service
certain family members of the relevant EU, EEA, Swiss or Turkish nationals
Further information on nationality requirements
Working for the Civil Service
The Civil Service Code sets out the standards of behaviour expected of civil servants.

We recruit by merit on the basis of fair and open competition, as outlined in the Civil Service Commission's recruitment principles.
The Civil Service embraces diversity and promotes equal opportunities. As such, we run a Disability Confident Scheme (DCS) for candidates with disabilities who meet the minimum selection criteria.

About the job 
Summary
We pride ourselves as being an employer of choice, where Everyone Matters promoting equality of opportunity to actively encourage applications from everyone, including groups currently underrepresented in our workforce.
UKHSA ethos is to be an inclusive organisation for all our staff and stakeholders. To create, nurture and sustain an inclusive culture, where differences drive innovative solutions to meet the needs of our workforce and wider communities. We do this through celebrating and protecting differences by removing barriers and promoting equity and equality of opportunity for all.
The UKHSA Development and Operations team leads the digital transformation of UKHSA to make it a more data driven, customer focused, digital organisation. We do this by delivering services which meet and maintain the Government Digital Service (GDS) Digital by Default Service Standard (https://www.gov.uk/service-manual/digital-by-default).
UKHSA Development and Operations team is based within the Technology Directorate. We have a team of roughly 40 people including content designers, developers, product managers, strategists and policy experts. We blend expertise from private and Government sectors and we work with a wide range of partners and suppliers. We also manages UKHSA’s presence on GOV.UK, is transitioning UKHSA’s websites to GOV.UK and NHS Choices, runs the UKHSA intranet, and contains a services team to drive improvements in the services operated by UKHSA colleagues.
Potential for a specialist pay allowance of up to £10,000 could be available depending on a capability assessment.

Job description
As a DevOps Engineer, you will have experience of designing and architecting highly-available services on a cloud platform such as AWS, and of implementing continuous integration technologies such as Jenkins, and orchestration tools such as Ansible or Terraform.
As a DevOps Engineer, you will work to optimise our development processes and identify process optimisation opportunities and contribute to the implementation of proposed solutions. You will initially work mostly with AWS, OpenStack and OpenShift developing and supporting systems and infrastructure through to production using modern continuous integration/deployment (CI/CD) techniques and supporting analysis, identification, prioritisation and implementation of incremental improvements to our services currently running. You will be a good technical communicator, able to improve developer experience through tools and technologies in collaboration with the development teams throughout the development lifecycle to live service and decommissioning. You will maintain the security, confidentiality and integrity of our cloud services by implementing relevant information security standards and ensure compliance with relevant legislations and regulations. 
As a DevOps Engineer, you will have experience of designing and architecting highly-available services on a cloud platform such as AWS, and of implementing continuous integration technologies such as Jenkins, and orchestration tools such as Ansible or Terraform.
As a DevOps Engineer, you will work to optimise our development processes and identify process optimisation opportunities and contribute to the implementation of proposed solutions. You will initially work mostly with AWS, OpenStack and OpenShift developing and supporting systems and infrastructure through to production using modern continuous integration/deployment (CI/CD) techniques and supporting analysis, identification, prioritisation and implementation of incremental improvements to our services currently running. You will be a good technical communicator, able to improve developer experience through tools and technologies in collaboration with the development teams throughout the development lifecycle to live service and decommissioning. You will maintain the security, confidentiality and integrity of our cloud services by implementing relevant information security standards and ensure compliance with relevant legislations and regulations. 
Responsibilities
You will excel at architecting cloud enabled systems and creating specifications and designs to meet our cloud hosting requirements, working with other stakeholders to translate requirements into visual technical designs and explore different approaches to solving problems. You will be capable of reviewing system designs to ensure selection of appropriate technology, design standards, methods, and tools and efficient use of resources and integration of multiple systems and technology. You will be a systems integrator and able to define and co-ordinate integration build activities across systems and understand how to undertake and support integration testing.
You will understand users and be able to identify them and their needs based on evidence and translate user stories and propose design approaches or services to meet these needs and engage in meaningful interactions and relationships with users. You must put users first, manage competing priorities excel at collaborating with users and user researchers and be able to make recommendations on the best tools and methods to use.
You will work to ensure that our cloud platforms are highly available and be able to define, analyse, plan, forecast, measure, maintain and improve all aspects of our service availability in a cost effective manner. You will need excellent ability to manage the capability, functionality and sustainability of all of our cloud services including infrastructure-as-a-service (IaaS) and platform-as-a-service (PaaS).
The post holder will develop working relationships and communicate regularly with a wide range of individuals, clinical and non-clinical, internal and external to UKHSA. This will include:
Internal
Technology team
Data team
Users within UKHSA including key business sponsors
External
Suppliers, in particular UKHSA’s current or potential cloud hosting providers
Representatives of other bodies with NHS and Department of Health
Government Digital Service
Key Responsibilities
Lead development and rollout of a continuous integration and deployment pipeline across UKHSA’s Digital’s estate of apps and services, use of containerisation techniques where appropriate, and working collaboratively with other department
Support developers, system administrators and technical architects to use DevOps approaches to design, architect, automate and implement highly available and fault-tolerant environments (staging, quality assurance, user acceptance and production), with multi-cloud capability primarily starting on AWS or Azur
Work with technical colleagues to define and implement DevOps methodology using practices recommended in the GDS Digital by Default Service Standard. Support the team to extend our continuous integration pipeline across our estate of apps and service
Write infrastructure as code using Terraform or similar. Use cross-platform APIs and automation/deployment technologies such as Ansible or similar to orchestrate cloud platform deployment
Support and fix bugs in existing application deployment pipelines, using standard debugging tools to track down and identify root causes. Work independently to find solutions / identify problems and to work with the Lead and Senior Developers to solve more challenging issue
Review existing applications, advising and supporting colleagues on configuring and converting them for deployment to the cloud or migrate from other cloud providers. Support setting up continuous integration/deployment, developing automation scripts and advising developers on adapting them to run in the clou
Working in sprints in a multidisciplinary scrum team, collaborate and liaise with delivery managers, product owners and other stakeholders to identify business requirements and implement user storie
Collaborate and work with external developers and cloud service providers to ensure UKHSA derives the maximum benefit from any third party service providers and that the right knowledge is transferred in-house
Continuously seek to improve your own knowledge of work areas, bringing your learning back into the team, and embrace the agile framework of software delivery. Support colleagues to reach full agility using DevOps best practices including continuous integrations, delivery, and release
Consistently work to meet project deadlines and manage time effectively to deliver projects on budget
Essential Criteria:
Educated to degree level in relevant subject such as computer science with core development element or equivalent level qualification or experience of working at a similar level in specialist area
Proficiency/experience with DevOps approaches to application testing and deployment
Experience of automated deployment of applications and services to AWS or Azure
Design, development and support of CI/CD pipelines in a microservice architecture
Experience of implementing a continuous integration platform such as Jenkins using repeatable deployment patterns
Knowledge/experience of appropriate standards, methods and tools to design systems using DevOps principles
Knowledge/experience of cloud automation technologies such as Ansible or Terraform
Genuine passion and interest in DevOps and cloud automation technologies and version control software (Git)
Ability to handle multiple tasks and workloads
Able to identify opportunities to optimise application development/deployment and lifecycle processes and contribute to their implementation using DevOps and Agile approaches
Able to defines the continuous integration build, co-ordinate build activities across systems and understand how to undertake and support integration testing activities
Able to work with business and technology stakeholders to translate business problems into technical designs, specifying and designing systems using appropriate standards and tools
An understanding of and commitment to equality of opportunity and good working relationships, both in terms of day-to-day working practices, but also in relation to management systems
Desirable Criteria:
Postgraduate or professional qualification or equivalent experience in of working at a similar level in specialist area Experience with continuous integration systems (Jenkins/Travis)
Experience of containerisation or microservices technologies and techniques, such as Docker or Kubernetes
Good understanding of RESTful Web Services
Good understanding of user needs and the difference between user needs and desires
Experience of Agile principles, practices and tools such as Jira

DevOps Engineer - challenger bank
£70,000 - £80,000 DOE.
Fully remote - candidates can apply from anywhere in the UK. (Must be UK based)
An innovative UK Challenger Bank is making waves in the Banking world by offering a new product that is unique to their customers. They are looking for a DevOps Engineer who still has a willingness to learn and be molded into a Senior DevOps Engineer in the next couple of years.
You will be given state of the art training from some of the most technically gifted Senior/Lead DevOps Engineers who have worked within UK Banks for 10+ years. Not only will you be constantly challenged within this position, but you will be given the tools to complete certifications in AWS, Kubernetes and Terraform. They really believe in leanring and development.
On top of the training you will receive, you will be given autonomy to work in a way that suits you. With flexible working introduced in 2020, with a fully remote working strategy, you are given the tools to do a good a job as you want to do. Core working hours are between 10am - 4pm.
The tech stack is cutting-edge, with containerisation and code deployments at the heart of the Banks infrastructure. They use Terraform for IAC and Docker for building containers. AWS is their current cloud platform.
Skills required:
Experience of building containers using Docker.
Creating infrastructure using Terraform or CloudFormation.
Kubernetes for orchestration.

An innovative UK Challenger Bank is making waves in the Banking world by offering a new product that is unique to their customers. They are looking for a DevOps Engineer who still has a willingness to learn and be molded into a Senior DevOps Engineer in the next couple of years.
You will be given state of the art training from some of the most technically gifted Senior/Lead DevOps Engineers who have worked within UK Banks for 10+ years. Not only will you be constantly challenged within this position, but you will be given the tools to complete certifications in AWS, Kubernetes and Terraform. They really believe in leanring and development.
On top of the training you will receive, you will be given autonomy to work in a way that suits you. With flexible working introduced in 2020, with a fully remote working strategy, you are given the tools to do a good a job as you want to do. Core working hours are between 10am - 4pm.
The tech stack is cutting-edge, with containerisation and code deployments at the heart of the Banks infrastructure. They use Terraform for IAC and Docker for building containers. AWS is their current cloud platform.

Experience of building containers using Docker.
Creating infrastructure using Terraform or CloudFormation.
Kubernetes for orchestration.
Building CI/CD pipelines using Gitlab, CircleCI, Jenkins and more.

The Productivity Engineering Group at Arm is designed to assist colleagues across all of Arm's Engineering population with infrastructure that is evaluated and deployed alongside a deep understanding of the huge variety of work that the company does and what will work best at Arm. We are looking for a hardworking and enthusiastic engineer to join our Productivity Engineering Software & DevOps team based in Cambridge who support and enable our engineering teams.
We combine people, technology and domain specific knowledge to craft tools, services and infrastructure for Arm’s Engineering workforce that improve their productivity. It is a complicated and at times, but there are many opportunities for people who take pride in, and enjoy developing these services and systems to make a real difference.
Responsibilities:
You will have a chance to work across a range of systems, services and tools to provide first-class development environments and productivity tools for both hardware and software engineers around Arm, enabling them to perform the job effectively and efficiently. The domains and areas typically include:
Software build and test solutions using CI/CD, binary, secret and test management.
Exploiting Virtualisation and cloud technologies such as AWS, Kubernetes and Vault.
Migrating services from on-prem based infrastructure to AWS
Our days can be highly dynamic and are usually a mixture of both development and supporting the engineering community with advice on how best to utilize the tools and systems we have available. Development activities range from small incremental improvements and bug fixes to multi-month strategic scale projects. In all our activities we usually spend a large amount of time interacting with the other engineering teams in Arm.
Required Skills and Experience:
A good university degree in computer science/software engineering or equivalent
A working knowledge of software development lifecycle
Significant experience of Linux based infrastructure design, provisioning and maintenance.
Have a broad range of Cloud services experience with a deep knowledge of at least one of the following: AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Demonstrable experience in:
Infrastructure as code technologies such as Terraform, Ansible, Puppet
Containerisation (Kubernetes and Docker)
Interpreted programming languages such as Bash, Python, Ruby or Perl
‘Nice to Have’ Skills and Experience
Self-motivated
Passionate about software development and automation
Have an active interest in Open Source Software
A focus on personal achievement and responsibility
Experience of Microservice Software development using GoLang
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
