DevOps Engineer – £85,000 – £95,000 – 25% Bonus – FTSE 250 – London – Hybrid Working

Overview:
My client, a leading FTSE 250 organisation are looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer to join one of their growing teams in London. You will be working on industry changing modern technology in a world class team.
Roles & Responsibilities:
Work with Senior Platform Engineers and DBAs to design, plan, implement, and release necessary changes according to the needs of the business.
Work on everything from transitioning the on-prem teams into the cloud, helping move to an orchestrated container-based service architecture (Kubernetes and Docker).
Add, improve, and maintain modules in the central Terraform & PowerShell Module library
Consolidate existing Azure resources where possible and migrate on-prem services to PaaS/AKS services with assistance from the platform engineering team and developers.
Manage and monitor systems to ensure that issues are quickly identified and resolved.
Collaborate with the operations and development teams to plan and execute system changes e.g security and audit controls.
Automate build and release manual activities.
Create guides and documentation for the development team to operate and maintain products.
Participate in incident management. Prioritise incidents to help deliver within SLAs. Carry out strong diagnosis to discover root cause and resolutions.
Essential Skills & Experience:
Strong experience with Azure and Azure DevOps pipelines.Excellent hands-on knowledge on the usage of CI/CD processes.Strong experience in engineering and automation of container orchestration with Kubernetes.Hands-on working knowledge of Infrastructure as Code using Ansible, Terraform and PowerShell.Excellent experience with logging and monitoring tools.

Package:
£85,000 – £95,000 basic salaryUp to 25% annual bonus
Generous pension contributions

DevOps Engineer – £85,000 – £95,000 – 25% Bonus – FTSE 250 – London – Hybrid Working Show more

Job Introduction
Graduate DevOps Engineer
Salary: £25,457 to £28,285
Location: Kings Cross, London
Contract: Fixed Term Contract (24 months)
Working Pattern: Full Time, 35 hours per week - Monday to Friday
DevOps is for people who love to learn and tackle complex ideas. If you are interested in joining an innovative and pioneering organisation, then we would love to hear from you.
Main Responsibility
Notting Hill Genesis have an exciting opportunity for a Graduate DevOps Engineer to join our team. This is a superb route into the world of DevOps and Cloud Engineering and a fantastic time to join us as we strive to become a leader in digital technology.
We have embarked on an exciting digital transformation journey and have adopted the latest Microsoft technical stack (i.e., Azure, Microsoft Power Platform, Microsoft 365, Dynamics 365) to develop an innovative digital platform.
This role will see you work on cutting edge software projects using the latest technologies. As part of an agile cross-functional team you will work in a collaborative way and play a key role in each phase of the software deployment lifecycle.
You will be part of our DevOps team working alongside other DevOps to support the design, development and in some cases own the automated deployment, maintenance and monitoring of our PaaS and SaaS products.

The Ideal Candidate
We will make sure you are ready and confident to fulfil the duties of your role. Our training and guidance will help provide you with an in-depth knowledge of the technical tools and skills you'll need to succeed in your career.
This is a key hire for NHG. We are looking for an individual who is passionate and enthusiastic about technology and is keen to learn new tools and technologies.
We are seeking a team player and a passionate collaborator with a focus on what is best for the team. You will be enthusiastic about problem solving and happy to get stuck in with ideas. You will possess excellent oral and written communication skills and be able to liaise with a wide range of individuals.
You will have a clear focus on the customer (both internal and external) with a view to ensure that the work we do meets the expectations of the business and our customers.
We are seeking someone with a Computer Science degree, engineering or related STEM subject qualification. You will have foundational development/ scripting skills (e.g. PowerShell, Bash, .NET) and understand software configuration and deployment methodologies using DevOps. We work in an Agile environment so an understanding of agile methodology would be highly useful.
Our culture of innovation means your ideas and enthusiasm on how to improve our service will be welcomed. If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you.
In return we offer a competitive salary, generous annual leave, health cash plan, season ticket loan, life assurance and a generous contributory pension offer as well as other benefits packages.
Benefits
In return we offer:
Excellent annual leave allowance and flexible working opportunities (qualifying period may apply)
Generous pension scheme
Enhanced maternity, paternity and adoption pay - we offer enhanced maternity and adoption pay in addition to statutory entitlements (qualifying period may apply)
Employee assistance - free confidential advice and counselling services provided by independent specialist organisations
Health cash plan
Staff discounts - we give our staff access to discounts at hundreds of major retailers, gyms, restaurants, entertainment, days out, insurance and much more
Interest free loans: season ticket loan, tenancy deposit loan and training loan
Cycle to work scheme

How to apply
To apply for this role, please upload your CV and supporting statement. Your supporting statement should contain specific examples from your own experience demonstrating how you meet the professional expertise and skills criteria in the role profile.
Your supporting statement (about 500 words long) should cover why you are interested in this role as well as your skills and experiences that meet the criteria covered in the job description/role profile.
Please see the Role Profile for further details. You can request this from our Recruitment Partner - Retinue Solutions.
For further information or an informal conversation regarding the role please contact Tom Bullock 07384 798 495 mailto:t.bullock@retinue-solutions.com
Applications for this role close on Sunday 21 August 2022
About the Company
Notting Hill Genesis is now one of the largest housing associations in London and the south east. We own and manage more than 66,000 homes and employ around 2,000 staff. We provide homes across a range of tenures and are committed to continuing to deliver housing that is affordable to all. Our roots reach back to the 1960s when our legacy organisations were established by local people who shared a similar vision – to house west London’s working poor, providing them a home from which to build themselves and their families a secure future.
Our people
We value our people and both respect and celebrate their differences. We’re proud to say that our colleagues come from different backgrounds, with varied outlooks and are from all over the world. We encourage and are committed to diversity. We know that when people with varied experiences and unique points of view come together, it makes us a stronger organisation and more able to help the wide range of residents that we serve. We want all our colleagues to bring their full selves to work in a culture and environment based on respect and fairness, regardless of role, background or ability.
Our pledges
We are proud signatories of the G15 group’s diversity pledge to encourage more diversity in the boardroom and at senior level. The pledge on Black, Asian and minority ethnic diversity commits NHG to reflect the ethnic diversity of the communities we work in at all levels and particularly at senior managerial, leadership and board levels.
We have under-representation of Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic colleagues at this level and are keen to fill this gap. We welcome applications from everyone. For this role, we especially encourage Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic candidates to join us and be part of an inclusive culture that celebrates diversity, equality of opportunity and provides a place for you to grow your career.
We are also a Stonewall Diversity Champion, a Disability Confident employer and have signed up to Harry’s Pledge. We actively monitor the diversity of our workforce and strive to show equal representation throughout all levels of the organisation.
To find out more about Diversity and inclusion at NHG, please visit our website.

 Graduate DevOps Engineer - Role Profile
Apply
Salary £25,457 to £28,285 per annum for 35 hours per week.
Frequency Annual
Job Reference nhg/TP/838/346
Contract Type Fixed Term
Contract Details 24 months
Working Hours 35
Location 2 Killick Street, United Kingdom
Posted on 01 August, 2022
Closing Date 21 August, 2022 Job Introduction
Graduate DevOps Engineer
Salary: £25,457 to £28,285
Location: Kings Cross, London
Contract: Fixed Term Contract (24 months)
Working Pattern: Full Time, 35 hours per week - Monday to Friday
DevOps is for people who love to learn and tackle complex ideas. If you are interested in joining an innovative and pioneering organisation, then we would love to hear from you.
Main Responsibility
Notting Hill Genesis have an exciting opportunity for a Graduate DevOps Engineer to join our team. This is a superb route into the world of DevOps and Cloud Engineering and a fantastic time to join us as we strive to become a leader in digital technology.
We have embarked on an exciting digital transformation journey and have adopted the latest Microsoft technical stack (i.e., Azure, Microsoft Power Platform, Microsoft 365, Dynamics 365) to develop an innovative digital platform.
This role will see you work on cutting edge software projects using the latest technologies. As part of an agile cross-functional team you will work in a collaborative way and play a key role in each phase of the software deployment lifecycle.
You will be part of our DevOps team working alongside other DevOps to support the design, development and in some cases own the automated deployment, maintenance and monitoring of our PaaS and SaaS products.

The Ideal Candidate
We will make sure you are ready and confident to fulfil the duties of your role. Our training and guidance will help provide you with an in-depth knowledge of the technical tools and skills you'll need to succeed in your career.
This is a key hire for NHG. We are looking for an individual who is passionate and enthusiastic about technology and is keen to learn new tools and technologies.
We are seeking a team player and a passionate collaborator with a focus on what is best for the team. You will be enthusiastic about problem solving and happy to get stuck in with ideas. You will possess excellent oral and written communication skills and be able to liaise with a wide range of individuals.
You will have a clear focus on the customer (both internal and external) with a view to ensure that the work we do meets the expectations of the business and our customers.
We are seeking someone with a Computer Science degree, engineering or related STEM subject qualification. You will have foundational development/ scripting skills (e.g. PowerShell, Bash, .NET) and understand software configuration and deployment methodologies using DevOps. We work in an Agile environment so an understanding of agile methodology would be highly useful.
Our culture of innovation means your ideas and enthusiasm on how to improve our service will be welcomed. If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you.
In return we offer a competitive salary, generous annual leave, health cash plan, season ticket loan, life assurance and a generous contributory pension offer as well as other benefits packages.
Benefits
In return we offer:
Excellent annual leave allowance and flexible working opportunities (qualifying period may apply)
Generous pension scheme
Enhanced maternity, paternity and adoption pay - we offer enhanced maternity and adoption pay in addition to statutory entitlements (qualifying period may apply)
Employee assistance - free confidential advice and counselling services provided by independent specialist organisations
Health cash plan
Staff discounts - we give our staff access to discounts at hundreds of major retailers, gyms, restaurants, entertainment, days out, insurance and much more
Interest free loans: season ticket loan, tenancy deposit loan and training loan
Cycle to work scheme

How to apply
To apply for this role, please upload your CV and supporting statement. Your supporting statement should contain specific examples from your own experience demonstrating how you meet the professional expertise and skills criteria in the role profile.
Your supporting statement (about 500 words long) should cover why you are interested in this role as well as your skills and experiences that meet the criteria covered in the job description/role profile.
Please see the Role Profile for further details. You can request this from our Recruitment Partner - Retinue Solutions.
For further information or an informal conversation regarding the role please contact Tom Bullock 07384 798 495 mailto:t.bullock@retinue-solutions.com
Applications for this role close on Sunday 21 August 2022
About the Company
Notting Hill Genesis is now one of the largest housing associations in London and the south east. We own and manage more than 66,000 homes and employ around 2,000 staff. We provide homes across a range of tenures and are committed to continuing to deliver housing that is affordable to all. Our roots reach back to the 1960s when our legacy organisations were established by local people who shared a similar vision – to house west London’s working poor, providing them a home from which to build themselves and their families a secure future.
Our people
We value our people and both respect and celebrate their differences. We’re proud to say that our colleagues come from different backgrounds, with varied outlooks and are from all over the world. We encourage and are committed to diversity. We know that when people with varied experiences and unique points of view come together, it makes us a stronger organisation and more able to help the wide range of residents that we serve. We want all our colleagues to bring their full selves to work in a culture and environment based on respect and fairness, regardless of role, background or ability.
Our pledges
We are proud signatories of the G15 group’s diversity pledge to encourage more diversity in the boardroom and at senior level. The pledge on Black, Asian and minority ethnic diversity commits NHG to reflect the ethnic diversity of the communities we work in at all levels and particularly at senior managerial, leadership and board levels.
We have under-representation of Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic colleagues at this level and are keen to fill this gap. We welcome applications from everyone. For this role, we especially encourage Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic candidates to join us and be part of an inclusive culture that celebrates diversity, equality of opportunity and provides a place for you to grow your career.
We are also a Stonewall Diversity Champion, a Disability Confident employer and have signed up to Harry’s Pledge. We actively monitor the diversity of our workforce and strive to show equal representation throughout all levels of the organisation.
To find out more about Diversity and inclusion at NHG, please visit our website.

DevOps Engineer with Security experience (DevSecOps)
We are looking for a DevOps Engineer with security experience for a fast-growing Fintech company in Central London.
This is a contract role and you should have excellent communication skills and have worked in "built" environments.
On a daily basis, you will liaise with the information security teams within the organisation and be the bridge between the software development and security team.
As a result, you should have good experience ideally with AWS or Azure cloud security and general security frameworks.
Similarly, you should be a strong DevOps engineer to understand the needs of developers.
Contract role up to £550 a day outside IR35.

Junior DevOps Engineer - Manchester - Salary £35,000-55,000 DOE
The Company: Lorien Global are working in partnership with a global software provider. With offices based in Manchester City Centre they're experience a significant period of growth at present. As such are looking to promote progression opportunities for Juniors within the industry, they're looking for a Junior DevOps Engineer to join the team.
The Role: Your role is to work as part of the Technical Operations Team, you'll be working alongside the established team of skilled engineers who will guide and mentor you as you develop your skills.
Here even as a junior there will be excellent opportunity to work on real, meaningful and complex problems that the team are facing. This practical experience will allow you to put the theory elements of your learning into practise.
We're looking for candidates who understand the concepts behind a DevOps Culture, Cloud Automation and Software Engineering, however it's more important to have a strong motivation to progress a career in the DevOps space.
The Skill Requirements: We're looking for candidates who understand some of the following:
Previous experience in an Infrastructure or Software Engineering position
Understanding of Linux and/or Windows OS
Understanding of cloud technologies from providers like AWS/Azure
Understanding of how Infrastructure as Code works (Terraform/CloudFormation/Ansible/Puppet/Salt/or similar)
Aptitude for learning new skills
Can work effectively in a team and as an individual
The Benefits:
Salary £35,000-55,000 DOE
Individual training programme
Remote working
25 days annual leave
Options to buy/sell more annual leave
Bonus scheme (10%)
Company pension schemes
The is a great role for someone who wants to develop their career in this space. Contact us for further information.

About Enable:
Market forces are dramatically reshaping supply chains, forcing drastic changes in trading behaviors between manufacturers, distributors and retailers. Many key business decisions are being made without a single source of truth to back them up, resulting in struggles to keep up with consumer expectations and increased disputes between partners.
At Enable, we believe in removing barriers between trading partners to create a healthier supply chain — and there’s no better way to do this than with rebates. Rebates drive partner behaviors, while increasing loyalty and trust. They help businesses and their trading partners better understand their data, boost their financial performance, mitigate risks, and drive efficiency and trust. When trading partners can make the best decisions for their businesses, everyone wins: manufacturers, distributors, retailers and, most importantly, end consumers.
That’s the core of what we’re doing at Enable: creating a healthy, vibrant supply chain ecosystem where partner collaboration drives the best products, services and values to customers.
As we grow and scale as a company, we are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our team who can take our services to the next level and help lead improvements to our platforms. This role will be pivotal in helping Enable achieve the agility necessary to reach the hypergrowth requirements of our customers.
The Ideal Candidate Is:
Passionate about building resilient and scalable systems for a company achieving exponential growth.
An ardent technologist who is excited about automation, engineering, and building future proof production reliable platforms
DevOps Engineer Responsibilities:
Help manage and release our SaaS offerings (products) onto our global Azure infrastructure.
Be the CI/CD authority and champion CI/CD best practices across the whole technology team by working with the development teams to ensure great collaboration and constant improvement
System provisioning and automation, monitoring, metrics, scalability, security and hardening.
Work with other engineers, providing the knowledge to deliver a smooth automation process from the start to the end of the project lifecycle.
Help maintain Infrastructure as Code, alongside Docker & Azure Container ecosystem
Accountable for meeting the SLA’s and KPI’s defined for the applications on the Azure platform.
Must Haves:
Strong understanding of Cloud technology – specifically Azure.
Knowledge of IAM stack, including identity, authentication, and federation.
Experience working in a highly available production environment.
Excellent knowledge of Infrastructure as Code, Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment.
Understanding of security and automating security in the pipeline.
Experience integrating test automation frameworks into CI/CD pipelines, coalescing results, and delivering data for decision making.
Nice-To-Haves
C# and Powershell scripting skills (Bash, YAML, etc still a plus)
Experience working with Azure Elastic Pools, App services, containerization, managed Redis, and Application Insights.
Experience working directly for a product or SaaS company
Hypergrowth start-up experience

Enable complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
Enable expressly prohibits any form of unlawful employee harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, genetic information, disability or veteran status. The Role:
As part of the technology organisation at the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA), we run digital products throughout the organisation. We are passionate about delivering value in a fun collaborative manner and being an influencer at the heart of the global RegTech and FinTech revolutions driving the digital economy.
As part of our Agile journey, we have formed Product Groups that combine our Delivery and Service functions.
The Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Product Group provides services using Software as a service (SaaS) capabilities and services to meet the needs of the wider FCA Organisation.
This role will provide full DevOps support for several key SaaS systems in the ERP product group, primarily the Clarizen Project and Portfolio Management, CAMMs Risk Management and Jira toolsets but may be called on to provide technical assistance on other ERP products so experience with other products is a bonus.
Key Accountabilities & Responsibilities:

Working US Hours (12pm-9pm UK time)

Â£65-75k + bonus + benefits package

My large Media client located in London is looking for a DevOps Engineer, experienced with AWS to join their growing team on a fully remote basis, working US hours.

Â

DevOps Engineer Responsibilities:
Experience configuring and managing AWS infrastructure deployments.
Manage our cloud architecture, including capacity planning, increased availability, resiliency, monitoring and alerts, security, and deployment strategy.
Develop and document new processes and make it a priority to assist in knowledge sharing with the team.

Participate in on-call rotation.Requirements:
Solid operations experience supporting a 24x7 production environment
Confident and capable in your AWS abilities
Familiarity with configuration management tools (Ansible, CloudFormation).
Experience working on optimization of an AWS based LAMP stack.
Strong scripting skills in automating standard tasks. Python, Ruby, or Bash experience preferred.
Strong skills in Linux system administration and standard services (HTTPS, DNS, SMTP, NFS).
Knowledge of container technology (such as Docker) to run multiple services independently on the same hardware.
Understanding of networking, routing, and security concepts (ideally: AWS security groups, IAM roles, VPC routing, subnetting).
Skills working with MySQL/RDS database systems.
Dedication to monitoring and alerting systems. We currently use CloudWatch, DataDog, NewRelic and SumoLogic.What you get in return:

Annual bonus
Competitive base salary!
25 days annual leave + bank holidays
Fully remote working
Medical benefits
Income protection and death in service
PensionÂ

About BrightTALK
BrightTALK brings professionals and businesses together to learn and grow. Over 7 million professionals engage with 75,000 free talks and 1,000 online summits to discover new technologies, learn from trusted experts and grow their careers.
Thousands of businesses acquire and inspire their ideal audience with BrightTALK's AI-powered content and demand marketing platform.
We are looking for a talented and passionate DevOps Engineer to join BrightTALK’s Operations team, working in London as part of our UK-wide DevOps team.
The DevOps team is responsible for the ongoing monitoring, scaling, code deployment and health of our busy platform.
We’re a bright, friendly and hard-working team working on unique and interesting challenges that keep us continually learning and improving. Our DevOps team works closely with our software engineers and is part of the project from the initial business requirement to final production deployment - this provides plenty of scope for innovation.
Responsibilities:
The DevOps Engineer role integrates significant Linux experience, AWS knowledge, scripting abilities, information security and debugging skills to implement continuous integration, delivery and deployment to optimize the operational aspects of our platform. The DevOps Engineer background includes experience in large-scale system administration and familiarity with Open Source and cloud services technologies, such as Jenkins, Docker and MySQL.
Key Responsibilities
Help to maintain the overall health and performance of our web applications and services
Build up and implement reliable infrastructure components to deliver highly scalable services on the AWS platform
Automate the deployment, administration and monitoring of our large-scale Linux environments
Work with development teams to enhance, document, establish a process and improve the operability and security of our systems
Skills and Experience
Experience building and maintaining production systems on AWS using EC2, RDS, S3, etc. and familiarity interacting with the AWS CLI is essential
Ability to use a wide variety of open source technologies, cloud services and automation tools e.g. Ansible, Terraform, Packer
Solid scripting skills in one or more of: Python, Bash, Perl, Ruby, PHP
Strong background in Linux/Unix administration
Familiarity with large-scale databases and proficiency in SQL, MySQL.
Familiarity with a broad range of open source technologies, build tools and continuous integration systems (e.g. Jenkins)
Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service
Experience working with containers such as Docker (deployment aspects)
Experience writing tools for automation, configuration and build
Experienced with source code control (GitHub or Bitbucket)
Why we like working at BrightTALK
Friendly, talented, collaborative and entrepreneurial teams.
Generous and comprehensive benefits.
Generous holiday policy with a flexible schedule.
Regular company sponsored social events.
Training allowance and opportunities to innovate.
Team building and volunteering opportunities.
Stock options in our business.
We are dedicated to learning and growing, going after big dreams, taking ownership, remaining open and honest while recognizing we are in it together. We are committed to hiring individuals with a diversity of perspectives, backgrounds, and beliefs who can use their passion to help us build a world changing audience and thrive along the way. Join BrightTALK and experience a collaborative and engaged team who works together to provide learning and growth opportunities for businesses and professionals.
BrightTALK is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state, or local law. About BrightTALK
BrightTALK brings professionals and businesses together to learn and grow. Over 7 million professionals engage with 75,000 free talks and 1,000 online summits to discover new technologies, learn from trusted experts and grow their careers.
Thousands of businesses acquire and inspire their ideal audience with BrightTALK's AI-powered content and demand marketing platform.
We are looking for a talented and passionate DevOps Engineer to join BrightTALK’s Operations team, working in London as part of our UK-wide DevOps team.
The DevOps team is responsible for the ongoing monitoring, scaling, code deployment and health of our busy platform.
We’re a bright, friendly and hard-working team working on unique and interesting challenges that keep us continually learning and improving. Our DevOps team works closely with our software engineers and is part of the project from the initial business requirement to final production deployment - this provides plenty of scope for innovation.
Responsibilities:
The DevOps Engineer role integrates significant Linux experience, AWS knowledge, scripting abilities, information security and debugging skills to implement continuous integration, delivery and deployment to optimize the operational aspects of our platform. The DevOps Engineer background includes experience in large-scale system administration and familiarity with Open Source and cloud services technologies, such as Jenkins, Docker and MySQL. We are looking for a talented and passionate DevOps Engineer to join BrightTALK’s Operations team, working in London as part of our UK-wide DevOps team.

Responsibilities:  
The DevOps Engineer role integrates significant Linux experience, AWS knowledge, scripting abilities, information security and debugging skills to implement continuous integration, delivery and deployment to optimize the operational aspects of our platform. The DevOps Engineer background includes experience in large-scale system administration and familiarity with Open Source and cloud services technologies, such as Jenkins, Docker and MySQL.

ASAP
Huge growth and potential for ambitious software engineers, who love crafting great solutions and making cool consumer products, services and world-firsts.
The business is thriving post-lockdown, being fortunate to be in a growth industry and with millions of customers on-line worldwide.
Specifically this role -
In this role you will work within one of our engineering squads, helping to bridge the gap between software development and infrastructure.
You will providing support to the rest of the squad in areas such as creating & managing CI/CD pipelines (CircleCI/GitHub), developing our AWS infrastructure as code using the CDK in C#, helping ensure our infrastructure automation and deployment is robust, along with helping the other engineers to produce cloud first applications.

This role is about managing and building infrastructure as code, automating infrastructure deployment and manipulating infrastructure using AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK). Using C# (and typescript) the engineer will provision and manipulate AWS resources programmatically.

You'll be interested in -
DevOps practices
Infrastructure as Code / IaC
AWS
CDK / Cloud Development Kit
C# and/or NodeJS
Tyepscript
CircleCI/GitHub
Agile DevOps
Create platforms based around a modern serverless tech stack:
C# Typescript and more... it will evolve and it's 'right tool for the job'
AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK)
Kubernetes
Terraform
CloudFormation

Do you have the experience / skills?

Demonstrable experience in automating operations tasks with one or more scripting languages
Experience creating and/or maintaining production software delivery pipelines using common CI/CD tools
Experience working with AWS CDK ideally (or keenness to learn and experience with CloudFormation and/or Terraform)
Experience supporting and operating production systems
The opportunity
Growth, ownership, aspiring to be the best software team in Manchester while having lots of fun and operating a flexible, friendly working environment.
Please get in touch if you would like to hear more. MandyKettle@UnitingAmbition.com

We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join a team building complex SaaS products for household names such as McDonalds and Starbucks, tacking challenges of scale and mass users.
As a DevOps Engineer you would work in an AWS environment creating CI/CD pipelines, improving and maintaining automation processes and working with the wider engineering team to ensure product reliability as the team grow.
You would also have input into the technologies used by the team as they are looking for Engineers who enjoy using "the right tool for the right situation". As a recent example, the team have started working on a Rust.
We are looking for a DevOps Engineer with:
Hands on experience with AWS
History of working with Infrastructure as Code ( Terraform preferred)
Software background ( open to language environment)
Knowledge of wider DevOps tools such as Ansible, Grafana, Prometheus.
We can offer a DevOps Engineer:
Up to £90,000 salary
Benefits including 10% bonus and healthcare
Hybrid working pattern (time in Watford office)

Main Scope of Role:
Manage and maintain DevOps/toolchain for machine/deep learning apps
 for drug discovery
Code management (git/gitlab) and CI/CD pipelineBuilding robust container workflows with CI/CD pipeline
Key Responsibilities or Core Accountabilities:
Deployment and testing of Docker standalone/Swarm/Stack or KubernetesFull stack deployment of the applicationsService-based architectureHybrid (on-prem/cloud) deployment of scientific applications
Knowledge, Skills & Capabilities:
Demonstrable knowledge of the multiple aspects of DevOps and MLOpsReliable, team player with a collaborative approach.Excellent communication skillsDemonstrable problem solving skillsWorking knowledge of databases and SQL/NoSQL (desirable)
Education, Qualifications and Experience:
BSc in Computer Science, Engineering, or relevant fieldExperience as a DevOps Engineer or similar software engineering roleProficient with git and git workflowsWorking knowledge of Python, Shell ScriptingExperience of container building/deployment
Other Information:
Placement at any of our sites across Europe (UK, France, Italy, Austria, Germany) and the US would be considered, as would a remote role based in one of these countries.
Employees must adhere to all applicable company policies and procedures. Regular and predictable attendance is required. Willingness and ability to work non-standard business hours, such as evenings, weekends and holidays, on an as-needed basis is required. Employees must be able to use good judgment and effectively deal with difficult situations, multiple demands and changing priorities.
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this job. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all the responsibilities, duties and skills required. The time devoted to the activities listed may be changed and other duties may be assigned.

DevOps Engineer
About our Team
You will be joining a collaborative team mid-way through our multi-year DevOps journey. We partner with Digital Business Solutions development teams and underpin their success through engineering and operational best practice. We deliver reliable and resilient AWS infrastructure and are expanding our automated CI/CD delivery pipelines to empower the developers we partner with.
About the Role
You will have the chance to shape our next phase of transformation of our Enterprise infrastructure. Working at scale with the latest DevOps tooling you will have the chance to build infrastructure that supports our applications and seek opportunities for automaton and improvement.

Responsibilities
Deploying and supporting Cloud based solutions to meet business and compliance requirements
Developing and improving infrastructure automation
Design, development, release and deployment of AWS infrastructure and applications, using CI/CD
Working with Development teams and like minded DevOps engineers using an Agile framework
Seeking and implementing efficiencies to erase toil to allow more focus on project work and lasting improvements
Requirements
Be able to demonstrate experience of 24 x 7 operational support of cloud based services
Experience of managing Cloud infrastructure using some sort of IAC tool (We like Terraform, Anisble, Puppet and Jenkins but if you have used something else then we can help you cross train!)
Understanding modern software delivery techniques such as Agile, CI/CD, GIT, Jira
Creative problem solving!
Desire to drive own development and learning
Work in a way that works for you
We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organisation. With an average length of service of 9 years, we are confident that we offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, shared parental leave, study assistance and sabbaticals, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and your long-term goals. Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive
Working with us
We are an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to help you succeed. Here, you will find an inclusive, agile, collaborative, innovative and fun environment, where everyone has a part to play. Regardless of the team you join, we promote a diverse environment with co-workers who are passionate about what they do, and how they do it.

A global leader in information and analytics, we help researchers and healthcare professionals advance science and improve health outcomes for the benefit of society. Building on our publishing heritage, we combine quality information and vast data sets with analytics to support visionary science and research, health education and interactive learning, as well as exceptional healthcare and clinical practice. At Elsevier, your work contributes to the world’s grand challenges and a more sustainable future. We harness innovative technologies to support science and healthcare to partner for a better world.
Join Us
Are you ready to help us progress science and health? Our technology leads to innovation, so join a forward-thinking digital business that is tackling world-scale challenges and align your ambitions with our passion for driving global knowledge-sharing.

Junior DevOps Engineer required to work for an exciting Cloud consultancy working with large customers across the UK, enabling their transformation using public cloud, data and AI services.
During your first two months with Mobilise you will:
Meet your team via a mixture of virtual company social events and Slack channels.
Be allocated a buddy who will guide you through your learning and development pathway.
Be given a structured training plan to give you the tools you need to become a DevOps engineer.
Join up with the service desk squad (team) and start shadowing the support engineers by joining stand-ups and through pair programming.
Learn about Mobilise and the company values we all strive towards.
By month three you will:
Be picking up tasks with the help of your buddy.
Become more involved in the team and will join customer calls.
Learn about Agile delivery methodologies.
By month six you will:
Be working independently
Will have passed your probation period
Understand your objectives and the steps needed to advance in your career

This role initially progresses you through our service desk, working as a Cloud Support Engineer before transitioning to a Junior DevOps Engineer. During this initial period you will be involved in the following tasks:

Triaging support tickets
Carrying out basic changes to cloud infrastructure using Terraform
Fixing issues with customer environments
Assist in the creation of work instructions
Assist in the creation of monthly service reports

As a junior DevOps engineer, you will be involved in the following tasks:
Deploy, manage, and operate scalable, highly available, and fault-tolerant systems on AWS.
Pro-active communication of technical problems and issues.
Implement and manage continuous delivery systems and methodologies on AWS.
Define and deploy monitoring, metrics, and logging systems on AWS.
Implement systems that are highly available, scalable, and self-healing on the AWS platform.
As a junior DevOps engineer, you can expect to work with some, if not all of the following technologies:
Terraform.
Kubernetes.
EKS and ECS.
Git.
Ansible.
Elastic Stack.
CI/CD tooling such as Jenkins and GitLab.
AWS including but not limited to EC2, VPC, EBS, Transit Gateway.
Cloud networking concepts.
Required skills/experience:

At least 12 months experience of working in an IT setting.
Experience of working with AWS and or Azure advantageous but not essential.

Benefits

Salary £20k-£25k (D.O.E)
Entry into bonus scheme, paid 6 monthly.
Entry into workplace pension scheme.
Medicash
Employee Assistance Programme
Access to PerkBox discount scheme.
25 days holidays per annum plus bank holidays.

We’re Simply Business
We insure small businesses and enable big dreams – not just for our customers, but for our people and communities too. With over 850,000 active insurance policies, we protect builders, bakers, landlords, and more than 1,000 other trades.
We harness cutting-edge data ability, believe in experimentation, and build our own technology to deliver better experiences for our customers and employees. This means we’re as much a technology company as one that sells insurance. We build, we fail, we learn, we improve. We’re a B Corp too, which recognises our strong track record of having a positive impact on people, society and the environment.
If Simply Business sounds like the kind of place you’ll thrive, we’d love to hear from you
The DevOps team is responsible for:

You will help bring us closer to our DevOps nirvana and contribute to our Platform as a Service and DevOps culture (test driven infrastructure, automate everything, self-service tooling).
We are product driven, not project driven. Our PaaS built on cloud infrastructure is our product and the rest of the business our customers.
You will be hands on in creating solutions to build and automate environments for production use. You understand the need to build scalable, auditable, reproducible and usable infrastructure. You are security minded and endorse chaos engineering along with the approach of “you build it, you run it” and “you break it, you fix it”.
You will be required to be part of the on call rota, and believe that through well designed systems and automation you will never be called.
We are 100% hosted at AWS (and annually attend re:Invent) have built a PaaS on top to allow our product teams to deploy their applications using a Codebuild / GitHib Actions/Docker/Ansible/Terraform driven, region agnostic, blue-green automated deployment pipeline; this offers both AMIs and Docker images for deployment to our respective AWS EC2 and ECS production environment
In front of this we offer a self-service load balancing solution along with a DSL-based approach for creating and managing our subdomains with regards to DNS, SSL certificates, traffic manager routing and monitoring.
This framework is all done as Infrastructure as Code including integrations of other AWS services (e.g. RDS, S3), with a focus on providing the guardrails for immutable systems and making it as self-service as possible for the Engineering Teams.
We work in a timely, prioritised and start small manner. We look at the highest pain points for both dev and ops and work backwards. We continuously re-evaluate using the right tool for the DevOps job and making abstraction easy.
As a DevOps Engineer you'll:
Moving from Jenkins to Github Actions and AWS Code Build for orchestrating, building and deploying with our CI/CD pipeline
Supporting the deployment of an API Gateway solution along with our Engineering teams.
Upgrading our network infrastructure from hub and spoke VPNs to a centralised configuration using Terraform and AWS Transit Gateways.
 Enabling support for GRaviton and M1 processors across our infrastructureImproving the engineering experience for our core business app (Chopin) and our deployment pipeline.
Embrace DataOps and ML Ops to help our data team automate more of their workload
What we’re looking for:
Linux systems administration.
Experience of cloud hosting such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform.
Experience with continuous delivery / provisioning / deployment.
Building and managing production public-facing sites.
Familiarity with the concept of ‘infrastructure as code’.
Experience with automation tools such as Ansible, Terraform and Cloudformation (but not limited to those mentioned)
Strong programming skills (in any language).
Experience with hosting internet applications - DNS, load balancing, internet protocols, SSL etc...
Experience of monitoring tools such as New Relic.
Experience of logging tools such as ELK.
Experience of secrets management.
Experience of container technologies such as Docker.
Networking skills.
Experience of software / infrastructure testing and ideally TDD.
Our culture is inclusive and diverse
We Embrace Individuality We value what’s important to each and every SBer. Whether that be providing access to cutting edge wellbeing support, or being part of one of our many diversity networks and communities. We also take personal development seriously - we’re all about enabling big dreams.
We Trust Who We Hire We empower SBers with choice and flexibility to make the right decisions based on the needs of their roles and we’ve been working this way long before Covid19.
There’s no one-size-fits all solution when it comes to how often we get together in person, so all of our people and teams find the rhythm that suits them best when it comes to working from home or hub.
We’re innovative We've created a place for people to be curious, experience new things, and bring unique ideas to the table. If you want to learn how we do all this - head over to our Careers page where you’ll see us walk the talk
Our mission is to make Simply Business synonymous with fairness, belonging and inclusivity. We won’t be happy until we’ve created a truly inclusive culture – where every employee, whatever their background, role, or location, feels comfortable being their authentic self at work.
We all have a part to play – to learn more, to do more and to go further – in building this new reality that’ll be befitting of the diversity of the customers we serve. At Simply Business, we’re all in.
What are the benefits?
At Simply Business, our benefits let you balance life and work properly:
flexible parental leave – you can choose to take shared parental leave, plus we offer full pay for the first six months of your maternity leave and four-week fully paid paternity leave, subject to meeting the qualifying criteriaremote working – more of us are currently working remotely than usual, but longer-term you can balance working remotely with working in the office, giving you the opportunity to connect with colleaguesmental health and wellbeing resources – we take your wellbeing seriously, giving you access to counselling (through our Employee Assistance Programme) as well as technology to support your mental health (through the Unmind app)paid sabbatical – two weeks off when you’ve been here for five years and four weeks off when you’ve been here for 10 years
a dedicated learning platform – including a management and leadership programme – the platform lets you balance both work and life goals

And we compensate you fairly:
a competitive salary that reflects your experience, our pay policy and the market we’re in from your first daythe potential to earn an annual bonus based on business performance (those on commission-led roles will be rewarded monthly)we match what you put into your pension up to five per centa health cash plan reimburses your everyday medical expenses (with the opportunity to increase the level of your plan in your flexible benefits)a generous holiday entitlement of 25 days annual leave, plus bank holidays
life assurance of four times of your basic salarySmart Health services including unlimited access to a 24/7 virtual GPa flexible benefits scheme with an allocated allowance each year to choose from benefits including private medical insurance, dental insurance, travel insurance, up to five days extra holiday, and gym membership
These values are important to us and our people
LearningEmpowermentAuthenticityPioneeringSimplicity
These all mean something unique to every person at Simply Business, but if you’re thinking about working here, give them some thought. They’re at the heart of our story. We’re Simply Business

You will be hands on in creating solutions to build and automate environments for production use. You understand the need to build scalable, auditable, reproducible and usable infrastructure. You are security minded and endorse chaos engineering along with the approach of “you build it, you run it” and “you break it, you fix it”.
You will be required to be part of the on call rota, and believe that through well designed systems and automation you will never be called.
We are 100% hosted at AWS (and annually attend re:Invent) have built a PaaS on top to allow our product teams to deploy their applications using a Codebuild / GitHib Actions/Docker/Ansible/Terraform driven, region agnostic, blue-green automated deployment pipeline; this offers both AMIs and Docker images for deployment to our respective AWS EC2 and ECS production environment
In front of this we offer a self-service load balancing solution along with a DSL-based approach for creating and managing our subdomains with regards to DNS, SSL certificates, traffic manager routing and monitoring.
This framework is all done as Infrastructure as Code including integrations of other AWS services (e.g. RDS, S3), with a focus on providing the guardrails for immutable systems and making it as self-service as possible for the Engineering Teams.
We work in a timely, prioritised and start small manner. We look at the highest pain points for both dev and ops and work backwards. We continuously re-evaluate using the right tool for the DevOps job and making abstraction easy.
As a DevOps Engineer you'll:
Moving from Jenkins to Github Actions and AWS Code Build for orchestrating, building and deploying with our CI/CD pipeline
Supporting the deployment of an API Gateway solution along with our Engineering teams.
Upgrading our network infrastructure from hub and spoke VPNs to a centralised configuration using Terraform and AWS Transit Gateways.
 Enabling support for GRaviton and M1 processors across our infrastructureImproving the engineering experience for our core business app (Chopin) and our deployment pipeline.
Embrace DataOps and ML Ops to help our data team automate more of their workload
What we’re looking for:
Linux systems administration.
Experience of cloud hosting such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform.
Experience with continuous delivery / provisioning / deployment.
Building and managing production public-facing sites.
Familiarity with the concept of ‘infrastructure as code’.
Experience with automation tools such as Ansible, Terraform and Cloudformation (but not limited to those mentioned)
Strong programming skills (in any language).
Experience with hosting internet applications - DNS, load balancing, internet protocols, SSL etc...
Experience of monitoring tools such as New Relic.
Experience of logging tools such as ELK.
Experience of secrets management.
Experience of container technologies such as Docker.
Networking skills.
Experience of software / infrastructure testing and ideally TDD.
Our culture is inclusive and diverse
We Embrace Individuality We value what’s important to each and every SBer. Whether that be providing access to cutting edge wellbeing support, or being part of one of our many diversity networks and communities. We also take personal development seriously - we’re all about enabling big dreams.
We Trust Who We Hire We empower SBers with choice and flexibility to make the right decisions based on the needs of their roles and we’ve been working this way long before Covid19.
There’s no one-size-fits all solution when it comes to how often we get together in person, so all of our people and teams find the rhythm that suits them best when it comes to working from home or hub.
We’re innovative We've created a place for people to be curious, experience new things, and bring unique ideas to the table. If you want to learn how we do all this - head over to our Careers page where you’ll see us walk the talk
Our mission is to make Simply Business synonymous with fairness, belonging and inclusivity. We won’t be happy until we’ve created a truly inclusive culture – where every employee, whatever their background, role, or location, feels comfortable being their authentic self at work.
We all have a part to play – to learn more, to do more and to go further – in building this new reality that’ll be befitting of the diversity of the customers we serve. At Simply Business, we’re all in.
What are the benefits?
At Simply Business, our benefits let you balance life and work properly:
flexible parental leave – you can choose to take shared parental leave, plus we offer full pay for the first six months of your maternity leave and four-week fully paid paternity leave, subject to meeting the qualifying criteriaremote working – more of us are currently working remotely than usual, but longer-term you can balance working remotely with working in the office, giving you the opportunity to connect with colleaguesmental health and wellbeing resources – we take your wellbeing seriously, giving you access to counselling (through our Employee Assistance Programme) as well as technology to support your mental health (through the Unmind app)paid sabbatical – two weeks off when you’ve been here for five years and four weeks off when you’ve been here for 10 years
a dedicated learning platform – including a management and leadership programme – the platform lets you balance both work and life goals

And we compensate you fairly:
a competitive salary that reflects your experience, our pay policy and the market we’re in from your first daythe potential to earn an annual bonus based on business performance (those on commission-led roles will be rewarded monthly)we match what you put into your pension up to five per centa health cash plan reimburses your everyday medical expenses (with the opportunity to increase the level of your plan in your flexible benefits)a generous holiday entitlement of 25 days annual leave, plus bank holidays
life assurance of four times of your basic salarySmart Health services including unlimited access to a 24/7 virtual GPa flexible benefits scheme with an allocated allowance each year to choose from benefits including private medical insurance, dental insurance, travel insurance, up to five days extra holiday, and gym membership
These values are important to us and our people
LearningEmpowermentAuthenticityPioneeringSimplicity
These all mean something unique to every person at Simply Business, but if you’re thinking about working here, give them some thought. They’re at the heart of our story. We’re Simply Business
We insure small businesses and enable big dreams – not just for our customers, but for our people and communities too. With over 850,000 active insurance policies, we protect builders, bakers, landlords, and more than 1,000 other trades.
We harness cutting-edge data ability, believe in experimentation, and build our own technology to deliver better experiences for our customers and employees. This means we’re as much a technology company as one that sells insurance. We build, we fail, we learn, we improve. We’re a B Corp too, which recognises our strong track record of having a positive impact on people, society and the environment.
If Simply Business sounds like the kind of place you’ll thrive, we’d love to hear from you

DevOps Engineer
London
As a Barclays DevOps Engineer, you’ll join the team responsible for the delivery, stability and supportability of the Front-Office risk platform supporting the Equity Derivatives business. You’ll implement and champion DevOps and SRE best practices while developing automation and observability solutions and collaborating with other technology teams across the globe as well Front Office users and First-Line support teams.
Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.
This opportunity is open to flexible working arrangements. Such as working from home, flexible or compressed hours, and part-time options. If you have a need for flexibility, please apply and discuss this with us during the hiring process.
What will you be doing?
• You will be responsible for the analysis, design, development, deployment and hand-over to the end users of the solutions developed within the team
Ensuring these solutions meet our Control and Security requirements and help improve the stability of our platform, yet allowing higher volume of changes and activityEnsuring we increase the productivity of our wider engineering teamAdopting and promoting best practices within the larger team and organizationAchieving, and championing, our Excellence in Execution objectives
Hybrid Working
We are currently operating in a hybrid working environment, meaning that many colleagues spend part of their working hours at home and part in the office, depending on the nature of the role they are in. Please discuss the detail of the working pattern options for the role with the hiring manager.
What we’re looking for:
• Proficiency in at least one scripting programming language
Experience with large and complex distributed systemsExperience with successfully implementation monitoring and operational data analysis solutionsExperience with successfully deploying automation solutions
Skills that will help you in the role:
• Proficiency in Java 11 or above with understanding of multithreading
Proven ability to pick up and learn new technologiesExperience with implementing SRE practicesExperience with implementing automation and Observability solutionsSome data analysis understanding
Where will you be working?
5 North Colonnade is home to our investment bank and is in the heart of Canary Wharf, just a short walk from our headquarters at Churchill Place. It boasts an array of onsite amenities such as dry cleaner as well as a deli and buffet style staff restaurant. The building is easily accessible by tube, docklands light railway and all major bus links. The atmosphere is second to none with a real buzz being created around the offices within.

job_title: DevOps Engineer (Remote) - GCN / Global Cycling Network
listing_jobDesc:
As DevOps Engineer, you will support all of the backend teams in developing their infrastructure by guiding, mentoring and consulting, as well as getting hands on with them where necessary. This will range from assisting in designing and setting up monitoring and alerting as well as developing IaC and processes to ensure future scalability.

You’ll help small development teams to move quickly, while orchestrating our workflow, infrastructure and production services. It's a collaborative culture, working alongside existing teams, and a change to work on greenfield projects.

We're always open to new ideas and you can influence where we go and how we get there. You'll have a lot of freedom in design, technology choice and influence over the roadmap and current ecosystem - we'll welcome your influence
You will have access to online training courses in a wide variety of topics to help you keep developing professionally, as well as be able to attend conferences to keep your skills up to date.
The Role:

Reviewing our infrastructure, articulating its development objectives and priorities
Orchestrating and automating workloads across cloud platforms such as GCP, AWS and Mongo Atlas
Advise and implement infrastructure strategies using Infrastructure as Code
Security and continuity enhancements
Integrating with Discovery Inc and technology partners
Ensure scalability across our broad range of services by providing advice and implementing solutions in conjunction with all digital teams
Provide advice to teams during incidents and help diagnose and solve the problem
Skills, Knowledge and Experience:

Understanding of CI / CD principles, methods and tooling
Good abilities in Kubernetes, and GNU / Linux administration
Experience with Terraform, or a similar IaC tool
Understanding of cloud-infrastructure technologies

Our Benefits:

Working with a world-class team to develop cutting-edge products and breaking new ground in the cycling industry online
Personal development time
The opportunity to develop your skillset by working alongside some of the best people in the industry (including a CTO from Google), to solve hard problems in a fast-growing department and business
Be part of a collaborative team with a strong emphasis on pair programming
A sociable work environment with lots of responsibility and autonomy
A real focus on a healthy work-life balance with working-from-home opportunities and flexible working hours
5 weeks holiday, plus bank holidays & Christmas week shutdown
Enhanced sick pay & Pension Plan
Modern offices with air-con, showers, bike parking & coffee machines (when covid allows)
Company bike rides each summer during office hours
Christmas Party
Free lunch every month before payday
Free birthday pizza lunch out
Welcome gifts: GCN/GMBN cycling and casual wear
Up to 50% discount in the GCN, GMBN and GTN shops

To understand more about the products that our Digital Team work on, we recommend that you download the GCN App, available on iOS and Android.

We also recommend that you also take a look at our eCommerce stores,
GCN
,
GMBN
,
GTN,
and
EMBN
.

To read more abour careers at Play Sports Network, please click

As a DevOps Application Developer within the Investment Management Services (IMS) application delivery space, the main purpose of the role is to:  * Increase productivity and reduce issues across the IMS team * Continuously automate development, release and support processes * Improve and maintain CI/CD pipelines * Automate testing and monitoring frameworksKey Responsibilities:  * Collect, analyse and document technical/operational requirements from key IMS stakeholders * Design and implement automation for IMS processes * Knowledge share across the team with some mentoring from more senior members * Participate in team workshopsTechnical Competencies, and Skills:  * Experience expected in: o Azure Pipelines and CI / CDo Atlassian Jira and other productso Languages: PowerShell / Python / C# * Desirable experience in: o Scheduling Systems (preferably JAMS)o Testing Frameworkso Power BI Reporting * Expected to produce clear, concise, maintainable code. * Ability to share knowledge / This is a brand new opportunity to join a growing and exciting software company based in Oxfordshire.

They have developed a leading comprehensive situational awareness tool for elite professionals. They launched in 2008 with a core mission to help save lives and support those in the operational field.

You would be responsible for maintaining and enhancing the live services functionality, deployment of new versions, internal automation (CICD), and cost management.


Key skills:
Linux flavours Ubuntu / Centos as well as Windows server
Continuous Integration & Continuous Deployment principles (esp. Jenkins)
Containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes)
Infrastructure & Configuration Management (Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Terraform, etc.)
Cloud Computing platforms (esp. AWS)
Desirable:
Certified to professional level with AWS and/Or Azure or able to achieve this in your initial 3 months in the role
If this sounds of interest, then please apply for consideration.

Salary expectation: £80,000 per annum
Location: Oxfordshire

Want to apply your DevOps skills to a variety of projects? Enjoy sharing your cloud knowledge? Inquisitive and collaborative?
We’re looking for skilled DevOps professionals, interested in the cloud. So, come join the Cloudsoft tribe, one the UK’s Best Workplaces in Tech!

Salary: £45k - £75k, dependent on experience.
About the role

We’re looking for skilled DevOps professionals, interested in the cloud, to join our talented team. As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you’ll be participating in the end-to-end design and implementation of DevOps Pipeline and AWS cloud solutions for our Cloudsoft Tempo customers.

You’ll be able to communicate with technical and non-technical clients, advising them on their AWS environments and providing implementation support where required.

You’ll work closely with your fellow cloud engineers, helping customers to use the cloud better. Whether it’s a cloud migration project, modernising applications, implementing DevOps pipelines designing cloud-native applications, advising on cost optimisation, Well Architected Reviews and more, you’ll bring your knowledge of AWS services and DevOps tools and innovations to every customer interaction.

Cloudsoft Tempo customers range from small start-ups to large financial services firms and everything in between, so you’ll get the opportunity to constantly learn and develop your skills to support our growing client-lists’ needs. See some of our recent customer projects here.

Cloudsoft culture’s is underpinned by our core values;

We Wow Customers
We Take Pride
We Give Kudos
We Do It Right
We Do It Together

We encourage applications from candidates from underrepresented backgrounds. Remote and part-time working will be considered.
Your skills
As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you’ll need a range of technical and non-technical skills. Your tech skills will help you to design the best solutions for our customers, but you also need to be able to communicate these solutions to technical and non-technical audiences.

Candidates must be UK based or willing to relocate. We may consider visa sponsorship if required and all prerequisites are met.
Technical
Experience with any of the following is highly desirable:

Infrastructure as code, such as Terraform or CloudFormation.
Configuration management tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef or SaltStack
Automation and CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins, CircleCi, CodeBuild...)
Serverless, Kubernetes, and traditional application stacks
Designing, developing, and operating production environments
Certification (Professional or Associate level), but there will also be assistance to gain (further) certification.
Agile/iterative development methodologies
Programming languages and/or scripting languages
Non-technical
Your application should also demonstrate these skills, in addition to your technical skills.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Confidence when working with customers.

Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to a non-technical audience.

Produce high quality technical documentation.

Able to build positive relationships with stakeholders in client organisations.

Able to lead, and work on, projects whilst maintaining a clear communication with the wider Cloudsoft Tempo team.

Collaboration skills.

LAST NAME*
EMAIL*

COVER LETTER (OPTIONAL, PDF ONLY)
LINKEDIN PROFILE

Cloudsoft will use these details to provide you with information about our products and services. You may unsubscribe from these communications at any time. For more information, please view our Privacy Policy.
About Cloudsoft

As an AWS Advanced Consulting Partner, Cloudsoft helps customers navigate the maze of cloud and design the best solutions for their needs. We are also FinOps Foundation Members and Practitioners.

You will join a team of talented engineers and consultants who are passionate about helping our customers succeed in the cloud and who are continually learning, sharing knowledge and solving real-world problems for customers.

Read more about our team on Talent Scotland and Great Place To Work.

Cloudsoft has a tightly focused and growing team of 36, with a strong focus on inclusion, quality and growth. There are excellent opportunities to be involved in other areas of the business and to develop depth and breadth of skills, in addition to good benefits and salary in the range of £45k to £75k commensurate with experience.

Benefits include:

Training and development days
Up to 37 days paid holiday every year
Private pension contributions
Private health insurance
Share options
Perks (Perkbox, Cycle2Work scheme, electric car leasing, financial coaching and more)
Monthly team events and activities.

We’re based in city-centre Edinburgh (check out the view!), but have teammates working remotely all over the UK. Want to apply your DevOps skills to a variety of projects? Enjoy sharing your cloud knowledge? Inquisitive and collaborative?

Cloudsoft will use these details to provide you with information about our products and services. You may unsubscribe from these communications at any time. For more information, please view our Privacy Policy.
About Cloudsoft

As an AWS Advanced Consulting Partner, Cloudsoft helps customers navigate the maze of cloud and design the best solutions for their needs. We are also FinOps Foundation Members and Practitioners.

You will join a team of talented engineers and consultants who are passionate about helping our customers succeed in the cloud and who are continually learning, sharing knowledge and solving real-world problems for customers.

Read more about our team on Talent Scotland and Great Place To Work.

Cloudsoft has a tightly focused and growing team of 36, with a strong focus on inclusion, quality and growth. There are excellent opportunities to be involved in other areas of the business and to develop depth and breadth of skills, in addition to good benefits and salary in the range of £45k to £75k commensurate with experience.

Benefits include:

Training and development days
Up to 37 days paid holiday every year
Private pension contributions
Private health insurance
Share options
Perks (Perkbox, Cycle2Work scheme, electric car leasing, financial coaching and more)
Monthly team events and activities.

We’re based in city-centre Edinburgh (check out the view!), but have teammates working remotely all over the UK. Want to apply your DevOps skills to a variety of projects? Enjoy sharing your cloud knowledge? Inquisitive and collaborative?
We’re looking for skilled DevOps professionals, interested in the cloud. So, come join the Cloudsoft tribe, one the UK’s Best Workplaces in Tech!

Salary: £45k - £75k, dependent on experience.
About the role

We’re looking for skilled DevOps professionals, interested in the cloud, to join our talented team. As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you’ll be participating in the end-to-end design and implementation of DevOps Pipeline and AWS cloud solutions for our Cloudsoft Tempo customers.

You’ll be able to communicate with technical and non-technical clients, advising them on their AWS environments and providing implementation support where required.

You’ll work closely with your fellow cloud engineers, helping customers to use the cloud better. Whether it’s a cloud migration project, modernising applications, implementing DevOps pipelines designing cloud-native applications, advising on cost optimisation, Well Architected Reviews and more, you’ll bring your knowledge of AWS services and DevOps tools and innovations to every customer interaction.

Cloudsoft Tempo customers range from small start-ups to large financial services firms and everything in between, so you’ll get the opportunity to constantly learn and develop your skills to support our growing client-lists’ needs. See some of our recent customer projects here.

Cloudsoft culture’s is underpinned by our core values;

We Wow Customers
We Take Pride
We Give Kudos
We Do It Right
We Do It Together

We encourage applications from candidates from underrepresented backgrounds. Remote and part-time working will be considered.
Your skills
As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you’ll need a range of technical and non-technical skills. Your tech skills will help you to design the best solutions for our customers, but you also need to be able to communicate these solutions to technical and non-technical audiences.

Candidates must be UK based or willing to relocate. We may consider visa sponsorship if required and all prerequisites are met.
Technical
Experience with any of the following is highly desirable:

Infrastructure as code, such as Terraform or CloudFormation.
Configuration management tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef or SaltStack
Automation and CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins, CircleCi, CodeBuild...)
Serverless, Kubernetes, and traditional application stacks
Designing, developing, and operating production environments
Certification (Professional or Associate level), but there will also be assistance to gain (further) certification.
Agile/iterative development methodologies
Programming languages and/or scripting languages
Non-technical
Your application should also demonstrate these skills, in addition to your technical skills.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Confidence when working with customers.

Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to a non-technical audience.

Produce high quality technical documentation.

Able to build positive relationships with stakeholders in client organisations.

Able to lead, and work on, projects whilst maintaining a clear communication with the wider Cloudsoft Tempo team.

Collaboration skills.

 About the role

We’re looking for skilled DevOps professionals, interested in the cloud, to join our talented team. As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you’ll be participating in the end-to-end design and implementation of DevOps Pipeline and AWS cloud solutions for our Cloudsoft Tempo customers.

You’ll be able to communicate with technical and non-technical clients, advising them on their AWS environments and providing implementation support where required.

You’ll work closely with your fellow cloud engineers, helping customers to use the cloud better. Whether it’s a cloud migration project, modernising applications, implementing DevOps pipelines designing cloud-native applications, advising on cost optimisation, Well Architected Reviews and more, you’ll bring your knowledge of AWS services and DevOps tools and innovations to every customer interaction.

Cloudsoft Tempo customers range from small start-ups to large financial services firms and everything in between, so you’ll get the opportunity to constantly learn and develop your skills to support our growing client-lists’ needs. See some of our recent customer projects here.

For more information, please view our Privacy Policy. About Cloudsoft

As an AWS Advanced Consulting Partner, Cloudsoft helps customers navigate the maze of cloud and design the best solutions for their needs. We are also FinOps Foundation Members and Practitioners.

You will join a team of talented engineers and consultants who are passionate about helping our customers succeed in the cloud and who are continually learning, sharing knowledge and solving real-world problems for customers.

Read more about our team on Talent Scotland and Great Place To Work.

Cloudsoft has a tightly focused and growing team of 36, with a strong focus on inclusion, quality and growth. There are excellent opportunities to be involved in other areas of the business and to develop depth and breadth of skills, in addition to good benefits and salary in the range of £45k to £75k commensurate with experience.

Benefits include:

Training and development days
Up to 37 days paid holiday every year
Private pension contributions
Private health insurance
Share options
Perks (Perkbox, Cycle2Work scheme, electric car leasing, financial coaching and more)
Monthly team events and activities.

We’re based in city-centre Edinburgh (check out the view!), but have teammates working remotely all over the UK. About Cloudsoft

ASAP
DevOps Engineer
Manchester
£50,000 - £80,000
A fantastic opportunity for a DevOps Engineer to join a market leader in their industry. This is a great opportunity to work with the latest technologies and methodologies and influence the future of an enterprise scale business in the Cloud and DevOps space.
Desired skills:
Being capable of planning and managing your workload to suit multiple project deadlines.
Collaborate and share knowledge with other team members.
Cloud-based Linux environments: Google Cloud Platform, some AWS
Containerisation & Virtualisation: Docker, Kubernetes
Infrastructure as code with Ansible and Terraform
Primary development languages: PHP, JavaScript
Web servers: Apache & Nginx
MySQL.
NoSQL & Search (Datastore, Elasticsearch/Lucene)
Memcache, Queueing systems, Pub/Sub technologies
Build & deployment tools: GitHub, Composer, Travis, PHPUnit
An API ecosystem, using OAuth, HMAC, JSON over HTTPS
Benefits: -
25 days holiday (plus bank holidays)
A ‘go home’ culture where no one is expecting you to be still in the office past your working hours
A personal career development plan and regular one to ones
Twice yearly pay reviews that are not tied to the company’s performance or your current job title
A Windows, Mac or Linux laptop
Health Assured Employee Assistance Programme
A generous employee referral scheme
Flexible working hours and no dress code
Share grant scheme
Employer pension scheme
DevOps Engineer, Manchester, £50,000 - £80,000
