DEVOPS ENGINEER

Level
L3 - Manager

Closing Date:
27/08/2022

Permanent / Fixed Term
Permanent

Support Centre Location
London Office

More about the role
DevOps Engineer
We’re New Look and we’ve been at the forefront of British high-street fashion since 1969. Over the last 50 years, we’ve grown to be a global, multichannel brand offering on-trend, value-driven fashion for women, men, girls and boys.

Our passion is feel-good fashion at feel-good prices – and we truly believe that all starts with us. Our values inspire us every day: we play to win, we’re customer-obsessed and we work as one to give each and every one of our customers That New Look Feeling.

It's a busy and exciting time for the brand and we’re on the hunt for a DevOps Engineer to join our growing Digital Engineering team.

The Team
Our IT team don't accept the status quo, we think disruptively about Technology and how we can use it. We collaborate with the business to deliver that technology which supports our business ambition to be the leading omnichannel retailer. We strive to do the right thing, always, focusing on safe, secure and reliable operations, while seeking out quality technology for our customers and colleagues to support and drive our business goals. By focusing on the value, we're creating and ensuring our delivery choices suit the product and project ambitions, we challenge ourselves and thrive.

The Role:
The role will sit in our Technology function in our Engineering Team whose primary focus is to develop the digital and cloud capability for New Look. The team is brand new and currently in the process of being set-up. This is a brilliant opportunity for someone who wants to be part of something right at the start and be involved in creating an innovative team culture. This is a great opportunity for a motivated individual with a strong work ethic. As a Software Engineer (DevOps) you will be a key player in the Engineering team.

About You:
Skill Requirements:
Prior experience and proficiency with the following (cloud) platforms and services: Terraform, Kubernetes, Azure
Prior experience and proficiency in working with development lifecycle and source control systems, preferably git, Gitlab and Jira
Prior experience in Agile with JIRA and team collaboration.
Prior experience and proficiency in security minded designs, implementations and integrations
Preferable prior experience in the following technologies: React/Next.js, Typescript, GraphQL, Node/NestJS
Preferable experience with automated testing including integration tests
Proven team player with a can-do mentality

The Role:
Plans tasks for self and is accountable for their delivery.
Drives development of fast, clean and reliable code
Responsible for understanding business problems and designing, developing / configuring, testing, and deploying software to provide the solution
Depending on the team, responsibilities may include building pipelines, building test strategy, building cloud environments to be used in part of the development processes
Ensures the delivery of the software is high quality and automated as much as possible
Working in a growing environment that has/uses Test Driven Development, Agile, and Scrum methodologies
Advocates DevOps culture, tooling, delivery methods as part of a larger cross-functional team
Understands cloud cost models and can run cloud readiness assessments
Has knowledge of cloud security and seeks implementation of best practices
Camaraderie with the engineering team and other professionals in the company.
Communicate proficiently and professionally to customers and co-workers.
Deliver new software features promptly and free of defects.
Being dedicated and willing to follow through with individual and team commitments.

Additional expectations:
May be required to work occasionally in addition to the standard 9-5 working hours to troubleshoot issues with live applications
Experience of working within squads and collaborating with internal stakeholders to translate business requirements to technical requirements and solutions

Behavioural Skills:
At New Look, we live by our values, Play to Win, It starts with me, We are one and Customer Obsessed. We believe that our values are crucial to our success.
Good communicator at all levels
Attention to detail
Team Player
Assertive
Confident
Self-starter

Why New Look?
The amazing people, the love of fashion, the 4pm Friday finishes – there are so many reasons to love working at New Look. We prioritise development, offering training to support your progression, so you can be at your absolute best and achieve your goals. You’ll also receive these amazing benefits, to name only a few:
40% staff discount
Monthly 25% off privilege vouchers for family and friends to enjoy
Quarterly sample sales
Season ticket loans

About The Role

As a DevOps Engineer for our Cloud practice, you will work with your team to make impactful contributions for the company and our clients. You will work on client projects to provide infrastructure, IT operations, and security advice in the delivery of mission-critical, deep technical solutions across the enterprise. As a DevOps Engineer, you will adopt and contribute to the highest quality engineering practices, and take part in designing and delivering innovative infrastructure focused technical solutions to bring about business change and faster time to value realisation.

TPXimpact is creating a groundbreaking technology consulting business, to deliver world class engineering solutions for our clients. We aim to achieve this through our focus on technical quality and properly implemented Agile methodologies. We have gained excellent traction and are working with prestigious, progressive organisations to drive their digital transformations.

By joining us, you would shape and create the practices that you want to work with. You would work alongside people who share an enthusiasm for technology, for an organisation that values technical quality at every layer, and one that will take an active role in training and improving your skill set.

This role can be based anywhere in the UK. We encourage you to work where you feel most effective. That may be at home, from one of our office hubs or a combination of both. The choice is yours. However you choose to work, you need to be comfortable working with your colleagues remotely as even if you choose to work in a hub, you will likely be working with people based elsewhere. Some travel to client sites may also be expected for this role. This would be for ceremonies such as kick-off meetings, rather than on a regular basis.

Responsibilities

Help our clients modernise their architecture and core technologies
Be an active member of the team to help with the delivery of new architecture solutions, platforms, infrastructure, and products
Be part of a team that builds full-stack automated quality - IaC, deployment, security, and monitoring
Consult on engineering good practice and quality standards
Take advantage of our training opportunities to grow your skill set
Work in ambitious and dynamic teams, embracing the latest approaches and technologies

About You

More than any specific list of skills or qualifications, we want engineers who love technology, and contribute their opinions to drive through the entire development lifecycle. We want people who bring something unique, in technical knowledge, experience or mindset. If you think that’s you, regardless of how well you think you match the list below, please apply for this role.

Experience with a major cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Some experience with Infrastructure as code
Computer network knowledge (routing/routed protocols)
Industry vendor certifications are desired (e.g. Azure, AWS, GCP or CNCF/Kubernetes certifications); although not essential if you have demonstrable ability
A technology and platform agnostic perspective
Passion and enthusiasm to help drive the creation of a truly empowering engineering culture at TPXimpact
A strong desire to learn would be beneficial
About Us
Why work at TPXimpact

The opportunity to achieve impact in the public sector through your work
Flexible working to help you function at your best
We’re collaborative, and will readily give our time to help your development and invest in your training
Everyone has a voice - inclusivity and respect are key to our culture
A focus on wellbeing with access to a range of wellness activities and an annual Fitness challenges
An inclusive workplace with active advocacy networks for women, LGBTQI employees and people from ethnic minorities
Some of the benefits include:

30 days holiday + Bank Holidays
2 charity volunteer days for causes that you are passionate about
Working from home allowance
Maternity/Paternity - 6months Maternity Leave, 3 months Paternity Leave
Life Assurance
Employer Pension Contribution of 5%
Health Cash Plan
Personal Learning & Development budget
Employee Assistance Programme
Access to equity in the business through a Share Incentive Plan
Green incentive programmes including Electric Vehicle Leasing and the Cycle to Work Scheme
Dental insurance
Financial advice
Health assessments
 About TPXimpact
What is TPXimpact? We're TPXimpact. We deliver transformation that matters to organisations, to public services and to society. Our multidisciplinary teams work across technology, design, and digital experiences. We're united by the belief that it's possible to deliver more – that by harnessing digital technologies, modern ways of working and a fresh mindset we can create better outcomes for people and the planet.
This is what impact means to us.
Impactful, sustainable, digital transformation
We have the scale and capabilities to truly deliver impactful, sustainable, digital transformation that enriches how individuals and society experience the world. Our clients will work with the most skilled and experienced digital and technology specialists across the UK who will share their knowledge to ensure you have the potential to continue developing our work once we're gone.


We’re an inclusive employer, and we care about diversity in our teams. Let us know in your application if you have accessibility requirements during the interview. About The Role

As a DevOps Engineer for our Cloud practice, you will work with your team to make impactful contributions for the company and our clients. You will work on client projects to provide infrastructure, IT operations, and security advice in the delivery of mission-critical, deep technical solutions across the enterprise. As a DevOps Engineer, you will adopt and contribute to the highest quality engineering practices, and take part in designing and delivering innovative infrastructure focused technical solutions to bring about business change and faster time to value realisation.

TPXimpact is creating a groundbreaking technology consulting business, to deliver world class engineering solutions for our clients. We aim to achieve this through our focus on technical quality and properly implemented Agile methodologies. We have gained excellent traction and are working with prestigious, progressive organisations to drive their digital transformations.

By joining us, you would shape and create the practices that you want to work with. You would work alongside people who share an enthusiasm for technology, for an organisation that values technical quality at every layer, and one that will take an active role in training and improving your skill set.

This role can be based anywhere in the UK. We encourage you to work where you feel most effective. That may be at home, from one of our office hubs or a combination of both. The choice is yours. However you choose to work, you need to be comfortable working with your colleagues remotely as even if you choose to work in a hub, you will likely be working with people based elsewhere. Some travel to client sites may also be expected for this role. This would be for ceremonies such as kick-off meetings, rather than on a regular basis.

Responsibilities

Help our clients modernise their architecture and core technologies
Be an active member of the team to help with the delivery of new architecture solutions, platforms, infrastructure, and products
Be part of a team that builds full-stack automated quality - IaC, deployment, security, and monitoring
Consult on engineering good practice and quality standards
Take advantage of our training opportunities to grow your skill set
Work in ambitious and dynamic teams, embracing the latest approaches and technologies

About You

More than any specific list of skills or qualifications, we want engineers who love technology, and contribute their opinions to drive through the entire development lifecycle. We want people who bring something unique, in technical knowledge, experience or mindset. If you think that’s you, regardless of how well you think you match the list below, please apply for this role.

Experience with a major cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Some experience with Infrastructure as code
Computer network knowledge (routing/routed protocols)
Industry vendor certifications are desired (e.g. Azure, AWS, GCP or CNCF/Kubernetes certifications); although not essential if you have demonstrable ability
A technology and platform agnostic perspective
Passion and enthusiasm to help drive the creation of a truly empowering engineering culture at TPXimpact
A strong desire to learn would be beneficial
About Us
Why work at TPXimpact

The opportunity to achieve impact in the public sector through your work
Flexible working to help you function at your best
We’re collaborative, and will readily give our time to help your development and invest in your training
Everyone has a voice - inclusivity and respect are key to our culture
A focus on wellbeing with access to a range of wellness activities and an annual Fitness challenges
An inclusive workplace with active advocacy networks for women, LGBTQI employees and people from ethnic minorities
Some of the benefits include:

30 days holiday + Bank Holidays
2 charity volunteer days for causes that you are passionate about
Working from home allowance
Maternity/Paternity - 6months Maternity Leave, 3 months Paternity Leave
Life Assurance
Employer Pension Contribution of 5%
Health Cash Plan
Personal Learning & Development budget
Employee Assistance Programme
Access to equity in the business through a Share Incentive Plan
Green incentive programmes including Electric Vehicle Leasing and the Cycle to Work Scheme
Dental insurance
Financial advice
Health assessments
 About TPXimpact
What is TPXimpact? We're TPXimpact. We deliver transformation that matters to organisations, to public services and to society. Our multidisciplinary teams work across technology, design, and digital experiences. We're united by the belief that it's possible to deliver more – that by harnessing digital technologies, modern ways of working and a fresh mindset we can create better outcomes for people and the planet.
This is what impact means to us.
Impactful, sustainable, digital transformation

Moody’s (NYSE: MCO) is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions. Our data, analytical solutions and insights help decision-makers identify opportunities and manage the risks of doing business with others. We believe that greater transparency, more informed decisions, and fair access to information open the door to shared progress. With over 11,000 employees in more than 40 countries, Moody’s combines international presence with local expertise and over a century of experience in financial markets. Learn more at moodys.com.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

Moody’s Analytics provides financial intelligence and analytical tools supporting our clients’ growth, efficiency and risk management objectives. The combination of our unparalleled expertise in risk, expansive information resources, and innovative application of technology, helps today’s business leaders confidently navigate an evolving marketplace.

Department

In Buy-side Solutions, we serve investors, consultants and asset managers by helping them make better decisions. Our next-generation buy-side technology enhances customer performance, improves governance and ultimately helps win more business. Our dedicated team of sales, marketing and product management experts are passionate about delivering effective solutions to our customers.
Role/Responsibilities

The DevOps Engineer will be part of a project team that will participate in the design, development, testing,
implementation, support and documentation related to automation, server/application configuration, build and deploy, and activities related to end to end solutions.
Automation and processes required to deploy, manage, configure, scale, and monitor internal, product, and cloud-based applications.Implementation and support of build and deploy workflow processes related to product development.Management and support of infrastructure and development applications including continuous integration, source code management, and hosted applications.Work collaboratively with team members to ensure successful delivery and implementation of assigned tasks.Coordinate with corporate IT organization to identify, refine, and validate technology requirements especially in regards to build and deploy activities and cloud activities.Guide development teams in their DevOps journey

This position can sit anywhere in the UK.

Qualifications

A Moody’s employee in this role would typically have 1-3 years of experience in the following areas:

o Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery process
o CI/CD tools (e.g git, Azure DevOps)
o Cloud (Microsoft Azure …)
o Infrastructure as Code (e.g terraform)
o Container technologies (kubernetes, helm, docker…)
o Linux/Windows Platforms
o Scripting (bash, Powershell, etc.)
Knowledge of software development life cycle (SDLC) including Agile Development MethodologyExcellent communication, interpersonal, and, consultative skills, work effectively with clients, vendors, peers, and business/IT management.Strong analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills.Ability to stay current on trends and development within functional area of experience along with the industry.Self-assured and confident with professional approach.Ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines.

True leaders are always learning. Moody’s is home to information architects, thinkers, builders, and passionate problem solvers, a collection of diverse viewpoints working together to bring out our best. Join us. Forward Together.

Moody’s (NYSE: MCO) is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions. Our data, analytical solutions and insights help decision-makers identify opportunities and manage the risks of doing business with others. We believe that greater transparency, more informed decisions, and fair access to information open the door to shared progress. With over 11,000 employees in more than 40 countries, Moody’s combines international presence with local expertise and over a century of experience in financial markets. Learn more at moodys.com.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

Moody’s Analytics provides financial intelligence and analytical tools supporting our clients’ growth, efficiency and risk management objectives. The combination of our unparalleled expertise in risk, expansive information resources, and innovative application of technology, helps today’s business leaders confidently navigate an evolving marketplace.

Department

In Buy-side Solutions, we serve investors, consultants and asset managers by helping them make better decisions. Our next-generation buy-side technology enhances customer performance, improves governance and ultimately helps win more business. Our dedicated team of sales, marketing and product management experts are passionate about delivering effective solutions to our customers.
Role/Responsibilities

The DevOps Engineer will be part of a project team that will participate in the design, development, testing,
implementation, support and documentation related to automation, server/application configuration, build and deploy, and activities related to end to end solutions.
Automation and processes required to deploy, manage, configure, scale, and monitor internal, product, and cloud-based applications.Implementation and support of build and deploy workflow processes related to product development.Management and support of infrastructure and development applications including continuous integration, source code management, and hosted applications.Work collaboratively with team members to ensure successful delivery and implementation of assigned tasks.Coordinate with corporate IT organization to identify, refine, and validate technology requirements especially in regards to build and deploy activities and cloud activities.Guide development teams in their DevOps journey

This position can sit anywhere in the UK.

Qualifications

A Moody’s employee in this role would typically have 1-3 years of experience in the following areas:

o Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery process
o CI/CD tools (e.g git, Azure DevOps)
o Cloud (Microsoft Azure …)
o Infrastructure as Code (e.g terraform)
o Container technologies (kubernetes, helm, docker…)
o Linux/Windows Platforms
o Scripting (bash, Powershell, etc.)
Knowledge of software development life cycle (SDLC) including Agile Development MethodologyExcellent communication, interpersonal, and, consultative skills, work effectively with clients, vendors, peers, and business/IT management.Strong analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills.Ability to stay current on trends and development within functional area of experience along with the industry.Self-assured and confident with professional approach.Ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines.

Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

A company operating within conversational artificial intelligence are seeking a decisive and insightful DevOps Engineer to join their technical team in various stages of each product’s lifespan, and ensure that all outputs remain safe for public consumption.

So far their projects have included the development of a humanoid robot capable of interacting autonomously and naturally with the general public, an animated AI designed to engage in emotionally aware conversations, and are in the process of developing the worlds first conversational robot for the healthcare sector.

Get in touch if you have experience in several of the following:


Cloud Technologies – AWS (preferred), Azure or GCP
CI/CD Tools – Kubernetes, Docker
GPU Scaling
Strong knowledge and understanding of Python
Machine Learning
Natural Language Processing

Offering a salary between £60 – 70k, and hybrid or remote working, depending on location.

For more information about Shift F5 and the opportunities we have to offer follow us on Twitter @F5_Jobs

Shift F5 Ltd is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy. We are TravelPerk: a scaling unicorn valued at $1.3billion that has raised over $400m since our creation in 2015.Backed by world-class investors with portfolios including AirBnb, Stripe, Slack, Trello, Gusto, Twitter, Farfetch and Deliveroo, our team is made up of A-players from across the travel and technology industries.Over the past few years, we've been named the fastest-growing SaaS startup in the world by SaaS1000 and featured as one of the hottest startups to watch by both Forbes and Wired. We're revolutionizing the B2B corporate travel market—worth over $1.3 trillion— to connect people in real life in an enjoyable and sustainable way.TravelPerk are innovators. During the last year we have welcomed and acquired the likes of Click Travel, NexTravel and Albatross to the team. From TravelCare, to FlexiPerk and of course GreenPerk we are shaping the future of the industry. Our team continues to emerge stronger and stronger as we adjust to the new normal—and that's where you come in!

If you're ready to take off with us, keep reading!

We are looking for DevOps Engineers that will contribute to the design, development and maintenance of our production and development infrastructure including all our deployment pipelines. As part of your role it will be crucial to ensure that the company has the required tooling to deploy, monitor, maintain and control the usage of the platform infrastructure and to ensure the security and safety of our applications and data.

In this role, you should have a keen eye for detail and excellent automation skills. If you are also competent in monitoring and are passionate about quality, we'd like to meet you.

You will work on a day-to-day basis with our product team to design, architect and implement our product. TravelPerk is a next-generation platform to take the pain out of booking and managing business travel.

As DevOps Engineer you will:

Manage the current platform infrastructure
Manage the current code deployment pipelines
Ensure the safety and security of all our infrastructure and data
Maintain all the cloud tools used on the production infrastructure
Support product squads with the relevant knowledge about the infrastructure evolution and needs
Recommend ways to improve the current setup

Required skills and experience:

3+ years of relevant experience as a Software Engineer or similar role working with large-scale infrastructure systems
Relevant knowledge related to cloud virtualization platforms such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud
Relevant knowledge with regards to containerization technologies such as Docker or Kubernetes
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, in English
Excellent scripting and automation skills
Knowledge/Understanding of:
Scripting (Python, Ansible, Bash, Linux, etc.)
AWS
Docker
CircleCi, Codeship, Fastlane, BitRise or similar technologies

What do we offer?

Competitive compensation including equity in the company
Generous vacation days so you can rest and recharge
Health perks such as private healthcare or gym allowance depending on your location
"Flexible compensation plan" to help you diversify and increase the net salary
Flexibility to work from home most of the time with core hours
Unforgettable TravelPerk events including to travel to one of our hubs
Udemy for business account to continue your development
Mental health support tool for your wellbeing
Exponential growth opportunities

Flexible Work Policy

You will need to be based in one of our hub countries, some positions are only open in specific locations
We will require you to travel to the office hub in your country once or twice per week depending on your position
In addition, every quarter you will be required to travel to an office hub location for up to 5 days to meet with your whole team
We have flexible working hours to fit around your life
Team members that want to go to the office more are welcome to!

For certain positions we can help with relocation from anywhere in the world, please let us know in your applications and we will assess whether this is possible. English is the official language at the office. Please submit your resume in English if you choose to apply.

*Outside IR35* AWS DevOps Engineer – FTSE 10 – Oil & Gas – 12 Month Contract – London – Fully Remote

Overview:
My client, a FTSE 10 Oil & Gas organisation are looking for a highly experienced AWS DevOps Engineer to join their growing team using modern engineering practices to rapidly deliver integrated physical and digital renewable energy based solutions.

Essential Skills & Experience:
Strong AWS experience – including services, multi-account management, best practicesStrong Terraform experience including writing modules and managementStrong Kubernetes experience, especially EKS in production and surrounding ecosystem of toolsStrong Security experience in production and cloud environments, security hardeningStrong IAM & full-stack Defensive Security skills are an absolute minimumStrong Networking experience, especially non-trivial VPC, Load Balancers, Ingresses etcStrong CI/CD experience building and maintaining production pipelines, ideally GitHub Actions, but some credit will be given for non-trivial Jenkins/GitLab or similarStrong Docker Containerization experience and surrounding ecosystem of toolsGood coding skills in Bash and at least 1 other programming language, preferably Python
GitHub experience.

Desired Skills:

Strong Python coding and experience of surrounding ecosystem of tools
Strong Azure experience
Strong Azure Active Directory experience in production, including SSO integrationsSignificant Projects and Migration experience
Strong Monitoring & Observability experience
Contribute ideas for improvements across the whole tech stack

Package:
£600 – £650 a day12 month initial contractFully remote

United Kingdom
Information Technology (IT)
Group Functions
Job Reference #
260804BR
City
London
Job Type
Full Time
Your role
Do you want to play a vital part in the design of our current and future banking technology? Do you have proven ability to design, support and Integrate complex platforms and applications?


We’re looking for an Tech DevOps Engineer to:

design IaaC aligned to business and IT requirements, transferring business problems into technical solutions on Azure.work with other technical teams to harmonize requirements, ensuring the end solution is fit for purposeguide implementation teams to successful delivery of cloud based infrastructure.make sure technical solutions are integrated into our heterogeneous and highly automated infrastructure on-prem and on cloud.collaborate on problem analysis, proof-of-concepts, pilots, and quality and controlpartner with the various teams/functions to enable and drive deployment of the chosen solutions for the full life cycle
Your team
You’ll be working in the Group Treasury Technology’s infrastructure team based in our Krakow Office. Our team makes sure that we get the most out of our technology investment by collaborating with colleagues, delivering on infrastructure projects and outlining the technical roadmap using our combined knowledge. As a Tech DevOps Engineer, you’ll play an important role in making sure we achieve both business and technology objectives.
Your expertise
ideally worked as an IT/Infra architect or engineering background for several years.proven delivery of cloud based infrastructure solutions
Successful management of complex and diverse tasks, while meeting key objectives and timelinesthorough understanding of SOA Architecturebachelor’s, master’s degree or equivalent (technical school) in IT Related fieldgood knowledge of infrastructure related technologies, such as Server H/W, Networks, DBs, O/S and Cloud.
About us
UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.

With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?
How we hire
This role requires an assessment on application. Learn more about how we hire: www.ubs.com/global/en/careers/experienced-professionals.html
Join us
At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.

From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?
Disclaimer / Policy Statements
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce. United Kingdom

About the role: To Support and maintain the development pipeline infrastructure and services
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in a Computer Science related subject (minimum)
Previous 2-3 years’ experience as a DevOps Engineer (minimum)
Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
Process-oriented with great documentation skills
Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in a mission critical and high availability environment (99.99% uptime)
Experience administering and deploying development CI/CD tools such as Docker, Jira, GitLab, data virtualization or Jenkins
Previous experience of working with AWS
Significant experience with Windows and Linux operating system environments
Experience with infrastructure scripting solutions such as PowerShell or Python
Experience with or knowledge of Lean methodologie s i.e. Kanban (desirable)
Knowledge of ITIL best practices
Confident English language skills
Main duties:
Building and setting up new development tools and infrastructure
Working on ways to automate and improve development and release processes
Participates in architecture and software development activities.
Translates loosely defined requirements into solutions.
Uses coding languages or scripting methodologies to solve a problem with a custom workflow.
Collaborates with others on the project to brainstorm about the best way to tackle a complex technological infrastructure, security, or development problem.
Performs incremental testing actions alongside testing team on code, processes, and deployments to identify ways to streamline execution and minimize errors encountered. About the role: To Support and maintain the development pipeline infrastructure and services

Bachelor’s Degree in a Computer Science related subject (minimum)
Previous 2-3 years’ experience as a DevOps Engineer (minimum)
Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
Process-oriented with great documentation skills
Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in a mission critical and high availability environment (99.99% uptime)
Experience administering and deploying development CI/CD tools such as Docker, Jira, GitLab, data virtualization or Jenkins
Previous experience of working with AWS
Significant experience with Windows and Linux operating system environments
Experience with infrastructure scripting solutions such as PowerShell or Python
Experience with or knowledge of Lean methodologie s i.e. Kanban (desirable)
Knowledge of ITIL best practices
Confident English language skills
Main duties:
Building and setting up new development tools and infrastructure
Working on ways to automate and improve development and release processes
Participates in architecture and software development activities.
Translates loosely defined requirements into solutions.
Uses coding languages or scripting methodologies to solve a problem with a custom workflow.
Collaborates with others on the project to brainstorm about the best way to tackle a complex technological infrastructure, security, or development problem.
Performs incremental testing actions alongside testing team on code, processes, and deployments to identify ways to streamline execution and minimize errors encountered. They must have knowledge of provisioning VMs using Terraform and managing them using Ansible. They should also adhere to Infrastructure as Code and be diligent in writing documentation for the team and the users (developers).

Introduction
Are you an out-of-the-box and forward-thinker? At the IBM Client Innovation Centre we are always looking for DevOps superstars to work on multiple exciting projects, in a friendly and energetic working environment. If this is you, and you're eager to learn, whether you have 1 or 20 years of experience, we'd love to hear from you!

Your Role and Responsibilities
As a DevOps Engineer, you will lead IBM into the future by translating system requirements into the design and development of customized systems in an agile environment. The success of IBM is in your hands as you transform vital business needs into code and drive innovation. Your work will power IBM and its clients globally, collaborating and integrating code into enterprise systems. You will have access to the latest education, tools and technology, and a limitless career path with the world’s technology leader. Come to IBM and make a global impact!
Participating in various customer projects from new infrastructure builds and migrations to audits and big data
Implementing configuration management infrastructure
Giving workshops and design recommendations to a technical team
Trusted advisor role for high profile enterprise businesses
Following customer projects from start to release

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Hands-on experience with Cloud Architecture Design and/or Cloud Architectural Patterns for Development
Advanced knowledge of Azure platform
Solid engineering/technical background/hands-on experience with conceptualizing strategizing and architecting cloud solutions
Windows and/or Linux sys op background
Previous experience in the design and delivery of systems based on IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS offerings, as well as exposure to different architecture models
DevOps skills for leading team and consulting the customer
Experience with building CI/CD pipelines
Knowledge of security network virtualization, load balancer, storage and database
Container technologies experience (e.g. Kubernetes, OpenShift)

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Hands-on experience with IaC for managing the cloud
Coding/scripting skills (Bash, Python, Powershell or similar)
Social skills and a customer service attitude are a must
As an equal opportunities’ employer, we welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds. However, for you to be eligible for this role, you must have the valid right to work in the UK for at least a 2-year period prior to applying. For certain projects, all applicants must be British nationals with 5 years of unbroken residency, ideally 10 years.
Unfortunately, we do not offer visa sponsorship and have no future plans to do so.

About Business Unit
The Client Innovation Centre (CIC) is an innovative and exciting part of IBM. A fast-paced and dynamic business built to deliver high-value technical services to world renowned clients. All of our employees work in a consultancy environment on a variety of exciting projects across a range of sectors. Every project has its own unique working environment - this enables our employees to build their experience, skillset and network. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems?

Your Life @ IBM
Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.


At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement
IBM wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you this might mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern, please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. Introduction

About Talogy
We are Talogy. The talent management experts. We craft solutions that screen, select, develop, and engage talent worldwide. By uniting the leading psychologists, data scientists, developers, and HR consultants we bring the power of psychology and technology together so you can make the best data-driven people decisions. With more than 30 million assessments delivered each year in more than 50 languages, we help clients discover organizational brilliance.
Learn more about what we do at: talogy.com
Life at Talogy
We walk our talk, and passion fuels what we do.
We are technology nerds and people people, who are energized by innovation and collaboration — winning together as a team of 650+ colleagues by uniting the leading talent experts across the globe.
Our mission is to help people meet their potential. In striving for this mission, we are daring, go the extra mile, take ownership, and expect a lot from each other.
But most of all, we care deeply — about our customers, and about each other.
At Talogy, we are humble masters, flexible experts, and human scientists.
About the Role
The operation and support of our cloud-based infrastructure and the ability to deploy new software features, bug fixes, close security vulnerabilities and deploy infrastructure updates is important to meet customer expectations, contractual obligations and maintain a competitive advantage.
Role Responsibilities
The DevOps Engineer is primarily responsible for:
Supporting our existing infrastructure, deployed across multiple regions.
Administering and troubleshooting the cloud environment.
Proactively identify improvements and recommend solutions.
Extending and enhancing our automated DevOps environments.
Implementing best practices for ensuring continued availability and security.
Staying ahead of issues with proactive monitoring and alerting.
Providing out of hours support and deploying software and server updates.
Knowledge, Skills and Experience Requirements
This opportunity is ideal for a determined and proactive individual who is willing to develop their skills in a variety of technical disciplines. This role requires an analytical thinker who pays significant attention to detail in their work.
The DevOps Engineer will be a knowledgeable Azure administrator with experience of automation tools. They will be responsible for the operation and support of our cloud-based infrastructure and the maintenance and development of the continuous delivery tools that support our DevOps frameworks.
Degree or equivalent in a computer science or related field.
Strong experience in a Windows server administration, DevOps engineering or infrastructure engineering role.
Comfortable with an Infrastructure as Code mindset and a desire to automate.
Consensus building through teamwork and collaboration; we need people who aren't afraid to share their ideas and want ideas and feedback from their team in return.
High degree of intellectual curiosity; constantly think about how we can improve our process and produce excellent high-quality solutions for our customers.
Attention to detail and a willingness to hold yourself and your team accountable for delivering them.
Azure certification is a plus.
Familiarity with DevOps tools such as:
Source control (Git / GitHub).
CI/CD tools, e.g. Azure DevOps.
Infrastructure as code frameworks, e.g. Terraform (essential).
Scripting and programming languages, e.g. PowerShell, Python.
Monitoring and APM tools, e.g. Azure Application Insights, Site24x7.
Containerization - Kubernetes, Azure AKS.
Experience with Windows server administration and networking.
Knowledge of SQL databases, e.g. MS SQL Server.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
Comfortable working with staff at all levels.
Ability to self-organise, solve problems, prioritise and track tasks.
Can work on their own or in a team.
The successful candidate will be required to gain counter terrorism clearance (CTC).
Benefits
Talogy offers a variety of competitive workplace benefits, including financial planning support, time off benefits, employee assistance programs, medical cover and participation rewards. We have a vibrant social culture, and we provide opportunities for employees to engage in volunteering and charity activities.
Education
Required

Source control (Git / GitHub).
CI/CD tools, e.g. Azure DevOps.
Infrastructure as code frameworks, e.g. Terraform (essential).
Scripting and programming languages, e.g. PowerShell, Python.
Monitoring and APM tools, e.g. Azure Application Insights, Site24x7.
Containerization - Kubernetes, Azure AKS.
Experience with Windows server administration and networking.
Knowledge of SQL databases, e.g. MS SQL Server.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
Comfortable working with staff at all levels.
Ability to self-organise, solve problems, prioritise and track tasks.
Can work on their own or in a team.
The successful candidate will be required to gain counter terrorism clearance (CTC).
Benefits
Talogy offers a variety of competitive workplace benefits, including financial planning support, time off benefits, employee assistance programs, medical cover and participation rewards. We have a vibrant social culture, and we provide opportunities for employees to engage in volunteering and charity activities.
Education
Required
Bachelor of Science or better in Computer Science or related field About Talogy
We are Talogy. The talent management experts. We craft solutions that screen, select, develop, and engage talent worldwide. By uniting the leading psychologists, data scientists, developers, and HR consultants we bring the power of psychology and technology together so you can make the best data-driven people decisions. With more than 30 million assessments delivered each year in more than 50 languages, we help clients discover organizational brilliance.
Learn more about what we do at: talogy.com
Life at Talogy
We walk our talk, and passion fuels what we do.
We are technology nerds and people people, who are energized by innovation and collaboration — winning together as a team of 650+ colleagues by uniting the leading talent experts across the globe.
Our mission is to help people meet their potential. In striving for this mission, we are daring, go the extra mile, take ownership, and expect a lot from each other.
But most of all, we care deeply — about our customers, and about each other.
At Talogy, we are humble masters, flexible experts, and human scientists.
About the Role
The operation and support of our cloud-based infrastructure and the ability to deploy new software features, bug fixes, close security vulnerabilities and deploy infrastructure updates is important to meet customer expectations, contractual obligations and maintain a competitive advantage.
Role Responsibilities
The DevOps Engineer is primarily responsible for:
Supporting our existing infrastructure, deployed across multiple regions.
Administering and troubleshooting the cloud environment.
Proactively identify improvements and recommend solutions.
Extending and enhancing our automated DevOps environments.
Implementing best practices for ensuring continued availability and security.
Staying ahead of issues with proactive monitoring and alerting.
Providing out of hours support and deploying software and server updates.
Knowledge, Skills and Experience Requirements
This opportunity is ideal for a determined and proactive individual who is willing to develop their skills in a variety of technical disciplines. This role requires an analytical thinker who pays significant attention to detail in their work.
The DevOps Engineer will be a knowledgeable Azure administrator with experience of automation tools. They will be responsible for the operation and support of our cloud-based infrastructure and the maintenance and development of the continuous delivery tools that support our DevOps frameworks.
Degree or equivalent in a computer science or related field.
Strong experience in a Windows server administration, DevOps engineering or infrastructure engineering role.
Comfortable with an Infrastructure as Code mindset and a desire to automate.
Consensus building through teamwork and collaboration; we need people who aren't afraid to share their ideas and want ideas and feedback from their team in return.
High degree of intellectual curiosity; constantly think about how we can improve our process and produce excellent high-quality solutions for our customers.
Attention to detail and a willingness to hold yourself and your team accountable for delivering them.
Azure certification is a plus.
Familiarity with DevOps tools such as:
Source control (Git / GitHub).
CI/CD tools, e.g. Azure DevOps.
Infrastructure as code frameworks, e.g. Terraform (essential).
Scripting and programming languages, e.g. PowerShell, Python.
Monitoring and APM tools, e.g. Azure Application Insights, Site24x7.
Containerization - Kubernetes, Azure AKS.
Experience with Windows server administration and networking.
Knowledge of SQL databases, e.g. MS SQL Server.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
Comfortable working with staff at all levels.
Ability to self-organise, solve problems, prioritise and track tasks.
Can work on their own or in a team.
The successful candidate will be required to gain counter terrorism clearance (CTC).

Finastra are one of the world’s largest FinTech organisations, headquartered in London, with offices across the UK and globally - currently going through an exciting growth period!We're looking for a DevOps Engineer to join us here on a permanent basis.DevOps Engineer Role description:We are looking for an exceptional DevOps Engineer to join our team embarking on a journey to Cloud Native, from both a VM approach and Docker containers using public cloud services such as AKS. This will involve assisting with the design and development of mission critical financial messaging systems. Producing high level systems architectures for cloud, local Data Centre and fully on prem solutions.You will also be assisting with the day to day running of existing development infrastructure including Jenkins, Artifactory, SVN, and Gitlab amongst others. Security consciousness is of course vital in all operations in our industry, and this will be a key requirement for the role. We work in an enterprise Agile environment with everyone playing an active role. There will also be opportunities to expand this role out across from development/QA into the wider team to ensure optimal management of services across the business unit.What will work well with our team?We take a pragmatic approach to our work in an environment that blends fun with professionalismAmenable character with good positive attitude and innovative mind-setComfortable working under pressure to firm deadlines in an agile and lean wayWorking with Scrum in a multiple scrum team environmentPassion to produce great quality software and a great service for our customersUnderstanding of FinTech environment/software productsDevOps Engineer Skills:Experience in delivering cloud based solutions with Docker containers ideally on Azure using AKS and/or using Kubernetes on prem.Artifactory/Jenkins administration, CI/CD, Build PipelinesExperience of Containers and Container orchestration (Docker/Kubernetes)Good understanding of supporting services (for instance logging and monitoring) in a microservices environment and concepts such as Service Chassis/Service MeshNice to have:Experience in API design/development using REST and HATEOS principles, following OpenAPI specificationsMicroservices development and design using Spring Boot or equivalent frameworkAt least basic database knowledge of Oracle/Postgres or equivalent (INGRES a bonus) – SQL.NOSQL SOLR/Lucene indexing, Big Data solutions, Analytics - Job Overview
A high-growth Digital Asset Exchange scale that has recently been acquired by one of the major players in the space is looking for a strong cloud engineer with strong site reliability skills to join the its fully remote UK team. This business has an outstanding culture and deep experience working in a remote environment. If you are looking to join a business where you can make a massive impact on an ever-growing industry this could be for you.
Job Description
The Role

As a Cloud Engineer for this high-growth crypto exchange scale up you will play a key role in building out a modern financial institution.

You will –

Be a technical leader within cloud engineering
Own the microservices that power this businesses core application.
You will own individual parts of the stack
Improve the productivity and experience of the developers in the team.
Build and operate integrations between the core platform and third party Vendors.

About you –

As a senior cloud engineer for this crypto asset exchange you will have a variety of skills that will enable you to succeed in this role. Don’t worry if you haven’t got all of these skills please still apply!

Experience with productionising systems on a public cloud. This business uses GCP but it open to seeing people from other backgrounds
Experience with Terraform
Experience in programming languages such as Go Python Javascript.
Kubernetes or GKE
Contact Details
Please email jake.kings@propellondon.com Job Overview

Cloud Engineer (AWS or Azure)

Manchester

Option for remote work


Salary to £60,000 plus benefits


Cloud Engineer required by this genuinely sustainable global business (50+ countries, 10,000+ employees).

Reuse, sustainability, and shared success are at the core of this organisation’s offerings and why so many household names trust them. Their solutions, and the technology that drives them, seek to disrupt tradition and deliver a new way of operating.

Further growth in the business and increased digitalisation across the organisation means they are now looking for an additional Cloud Engineer to join their team.

If you have some of the following, then this could be the role for you:

c. 3 years experience with Kubernetes, Docker and Jenkins.

Cloud computing models and design patterns, including Serverless concepts, Platform as a Service, Kubernetes (services and cluster management), Infrastructure as a Service.

Security principles and best practices for public cloud.

Networking knowledge for private-public cloud setups in Azure or AWS.

Automating and/or scripting the creation of cloud assets.

Atlassian Tools, DevOps, Application Architecture, AWS Cloud Computing, AWS Fargate, Infrastructure as Code and Infrastructure Automation (or similar).

Agile principles with a strong focus on Scrum framework and the principles of Kanban and Flow.

In the role, you will be working with a good level of autonomy, but support and training are available from the wider EMEA team. You will also be working closely with the wider Software Development teams and Security teams.

If you want an opportunity in an organisation that will offer you career opportunities into the future, either in Cloud Engineering or elsewhere, then this is worth considering.


For more information on this role, or to apply, please follow the “I’m Interested” link or contact Ben Halfpenny at Talenting Career Science directly. Cloud Engineer (AWS or Azure)

Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
Lead DevOps Engineer
OVERVIEW

BillPay Services looking for role of Lead DevOps Engineer to drive the DevOps transformation with Business Operations at Mastercard with a vision of getting to the better world. Business Operations at Mastercard leading the transformation through industry standard tooling and governing the product development life cycle to meet BizOps Golden Standards. We need some great minds with appetite to change, reduce the toils with automation and be the production readiness steward for the platform.

Relentlessly focus on automating anything and everything to weed out labour intensive processes.Shift left to be more proactive and involve upfront in the design & development process to deliver production ready products.Ensure the system is highly available with proactive monitoring and self-healing capabilities.Proactively manage production and change activities to maximize customer experience, and increase the overall value of supported applicationsManaging, mitigating, or elevating awareness of the business risk of all customer interactions with Mastercard’s technology platformsCentralizing points of interaction for both internal and external partners by communicating effectively with all key stakeholdersAlign Product and Customer Focused priorities with Operational needs
RESPONSIBILITIES

Orchestrate the build and deployment of a container environment, create and maintain virtualization automation, CI and CD pipelines.Responsible for coordinating with one or more groups to ensure platform goals are met.Develops plans to improve quality on a group of applications of a platform.Ensures platform integration procedures works seamlessly with other related systems within Mastercard.Implement industry standard tools and new methodologies to improve the functioning of Business Operations.Promote Business Operations best practices and create sustainable support model.Identifying and communicating risks proactively that can prevent incidents for all lines of business.
TECHNICAL EXPERTISE and EXPERIENCE

Continuous Integration, Delivery and Deployment Techniques using industry standard automation and orchestration tools.Cloud architecture and design, implementations and support (Azure, AWS or Google)Working experience with build, orchestration and deployment of a container environment (Kubernetes/Docker)Expertise in coding (Python/Java) & scripting (Bash)Working experience of Ancillary pipeline tools like Jenkins, Nexus/Artifactory, SonarQubeWorking knowledge of the Atlassian Suite – Bitbucket, Jira, ConfluenceExpertise in DevOps tools like Ansible, Chef or PuppetExperience in application development lifecycles and how it integrates with operations.Experience of Infrastructure as Code automation
COVID-19 Considerations
We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together. In many locations, which may change over time, we’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by video or phone. In addition, in some locations, only individuals who have been fully vaccinated will be permitted inside Mastercard offices until further notice.
In the US, Mastercard is a government contractor, which may legally require most Mastercard employees to be vaccinated unless a verified approved medical or religious exemption is granted. Further, we are currently making every effort towards having employees return to work in the office 2 days per week, if that makes sense for their team. Everyone must be vaccinated to enter Mastercard offices at this time. Therefore, we expect all candidates to be vaccinated or to be approved for a medical or religious accommodation prior to commencing work at Mastercard.
Corporate Security Responsibility
All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines. Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.

In many locations, which may change over time, we’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by video or phone. In addition, in some locations, only individuals who have been fully vaccinated will be permitted inside Mastercard offices until further notice.  
In the US, Mastercard is a government contractor, which may legally require most Mastercard employees to be vaccinated unless a verified approved medical or religious exemption is granted. Further, we are currently making every effort towards having employees return to work in the office 2 days per week, if that makes sense for their team. Everyone must be vaccinated to enter Mastercard offices at this time. Therefore, we expect all candidates to be vaccinated or to be approved for a medical or religious accommodation prior to commencing work at Mastercard.  
Corporate Security Responsibility
All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must: Show more

Giving the world more time.
For the first time in human history we have the technology, data, and insights to redefine health. Together with our partners, we will make the leap from reactive to proactive medicine. By collectively benefiting from the data we individually generate, we can all live our longest, fullest lives. Huma partners with scientists, technologists, healthcare, and life sciences professionals to understand, treat, and ultimately prevent ill health. Giving knowledge and power to those with medical conditions, while saving clinicians time, energy, and valuable resources.

This is a hybrid position based in London, members of the engineering team are required to be in the office on Wednesdays and Fridays.
Your mission
Work in close collaboration with Developers, Product Owners technical teams and third-party suppliers to ensure effective, positive testing outcomes
Implement DevOps technologies and processes, e.g. containerisation, CI/CD, infrastructure as code, metrics, monitoring etc
Design, implement & maintain infrastructure systems
Be part of the on-call and out-of-hours rotation when necessary
From day one in this role, we’ll expect you to have
Expertise in one or more of cloud platforms such as GCP, AWS, Azure
Strong experience in deploying and managing kubernetes platforms through automation
Experience with infrastructure as code (IaC)
Strong experience with one or more scripting languages such as Terraform (preferred), cloudfront/ARM templates
Experience with enterprise applications, and CI/CD pipelines to automate the deployments
Experience with monitoring systems such as Grafana and Loki
Solid understanding of infrastructure systems, cloud security practices
It’s great, but not required, if you have
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent
Experience with Python or GoLang
You will thrive at Huma if you are
Resilient - show adaptability, be a pro-juggler and have the ability to move fast
Ambitious and driven - the ability to focus your energy where it matters the most
A self-solver - you are resourceful and seek solutions through collaboration
A strong communicator - you practice open and clear dialogue, while listening with fairness
Detail oriented - working with people’s health means we obsess over every detail and make sure we get it right
What we can offer you
Progressive private health insurance with AXA Health
EAP scheme and gym membership discount with AXA
AIG Life & income protection scheme
Generous share options - every employee is an owner
25 days paid vacation + UK bank holidays
Home office allowance to support home working
Bike2Work scheme
Season ticket loan
Family first culture - giving the flexibility you need
Growth & development opportunities
Come join us!
We believe magic happens when you bring together diverse ideas, experiences, and styles. We want to create a world where people live longer, fuller lives, and to do that well we need a team that represents all of the people and communities who use our solutions. We aspire to create an environment where everyone has the opportunity to do their best work. We are always looking for ways to improve so if you have any suggestions, please get in touch.
Huma is committed to ensuring the safety of all current and prospective global employees during the ongoing COVID-19 Pandemic. We’ve developed technology-enabled recruitment and on-boarding processes, all Huma people have been provided with a home office allowance and we’ve developed a progressive communications model. We will continue to adapt as we work together in this new world of distributed working.
Dear recruitment agency friends: Huma attracts an amazing number of direct candidates and we do not need any help at this stage, so please do not send us unsolicited agency resumes. This is not a great use of your time, and we will not accept any liability or fees for any resumes or candidates which we have not asked you to find for us. Giving the world more time.

The job of a Save the Children UK's DevOps Engineer is varied and busy.


Are you a strong DevOps Engineer?


Are you passionate about web, open source development and for helping organisations to build a quality best of breed digital presence?


Are you motivated by our vision of creating a world where every child doesn't just survive but thrives and can go on to change the world – and of inspiring and leading others to do the same?


If the answers to these questions are yes, we would love to hear from you!

Note:
To avoid disappointment, you are advised to submit your application as soon as possible as we reserve the right to close the vacancy early if a high volume of applications are received. This is to ensure that we can manage application levels whilst maintaining a positive candidate experience. Unfortunately once a vacancy has closed, we are unable to consider further applications.


About Us

Save the Children UK believes every child deserves a future. In the UK and around the world, we work every day to give children a healthy start in life, the opportunity to learn and protection from harm. When crisis strikes, and children are most vulnerable, we are always among the first to respond and the last to leave. We ensure children's unique needs are met and their voices are heard. We deliver lasting results for millions of children, including those hardest to reach.


Job Purpose

Reporting directly to the Senior Network Support Engineer, you will be part of a small team whose primary functions will be to enable, accelerate and support the developers and testers working on a US/UK multi-tenancy Adobe AEM platform.

This will include supporting on AWS and GCP as well as implementing new Cloud solutions such as Azure where necessary

As a rights-based organisation, we are committed to anti-racism and actively opposed systemic oppression of any form. You will support our commitment to celebrate diversity, challenge inequality, and build an inclusive environment for every one of our employees so we can better represent the children we protect.


Main Accountabilities
The DevOps Engineer's key duties will be to:

Provide System Admin support to Save the Children UK with a particular focus on system performance and tuning and supporting User Acceptance testing of its AEM platform.


Managing, maintaining and patching our cloud infrastructure and availability of services through container-orchestration.


Ensure that sufficient documentation is in place for all hardware systems in the Integration and Staging environments to enable existing and new team members to support Save the Children UK infrastructure.


Ensure the effective and efficient use of all Save the Children resources in order to keep costs low and ensure safety in the workplace. Pro-actively pursue opportunities continuously to reduce costs and increase efficiency of the server support function.


Ensure a globally robust and highly scalable approach to development to support our growing number of global users and services.


Work alongside other members of the infrastructure team to ensure that all cloud systems and support are aligned with technical and business requirements.


Manage the provisioning/building/configuring/maintenance of environments using automation where possible


Keep abreast of new developments in the provisioning / configuration / deployment / monitoring of environments to help shape our DevOps roadmap


Other duties as required in line with skills, experience and role.


Person Profile
You must have good hands-on knowledge and experience in all of the areas below:


Cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure and OpenStack or similar)
Containerisation Software (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes or similar)
Source Control tools (e.g. Git, GitHub or Bitbucket or similar)
System administration tools (e.g. Red Hat, Debian or similar)
Scripting (e.g. Bash or similar) and using Command-Line Interfaces (CLI)


You must have abilities in all of the areas below:


Ability to work in a team, in a fast-paced environment
Independent and able to put forward new ideas, innovate and drive the team forward.
Strong attention to detail, astute diagnostic skills
Ability to solve issues with clear methods while knowing when to take intuitive leaps
Strategic and forward planning thought process
Able to guide technical discussions with both technical and non-technical audiences
A passion for web, open source development and for helping Save the Children to continue to build a quality best of breed digital presence.


Aptitude

A demonstrable commitment to the principles of diversity and inclusion and their practical application and integration in the work environment


A commitment to Save the Children UK's aims and core values of accountability, ambition, collaboration, creativity, and integrity


Save the Children UK is committed to diversity and equality of opportunity in all aspects of our work both external and internal. We strive to be an inclusive employer and particularly encourage applications from under-represented groups such as returning parents or carers who are re-entering work after a career break, people who are LGBT+, from Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic backgrounds, with a disability, impairment, learning difference or long-term condition, with caring responsibilities, from different nations and regions, and from less advantaged socioeconomic backgrounds.

Remote Working:
The majority of SCUK employees are currently working remotely within the UK in line with UK Government guidance. Commencing July 2021 we will transition to flexible and hybrid ways of working (i.e. a mixture of remote/home and office-based working) as social distancing restrictions ease.

We are happy to discuss flexible working options at interview.


Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

Save the Children UK is committed to diversity and equality of opportunity in all aspects of our work both external and internal. We strive to be an inclusive employer and particularly encourage applications from under-represented groups such as returning parents or carers who are re-entering work after a career break, people who are LGBT+, from Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic backgrounds, with a disability, impairment, learning difference or long-term condition, with caring responsibilities, from different nations and regions, and from less advantaged socioeconomic backgrounds.

To see our full statement please visit this link: https://jobs.savethechildren.org.uk/our-policies/diversity/


Jobs are positioned within the salary structure on the basis of evaluation. New employees would normally be appointed at the bottom of the grade, however the appointed salary may also take into account the relevant experience a candidate brings to a role. Save the Children is committed to paying staff in a fair and equitable way and will benchmark all salary offers in line with the pay of existing staff.


Save the Children UK has a comprehensive benefits package. To see our full offer please visit this link: https://jobs.savethechildren.org.uk/what-we-offer/


Interview expenses: Candidates should note that unfortunately it is not our policy to reimburse expenses accrued when attending interviews at Save the Children UK unless you are requested to attend an interview in an alternative location to where the role is based.

Pre-employment Checks: Any Employment with Save the Children UK will be subject to the following checks prior to your start date:


a satisfactory police record check to include a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check and/or an International Criminal Record Check (If applicable)
receipt of satisfactory references
proof of eligibility to work in the national location for this role
Division:Transformation
Department:Technology
Team:Technical Operations
Location (Role):Hybrid (London & Remote)
Contract Type:Permanent Contract
Full / Part Time:Full-time
